loans.name: Alba Dina

texts.es: Alba tiene 49 años de edad, curso la primaria de forma completa y satisfactoria, casada y junto a su esposo vive con su único hijo involucrándose únicamente ellos como familia en las diferentes actividades en el campo, limpieza, aplicación de abono, quitar sombras entre otras. Su única fuente de ingresos y principal es el cultivo y siembra de café; pero elaboran trabajos como limpiezas en otras propiedades de café mientras la cosecha llega esto para la compra de insumos básicos para elaborar alimentos, aceite o manteca para cocinar, condimentos, entre otras cosas accesibles para el hogar. Ella solicita crédito para poder llevar a cabo la compra de abono, fertilizantes, pago de mano de obra y poder dar a su cafetal el mantenimiento necesario para que este al final de la cosecha de muy buenos resultados y pueda ir superando los diferentes obstáculos en su vida. Ella manifiesta que con este crédito mejorara la plantación porque así la misma estará cuidada, incrementa la cantidad del grano y las ganancias mejoraran ayudando esto a cumplir con los compromisos que tiene.
texts.en: Alba is 49 years old. She finished primary school satisfactorily. She is married and lives with her husband and her only son. As a family, they just work in different farming activities such as clearing, applying fertilizer, and more. Her main source of income is planting and growing coffee, but they also do work such as clearing on other coffee properties while they await their harvest in order to buy basic materials for making food, like oil or lard, seasonings, and more for the home. She is asking for the loan to be able to buy compost and fertilizer and to pay for labor to do necessary maintenance on her coffee crop to have great results in the harvest and be able to overcome obstacles in her life. She says that this loan will improve her farm because it will be better cared for, the quantity of the grain will increase, and the profits will improve, helping her to meet her commitments.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizer and to pay for labor to tend to her coffee crops.

loans.name: Ametauna Group

texts.es:
Adelaida es una mujer de 49 años de edad, casada, tiene 2 hijos varones de 16 y 20 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, paciente, de buen trato, responsable y trabajadora, su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona Sur de la ciudad un área caracterizada por las redes viales que conectan a la ciudad y por encontrarse uno de los 2 aeropuertos internacionales, los suelos de esta parte son predominantemente arenas, arenas finas y arenas limosas, de clima cálido subtropical donde los meses de mayor precipitación pluvial son enero y febrero con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 19-35 grados centígrados.
Adelaida es de tez trigueña, cabello rojizo, ojos pardos, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (sentada al centro, viste polera roja). Su vida la comparte con su esposo que trabaja en el comercio y con sus hijos que estudian y juegan futbol, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina, y cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. La necesidad por apoyar a sus hijos en el deporte la llevó a liderar una banca de personas con negocios como; electricista, venta de verduras, venta de ropa de segunda mano, venta de juguetes, venta de perfumes, atención de tienda de barrio y comercio de electrodomésticos, para solicitar un préstamo y ampliar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional, como; majao encapao (charque molido, plátanos hervidos y arroz), sopa de maní (sopa a base de maní), locotos rellenos (locotos, carne picada, cebollas, ajo, pimiento), Chicharrón de Taitetu (Chanchitos de monte “taitetú” frito), Cogote relleno (cuello de gallina criolla, relleno puede ser de papa y churiqui), y otros, labor que realiza en su domicilio en un cuarto con salida a la calle. “abrí mi restaurante con unas pocas mesas y sillas viejas que tenía guardadas, el negocio creció y necesito renovar el mobiliario para atender a más clientes…” comenta. Su sueño es tener un menú completo de comidas tradicionales, ella desea realizar la compra de mesas y sillas plásticas para atender a mayor número de clientes y aumentar sus ventas. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 7 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Adelaida solicita un préstamo para la compra de mesas y sillas plásticas para vender comida a más personas, aumentar sus ventas y apoyar a sus hijos en el deporte.
texts.en:
Adelaida is a 49 year old woman, She is married and has 2 sons, aged 16 and 20. Her business is selling traditional food. 

She is a good mother, enterprising, patient, kind, responsible and hardworking. She has her business in the southern part of the city, an area characterized by its roads and by its 2 international airports. The soil in this area is mainly fine sand. It has a warm, sub-tropical climate and the rainiest months are January and February, with a temperature that varies in the day between 19-35 degrees centigrade.
 
Adelaida has golden brown skin, reddish hair, brown eyes, short stature, and a robust figure. Her mother tongue is Guaraní, which she speaks in her family, and she speaks Spanish in the general culture and for her business. She is seated in the middle, wearing a red t-shirt. She shares her life with her husband, who works as a merchant, and with her sons, who study and play soccer. They live in their own home built of brick and cement with a corrugated roof. It has potable water, electricity and plumbing. The need to support her children in sports led to her leading a bank of people with businesses such as an electrician, selling vegetables, selling second hand clothing, selling toys, selling perfume, running a neighborhood store, and an appliances business. They did this to ask for a loan and expand their activities. Her business is selling traditional food, such as majao encapao (ground meat, boiled plantains, and rice), peanut soup, stuffed locotos (locotos, dices meat, onions, garlic and peppers), chicharrón de taitetu (fried wild “taitetú” pork), cogote relleno (creole chicken neck, the stuffing can be potatoes and churiqui), and more. She does this work in her house in a room that opens onto the street. “I opened my restaurant with a few old tables and chairs that I had stored away. The business grew and I need to renew the furniture to serve my customers," she remarks. Her dream is to have a menu full of traditional food. She wants to buy plastic tables and chairs to serve more customers and increase her sales. This is her first loan cycle with the institution during the 7 years she has done this activity.
 
For these reasons, Adelaida is asking for a loan to buy plastic tables and chairs to sell food to more people, increase her sales and support her sons in sports.

loans.use: to buy plastic tables and chairs to sell food to more people, increase her sales,and support her children in sports.

loans.name: Guayaibyty Group

texts.es:
El grupo Guayaibyty está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. También forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde cada una pone su mejor esfuerzo para poder dar a sus familias una mejor vida.
Una persona que se destaca es la Sra. Vilma, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, lo que quiere decir que está en una pobreza extrema. Ella se dedica a la cría y venta de cerdos, y con ello ayuda a su familia y a sus seres queridos para que tengan una vida digna y sin privaciones.
Vilma pide este préstamo para la compra de balanceados, vitaminas y minerales para que pueda seguir con la cría de sus cerdos. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de cada día ir creciendo.
texts.en:
The Guayaibyty group is in its first loan cycle in the women's committee program where they all work and help each other get ahead. They are also part of the poverty elimination program, where each one puts forth her best effort to be able to give her family a better life.

One person who stands out is Vilma who, in her last questionnaire, showed a poverty level within level one, which is to say that she is in extreme poverty. She works raising and selling pigs, and with it she helps her family and her loved ones so they have a decent live without deprivation.

Vilma asks for this loan to purchase balanced feed, vitamins, and minerals to be able to continue raising her pigs. She is grateful for the opportunity that she is getting to continue growing each day.

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed, vitamins and minerals for her pigs.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.es:
La Sra. Cynthia  tiene 37 años,  es separada, y tiene una hija de 14 años, por quien se está esforzando para poder sacarla adelante.
Cynthia tiene un local donde realiza servicio técnico de electrodomésticos con ciertas marcas del país. Es una señora muy trabajadora mediante a su trabajo puede ofrecerle una vida digna a su hija.
Solicitó el préstamo para la refacción de su local, lo cual le será de mucha ayuda para seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en:
Cynthia is 37 years old, separated, and has a daughter who is 14 years old, for whom she is working hard in order to get her ahead.

Cynthia has a retail space where she performs technical service on household appliances of certain brands in the country. She is a very hard-working woman who, through her work, can offer her daughter a decent life.

She asked for the loan to refurbish her retail space, which will be a great help for continuing with her work.

loans.use: to refurbish her retail space.

loans.name: Samnang

texts.en:
Samnang (photo here) is 60 years old, and lives at Posen Chey district Phnom Penh ,Cambodia. She had been married since 1978, has two sons and two daughters, and they are a policeman, a worker, a student, and the last one is disabled.

She has been a farmer for 20 years, while her husband has been in the army and has 10 years of experience. 

She would like to apply for a loan to purchase a motorcycle for her daughter to take to school.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her daughter to take to school.

loans.name: Eriberto

texts.en:
Eriberto is 55 years old, married and had two children. He and his wife are vegetable vendors. 

Eriberto wanted to improve their sales; that is why he is now asking for additional capital of P10,000 to buy vegetables, tomatoes and cabbages to sell. Selling more vegetables will help increase sales capacity and income as well.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, tomatoes and cabbages to sell

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is a food vendor from Padul. She is selling biscuits, beverages and drinks. Margarita patiently sells these items to gain profits for her family. 

She wanted to improve her sales, so she is now asking for a loan of P20,000 to buy more snacks to sell such as biscuits, breads, and juice drinks. This will help increase her revenues. 

She will kept additional profits for the family’s emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy more snacks to sell such as biscuits, breads, and juice drinks

loans.name: Limber

texts.es:
Limber es un hombre joven de 21 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 1 hijo varón de 3 años y 1 hija mujer de 4 meses, y su negocio es el transporte como taxi.
Él es buen padre, independiente, constante, emprendedor, trabajador y muy responsable. Su trabajo lo realiza en la localidad de ‘Sacaba’ caracterizado por su oferta de restaurantes de comida tradicional y por la elaboración de chicha (bebida fermentada de maíz), de clima templado similar al de la ciudad, durante el invierno la gama de temperaturas varía de 1 grado centígrados a 24 grados centígrados y durante la época de verano, la gama de temperaturas varía a partir de 10 grados centígrados a 19 grados centígrados con fuertes lluvias.
Limber es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro corto, ojos pardos, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el quechua que se habla en el lugar y habla español por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica a la venta de comida y con sus hijos ambas son bebes y se encuentran al cuidado de los padres, viven en una casa de ladrillo a medio construir con techo de calamina y cuentan con el servicio de energía eléctrica y recogen agua de pozo. Su negocio es el transporte libre como taxi; ya lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad por lo que es conocido en el lugar, cuenta con clientes rutinarios, como cocineras del mercado a las cuales transporta diariamente y también clientes casuales que transporta desde el mercado después de haber realizado sus compras cargadas de bolsas. “crecí sin agua en mi hogar, nunca nos faltó nada, pero mi sueño es darle una vida mejor a mis hijos…” comenta. Su sueño es ver concluida la construcción de su casa, él desea realizar la instalación de agua potable en su cocina, baño y lavandería para que su familia viva en mejores condiciones. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que trabaja en el transporte y construye su casa. 
Es por esos motivos que Limber solicita un préstamo para la conexión de agua potable en su cocina, lavandería y baño para brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Limber is a young man who lives with his partner. He is 21 and has a three-year-old son and a four-month-old daughter. He drives a taxi.

Limber is a good father, and an independent, persistent, entrepreneurial, hardworking and responsible person. He works in Sacaba, a municipality known for its restaurants and the traditional food they offer, and also because they produce “chicha”, a beverage made with fermented corn. It has mild weather, like the city [Cochabamba]. During wintertime, temperatures can range from 1 to 24 °C [34-75 °F]. During summertime, temperatures can range from 10 to 19 °C [50-66 °F] and it rains heavily. 

Limber has a dark complexion. He is short and thin, and has short dark hair and brown eyes. His mother tongue is Quechua, which is spoken by locals. He also speaks Spanish because of his profession. He shares his life with his partner, who sells food, and his children, who are still babies and depend on them. They live in an unfinished brick house with a metal roof, served with electricity. They take the water from a well.

Limber has a taxi. He has been working as a taxi driver for three years and is well-known locally. He has fixed clients, such as cooks from the marketplace, who use his services every day. He also transports occasional clients that need to bring their groceries home.

“There was no water at home when I grew up, but I did not lack anything. My dream is to be able to offer my children a more comfortable life,” he says. His dream is to finish building his house. He would like to install running water in the kitchen, bathroom and laundry room, in order to improve his family’s living conditions.

This is Limber’s first loan from the institution. He has been working and building his house for three years. This is why he is requesting a loan to install running water in the kitchen, bathroom, and laundry room, and improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to install running water in his kitchen, bathroom and laundry room.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of ten children, six of whom are in school, Belinda works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Belinda is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Belinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 39 years old and married. She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. 

Catherine is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Catherine has been in pig fattening for two years, and also earns additional income from a general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 56 years old with eight children. With one child in school, Rosario works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, shampoo, groceries, etc..

Rosario has been in this business for 15 years now. 

In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rowena is 40 years old, and has five children who are in school.

Rowena has a buy and sell dressed chicken business in the Philippines. Rowena requested a PHP 28,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy dressed chickens to sell.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Rowena has been in this business for 21 years. In the future, Rowena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional dressed chickens to sell.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 50,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes to sell. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes

loans.name: Khatuna

texts.en:
Khatuna is a 43-year-old married woman, from Tbilisi city. She has three family members, and her husband is a driver and her son is a baker at the local bakery. Khatuna couldn't find any stable job and started working as a sales lady at the local store. She generates a small income, and has a great desire somehow to increase her productivity. 

She requested a loan from local financial institutions, but was rejected several times, as the creditors didn't find enough income to be sufficient to approve the loan. The startup loan program envisages provisions for business startups and re-startup credits with soft conditions for the country's poor people, who are regarded as "high risk borrowers" because they have a low income and do not have access to credit products. 

With the received credit, Khatuna plans to purchase shares of the store where she works and will lead the business herself. She has already had loyal costumers among local people and passerby's as well, and has all the opportunity to make the business activity productive. 

This hard-working woman relies on the goodwill of Kiva lenders, and will highly appreciate your support and kindness, as her income will significantly increase and Khatuna will get the chance to make a better style of life for her family.

loans.use: To purchase shares of a general store and lead the business herself

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married  woman and she is blessed with one child who attends school. They live at their own house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Fatuma has operated a tailoring business, making women’s and gents suits for sale at home. She cites seasonality and stiff competition from other tailoring operators to be her major challenges. 

With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing tread for her business. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing tread for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in continuing to improve the infrastructure of his humble house.

loans.name: Limay

texts.en: Limay is 36 years old, married, and has two children. Her spouse is a farmer while she is in the direct-selling business. She sells soap and perfumes. She wants to improve her sales; that is why she is now asking for additional capital of P28,000 to buy cosmetics, perfumes, fabric conditioner and soap. She will allow credits on her merchandise but she makes sure to collect them before the due date so she can revolve her income in the business. She hopes to keep selling good products and help cover her family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, perfumes, fabric conditioner and soap to sell

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
Clara is 55 years old and married with nine children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Clara is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional livestock, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

Clara has been raising livestock for 6 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock, vitamins and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline, 40, is a housewife who practices small-scale dairy farming in Keera village in the Nyanza province of Kenya. Pauline is active when it comes to commercial activities. She is a pragmatic problem solver. Her distinguishing factor is that she adds a business angle to every cultural way of life. While her community keeps cattle and poultry for food, she does the same on a greater scale in order to sell the surplus. 

Pauline is seeking a loan to purchase a flock of hens. She will use the same technique she used to grow her dairy farm to grow her poultry farm. The flock of hens will lay eggs, half of which will be sold and the rest kept for hatching and family consumption. From the clutch of chicks, chick breeding will be conducted where female chicks will be kept, for they are destined to lay eggs for commercial purposes, while male chicks will be culled because they are more relevant to meat production. 

With your investment, Pauline will be able to improve her family's livelihood by contributing to the income they generate. She will use the money from the poultry farm to grow the business and pay for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is 48 years old and married with four children.  

Clarita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

Clarita has been raising pigs for six years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Clarita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Eva Group

texts.en:
Evangeline is the featured borrower of Eva group. She came together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua because they have always been friends since they left their hometown in the Philippines to come and work in Lebanon with a better income to support their beloved ones back in the Philippines.

Evangeline is a 52-year-old widowed mother of three children who is working hard as a housekeeper to cover the expenses and needs of her beloved family and improve their living conditions, thus she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her family members' school tuition fees.

Evangeline is the lady standing in the middle. With respect to the other group members, Valencia is the lady standing on the right, and Jaolaza is the lady on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to pay her family members' school tuition fees

loans.name: Mean

texts.en:
Mean is a 33-year-old married fish seller with two children, who lives in the Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. He has been in the selling business since 2003, making around USD 8 a day. His wife is a 31-year-old homemaker and his two children attend school. 

Mean would like to buy a motorcycle to carry fish to sell at the market, but he lacks the money, so he is requesting a loan. 

This loan will help him have better traveling and transportation conditions. 

In the future, he wants to transport fish to sell at the market in the city and support his two children in earning bachelor degrees.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to carry fish to sell at the market

loans.name: Veasna

texts.en:
Veasna (shown in photo) is 27years old , single, and lives with his family at Posen Chey district in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. Veasna has been a garment factory worker for two years. 

He is applying for a loan to purchase a motorcycle, since he doesn’t have the means to get to his work. He had gone worked by taxi. 

He wants to get a means of getting to work that is easier than a taxi.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to take to his work.

loans.name: Meg Anne

texts.en:
Meg Anne is from Talavera, Nueva Ecija. Her family earns an income from her father, who is an OFW.  Sometimes what her father earns is just enough for their basic needs, and they struggle for funds for her schooling. 

To help her in her studies, Meg Anne wants to avail an education loan of PHP100,000 from KIVA lenders, which she will use to pay for her tuition fee.

She is hopeful that lenders will approve her loan so she can finish her college education.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fee

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rufina is 46 years old now.

Rufina has a fishing business in the Philippines. Rufina requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed like fish nets and other materials.

Rufina has been in this business for two years. 

In the future, Rufina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed like fish nets and other materials needed

loans.name: Sinforiana

texts.es:
La Sra. Sinforiana tiene 52 años, es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos ambos ya mayores de edad cursando carreras universitarias, ella es comerciante independiente y a la vez funcionaria de una entidad pública.
Ella se dedica a las ventas de Ao Poi y joyas, es una mujer muy sacrificada que lucha por su familia, y por sus seres queridos, ya que ellos son su principal sostén.
El préstamo lo solicita para invertir en su negocio comprando telas, hilos y joyas para su posterior venta.
texts.en:
Sinforiana is 52 years old, and is a single mother to two children who are both grown-ups already and are studying at university. She is a self-employer trader and also works for a public company.

She makes a living selling traditional embroidered Paraguayan clothing and jewellery. She is a hard-working woman who fights for her family and loved ones, as they are her main support. 

She is requesting the loan to invest in her business by buying to buy fabric, thread and jewellery to sell on.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread and jewellery to sell on.

loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Antonio; está en su ciclo número  12 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. 
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Elsa, quien se dedica a la costura, ella sobresale en este grupo por su entusiasmo y su dedicación en cada actividad que hacen. Ella es una persona que quiere salir adelante para poder ayudar a su familia, es por eso que está poniendo todo de su para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
La Sra. Elsa solicita de este préstamo para la compra de tejidos, hilos, y todo tipo de insumos que ella necesita para cumplir con  sus clientes; lo que le ayudará a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos. Su sueño es aumentar su la cantidad de máquinas y trabajadores a su cargo, tener mayor variedad y calidad para poder mantener su clientela y ganar clientes nuevos.
texts.en:
The group called San Antonio is in its 12th cycle of the women's committee program. They all work hard and help each other to move forward and get ahead. 

One of the group's members is Elsa who makes a living from dressmaking. She stands out from the group for her enthusiasm and her dedication to every activity the group does. She is someone who wants to progress and be able to help her family and it is for this reason that she is trying so hard to improve their living conditions.   

Elsa is asking for this loan to buy fabric, thread and all other supplies that she needs to fulfil the demands of her clients. The loan will help her to settle on a business plan, which will in turn help improve her income. Her dream is to increase the number of machines and workers that she has and provide more variety and better quality in order to keep her established clientele and gain new clients.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread for dressmaking.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan sends you her thanks for your generosity, because her previous loan had greatly enriched her business. She was able to buy products and supplies which are needed in her business. The loan also helped her provide for their daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she could improve her business more if you will let her borrow again an amount of 40,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional grocery items, toiletries, and beverages which she sells. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family through the help of this assistance.

Susan wants for her business to prosper and that her children will be able to finish their studies. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies for his café, like tea and coffee.

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.en:
Zoraida is 45 years old, married, and has nine children. They are a happy family, and together with her husband, they are taking care of her children. 

She's been in a fishpond business for 20 years already; it is a successful earning business. 

She borrowed another loan from GDMPC of P 25,000 to buy fingerlings for her fishpond, and also feed for the fingerlings. 

Zoraida's future plan is to save money from her business so that she can sustain her business needs.

loans.use: to buy fingerlings for the fishpond and feed for the fingerlings.

loans.name: Ma. Jeanne

texts.en:
Ma. Jeanne is 46 years old and married with seven children, two of whom are in school. Ma. Jeanne works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy and sell charcoal in the Philippine,s and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell for her business.

Ma. Jeanne has been in this business for seven years.

In the future, Ma. Jeanne would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is 55 years old and single. 

Shirley is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Shirley requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy piglets and feed for her business.

Shirley has been in this business for four years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Shirley would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed for her business

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Elsa requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell to her customers.

She has been in this business for two years now.

Elsa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Kuña Marangatu Group

texts.es:
19 son las mujeres que integran este grupo, son mujeres jefas de familia, donde cada una quiere poder mejorar su vida a través del esfuerzo en conjunto. Ellas están en su ciclo uno del programa de comité de mujeres.
Monica, una de las integrantes, es modista, ella es una mujer muy sacrificada que se esfuerza cada día para poder dar a su familia todo lo que necesitan para una vida digna y sin privaciones. Es muy luchadora y emprendedora, comenta que a se hizo de mucha clientela que siempre le lleva muchos trabajo para poder hacer.
Monica pide este préstamo para poder comprar telas, hilos, gomas, botones y otros, y con ello poder seguir cumpliendo con el pedido de sus clientes y también ir mejorando sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Nineteen woman form part of this group. These women are the head of the family unit and want to improve their lives through group effort. This is their first cycle on the women's committee programme.

Monica, one of the members, is a dressmaker. She is a very hard-working woman who strives every day to give her family everything they need to lead dignified lives without hardship. She is a real fighter and very enterprising. She says that she already has many customers who order a lot of work from her.

Monica is requesting this loan to buy fabric, thread, glue, buttons and other items, so that she can continue to meet her customer's orders and increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, glue, buttons and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase used spare car parts

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 54 years old and married with six children. Teresita works very hard to provide for them.

Teresita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, groceries, etc.

Teresita has been in this business for 5 years now. 

In the future, Teresita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
Abdul is 46 years old and married with two kids. Abdul works as a construction worker, where he gets a low and unstable income. This income is barely enough to cover all the family's needs. 

By taking this loan, he wants to improve the family's living conditions and to pay his elder son's medical expenses. Abdul hopes that Kiva will be able to help him. Please support him.

loans.use: to pay his elder son's medical expenses.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
17 mujeres integran este grupo, son mujeres jefas de familia que quieren dar a sus seres queridos todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener. Ellas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, que les permitirá conocer la situación de vida de cada una y conforme a ello poder trabajar por mejorar.
La señora Felicia pide este préstamo par a la compra de ropas para poder venderlas y por medio de ese trabajo dar  a sus seres queridos todo lo que no pudo tener. Es una señora muy activa  capaz de valerse por sí misma. Manifiesta constantemente los valores de honestidad, responsabilidad y solidaridad.
texts.en:
Seventeen women form part of this group. These women are heads of household those want to give their loved ones all the things they never had. They are taking part in the poverty elimination programme, which will provide them with information on their living conditions and help them work to improve them.

Señora Felicia is requesting this loan to buy clothing to sell on, and through this work, provider her loved ones with all the things she missed out on. She is a very active woman who is able to stand on her own two feet. She always shows the values of honesty, responsibility and solidarity.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Sineat

texts.en:
Sineat is a 35-year-old married factory worker with two children, and she lives in a village in the province of Takeo province, Cambodia. For the past four years, she has worked in the factory. Her husband is a 32-year-old blacksmith; he makes knives to sell. One of her two children attends school. 

Both Sineat and her husband can make approximately $10.50 each day. 

She is requesting a loan because she wants to buy cows to fatten and breed for calves to sell. With the loan, she will be able to improve the family’s finances. For her future plans, she is going to help her husband to expand his business, build a new, proper house and help her children to earn higher education.

loans.use: to buy cows to fatten and breed for calves to sell

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is hard working wife and mother. She is happily married and has been blessed with three children.

Before she came up with her eatery, her previous business experience was in a variety store and a direct selling business. Now, she focuses on her eatery business. According to her, she opens her eatery at 8:00 in the morning and closes it at 6:00 in the afternoon.

Luisa plans to buy raw meat, vegetables and cases of soft drinks for her eatery business, but she doesn't have enough capital. She decided to borrow additional capital of PHP 5,000. She is looking forward to approval of her requested loan.

loans.use: to purchase raw meat, vegetables and cases of soft drinks for her eatery business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a variety of merchandise such as soft drinks, shampoo, assorted biscuits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Sophal (in photo) is 54 years old and a widower. He lives in Chba Ampov district along the Mekong River, Phnom Penh, Cambodia.

Sophal has two sons and three daughters. They work as staff at a casino, one is a garment factory worker, and the other two are still young.
 
He is a driver for a private company with nine years of experience. 

Sophal is applying for a loan to purchase a motorcycle for his daughter to take to her work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for his daughter takes to her work.

loans.name: Santa Librada Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Santa Librada está en su 1er ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas hacen la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza para que cada una pueda crecer y salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Ana, quien se encuentra en una pobreza extrema, es una mujer muy buena en lo que hace, es por eso que ya tiene muy buena clientela, es conocida en el barrio ya que siempre cumple con sus clientes. Ella quiere seguir con su emprendimiento, es por ello que pone todo de sí para poder crecer.
Ana pide este préstamo para poder comprar telas e hilos, de manera a poder seguir con sus confecciones como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The group Santa Librada is in their first cycle of the program committee of women. They do a poverty elimination survey so that each one can grow and succeed.

One of the members is Mrs. Ana, who lives in extreme poverty. She is a woman who is very good at what she does, which is why she already has a very good clientele, and she is known in the neighborhood for always meeting her customers. She wants to continue with her venture, which is why she uses everything of herself to grow.

Ana asks for this loan to be able to buy fabric and thread, as a way to be able to continue with her apparel as she has been doing. She is thankful for the opportunity she has received to continue growing.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread for clothing.

loans.name: Lolina

texts.en:
Lolina sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan has entrenched her business. She was able to purchase additional grocery products needed to increase her product inventory. The loan also helped her provide for her daily needs and expenses.

She is very positive that she could improve her business more if you will lend her an amount of 60,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional stock of groceries, toiletries and beverages. Her customers will be likely to buy more items if she has more of her products displayed in her store. An increase in sales will also result in a significant increase in profit, which will also result in her business becoming viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

Aside from her variety store, Lolina wants to grow her funds used in her junk shop. She wants to give her family a better life someday, for she knows that all her hard work in business will pay off. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Lydiah

texts.en:
Lydiah is 48 years old. She is married with seven children. She has had a crop farming business for the last eight years and earns a monthly income of KES 8,000, which she uses to support her family.

She will be using the loan to purchase farm inputs, e.g., fertilizer, seedlings and pesticides, to prepare her land for better yields. She hopes this will help her to provide the basic needs for her family. 

Lydiah's hopes and dreams for the future are to grow her business and be stable financially.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs, e.g., fertilizers, seedlings and pesticides, to prepare her land for better yields

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is married and has three children. Her family is a happy one, and she is taking care of her children with the help of her husband. 

She's been in a sari-sari (variety) store business for 20 years, and it is a successful one. She started with a small sari-sari store, having a small display of goods for sale, but as time passed, she managed the business well and made it grow.

She joined GDMPC in 2013. Recently, she decided to borrow money again amounting 50,000 PHP to purchase additional grocery items and other stock for her sari-sari store so that she can increase her stock in the store and earn more income. 

Fe's plan for the future is to save money from her business so that she can sustain her business needs and buy a lot for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items and other stock for her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an electric posho mill to grind maize into flour

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 42 years old and married with five children.

Gina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Gina has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Gina aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Domecita

texts.en:
Domecita works hard to support her family. Domecita is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. Domecita has been in this business for four years now.

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials and equipment for fishing like fish net, gasoline, etc.

In the future, Domecita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and equipment for fishing like fish net, gasoline, etc

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
As a married parent of 11 children, Maria works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. 

Maria is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell for her fish-vending business.

Maria has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of two children, Teresita works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. 

Teresita is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients to sell in her food stall.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Onise

texts.en:
Onise, who is 40 a year-old-married man, lives in the small village Taia. He has a wife, two sons and parents. Sadly, for lack of economic resources and because he had to start working at a very young age, Onise was unable to study a professional career. 

He works hard on family-owned agricultural land, growing nuts and also takes care of a milk cow, producing cheese and yogurt. He always has high quality products, which he sells to local retailers for a good price. 

As the family has only seasonal income, Onise decided to start a clothing trading business and seek credit among local financial institutions, but his attempts were unsuccessful because of his poor living conditions. The startup program that is joint initiative between Kiva and Credo enables rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. His application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of 800 GEL for purchasing a stock of various kinds of clothing. His wife will sell among neighbors and villagers at increased prices. 

With the help of start up credit, Onise will get the chance to improve his family's living condition and more effectively meet daily costs. This motivated couple await your support and kindness.

loans.use: To start a clothing business.

loans.name: Las Mercedes Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Las Mercedes es un grupo nuevo formado por amigas y vecinas de Ciudad del Este, este grupo forma parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, con el que ellas quieren mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de ellas es la señora Mirta, quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, es decir que está en un nivel de pobreza extremo. Para poder ayudar a la señora la fundación paraguaya ha realizado capacitación para ellas.
Mirta vende verduras, y comenta que pide este préstamo para poder comprar verduras frescas para poder seguir con su venta como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The "Las Mercedes" group is new and made up of women who are friends and neighbors in Ciudad del Este. This group is part of the poverty elimination program, through which the members want to improve their living conditions. 

Mirta is one of them. In her survey, Mirta showed a poverty level within level one, meaning that she lives in extreme poverty. In order to help her, Fundación Paraguaya has provided training. 

Mirta sells vegetables. She's requesting this loan to be able to buy fresh vegetables so that she can continue selling them, as she's done so far.

loans.use: to buy fresh vegetables to sell.

loans.name: San Judas Tadeo Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Judas Tadeo está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, todas ellas vieron una oportunidad de crecimiento en el trabajo unido de todas, también forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, que les permitirá poder mejorar sus vidas con el trabajo de todas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Edith, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel dos, es decir que está en un nivel medio. Edith se dedica la peluquería, tiene un pequeño negocio montado con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo y hoy día ya tiene una clientela bien formada. Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de tintes, shampoo, cremas, y otros, de manera a poder seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo poco a poco.
texts.en:
The San Judas Tadeo group is in their second loan cycle with the women’s committee program. They all saw the opportunity for growth through working together. They are also part of the poverty elimination program that will allow them to improve their lives through their work. 

One of the members of the group is Sra. Edith who in her last survey was found to be at a level two of poverty, which is a medium level. Edith is a hairdresser. She has a small business, which she has built with much sacrifice and effort. She now has a well-established clientele. 

She is seeking this loan to be able to invest it in buying dyes, shampoo, creams and other supplies to be able to continue giving her customers good service. She is grateful for the opportunity she has to continue to grow little by little.

loans.use: to buy dyes, shampoo, creams and other supplies.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is a mother of 2 children. Her husband is a fisherman and he helps her in taking care of her children. 

She's been in a sari-sari store business for 5 years. She started it as a small business and has made it grow. 

Nida joined GDMPC in 2014 and decided to borrow a loan in the amount of PHP 12,000 to buy additional grocery items for her sari-sari store so that her inventory will increase and her income will increase also. 

Nida's future plan is saving amoney from her business so that she can provide a better living for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Credit1 Group

texts.en:
Diana is the featured borrower of Credit1 group. She got with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua because they have always been friends since they left their hometown in the Philippines to come and work in Lebanon for a better income to support their beloved ones back in the Philippines.

Diana is a 39-year-old married mother of three children who is working hard as a housekeeper to cover the expenses and needs of her beloved kids and improve their living conditions; thus, she is acquiring a loan to support the increasing living expenses of her family in the Philippines.

Diana is the lady standing in the middle. With respect to the other group members, Criselda is the lady standing on the right, and Lia is the lady standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to support the increasing living expenses of her family in the Philippines

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad is married woman.

She is a vegetable vendor who gets income from selling vegetables to her neighbors and regular customers at their village. 

She hopes to offer more vegetables but she has insufficient funds to buy additional goods. So she is now asking for a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy cabbages, tomatoes, squash and beans to sell. 

She will increase her profits by selling more vegetables. Trinidad will pay back her loan in full.

loans.use: to buy cabbages, tomatoes, squash and beans to sell.

loans.name: Nour 8 Group

texts.en:
Taghreed is the featured borrower of Nour 8 Group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, because they have always been neighbors and friends and they work hard to develop their families' social and financial living.

Taghreed is a 42-year-old widowed mother of two children who has spent eleven years of her life working in the beauty business as a makeup artist, to provide her children's necessary living needs, because she has to be both the hardworking father and the caring mother after her husband passed away, leaving her with big responsibilities to handle at the same time.

Taghreed is well known in her region for her special talents. She developed her skills through vocational training in a specialized college, and is working hard to open her own beauty salon instead of providing her services using others' salons.

Today, Taghreed is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy special spring- and summer-released beauty products and creams to develop her business and reply to customers' needs. She is the lady at the center of the picture. 

As for the other members, Nour is the first from the right, and Amira is the first at the left.

loans.use: To buy special spring- and summer-released beauty products and creams to develop her business and reply to customers' needs

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
She is Carolina. She sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan has entrenched her business. She was able to buy more high-quality used clothes needed to increase her inventory. The loan also helped her provide for her family’s daily needs.

She is very positive that she could improve her business more if you will lend her an amount of 50,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional supplies of clothing items she needs to improve her business. Her customers will likely buy more items if she has more of her products displayed in her store. An increase on sales will also result in a significant increase in profit, which will enable her business to become viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

Carolina wants to improve their present financial condition and she hopes to grow her business as well as start up other business opportunities. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of high-quality used clothes.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store and a food-vending business. 

Elma is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy fishing nets and a new engine for her fishing boat.

Elma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Marilou works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from food vending. 

Marilou is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell for her fish-vending business.

Marilou has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie is 43 years old and single. Virgie works very hard to provide for her daily needs.

Virgie runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years now. 

Vergie requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, groceries, etc.

In the future, Virgie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 53 years old and widowed with five children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Luzviminda has been in this business for 20 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando es de la ciudad de San Ignacio, cuenta con una carnicería en su casa, es casado vive en casa propia, tiene hijos mayores que ha sacado adelante por medio de sus esfuerzos.
Trabajan en familia, son gente humilde y trabajadora, buena predisposición y otros.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en su despensa, para la compra de comestibles, bebidas, lacteos, verduras y demás ya que es en eso que logra ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos. Es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora.
texts.en:
Fernando is from the city of San Ignacio. He has a butcher shop at his home. He is married, lives in his own home, and he has older children who he raised through his efforts. They are working in their families, are humble people, hardworking, and good-natured.

He is asking for this loan to invest in his pantry by purchasing groceries, drinks, dairy, vegetables and others. With these investments, he can help his family and loved ones. He is a hardworking and tenacious person.

loans.use: to buy groceries, drinks, dairy, vegetables, and other items.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan allowed her to enrich her business. She was able to purchase additional grocery products needed to increase her product inventory. The loan also helped her provide for her family's daily needs and business expenditures.

She is positive that she can further improve her business with a new Kiva loan in the amount of PhP 30,000. This new loan will go toward the purchase of additional stocks of groceries, toiletries, and beverages. She finds that her customers are more likely to buy more items if she has more of her products displayed in her store. An increase in sales will result in a significant increase in profit, which will allow her business to become more viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she will be better able to sustain the needs of her family.

Anita wants to grow her business and to create other sources of income. She also dreams of a better standard of living and good health for her family. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to offer for sale in her store

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es:
Luis es un joven hombre de 20 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos, y estudia la carrera de comunicación social.
Él es inteligente, emprendedor, decidido, comprometido con sus estudios y responsable. Sus estudios los desarrolla en una universidad privada, localizada en el centro de la ciudad donde oficinas comerciales, empresariales, públicas y todo tipo de comercio conviven lado a lado, de clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 6-16 grados centígrados.
Luis es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, ojos obscuros, utiliza lentes de aumento, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará que ya no habla porque estudia en español y también estudia inglés como segunda lengua. Él estudia la carrera de comunicación social y se prepara para desempeñar funciones dentro de los medio periodísticos, ya sea prensa escrita, radio o televisión, sus principales cualidades son; Sentido común, gusto por la palabra, facilidad para la escritura, curiosidad, capacidad de síntesis, Interés por las nuevas tecnologías (blogs, redes sociales, HTML…), lenguaje visual (edición de vídeo) y otras. “quiero desempeñarme en mi rubro y trabajar en los medios televisivos para ayudar a mi familia económicamente…” comenta. Su sueño es trabajar en televisión, el desea realizar el pago de las materias de su carrera por adelantado para obtener un descuento. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que estudia en la universidad.
Es por esos motivos que Luis solicita un préstamo para el pago de las materias de su carrera para obtener un descuento y ayudar a su familia económicamente.
texts.en:
Luis is a young 20 year old boy, single, childless, and is studying social communication.

He is smart, entrepreneurial, determined, committed to his studies and responsible. His studies were carried out in a private university, located in the center of the city where commercial offices, businesses, public offices and all types of trade coexist side by side. The city has a cold and dry climate with a temperature that varies during the day between 6-16 degrees Celsius.

Luis is of dark complexion, has short black hair, dark eyes, wears glasses, and has a short stature and thin physique. His maternal language is Aymará, which he no longer speaks because he studies in Spanish and also studies English as a second language. He studies social communication and is preparing to work within news media, either print, radio or television. His main qualities are: common sense, love and ease of writing, curiosity, capacity to synthesize, interest in new technologies (blogs, social networks, HTML...), visual language (video editing), etc. He says, "I want to develop in this category and work in television media to help my family financially...". His dream is to work in television, and he wants to pay for the materials for his career in advance to get a discount. This is his first sequence of loans with the institution in his first year of studying at the university.

It is for these reasons that Luis is requesting a loan to pay for materials for his career to get a discount and help his family financially.

loans.use: to pay for discounted materials for his career and help his family financially.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: Doña María, tiene 51 años de edad, esta casada, tiene dos hijos y reside en un sector de Cofradía, municipio de San Pedro Sula. Ella siempre se ha dedicado al comercio, lleva 9 años de haber establecido su propio negocio de pulpería donde vende pan, dulces, condimentos, arroz, frijoles, manteca, aceite, carnes, lácteos y otros abarrotes. Necesita invertir en su negocio y ha decidido solicitar 5,000 lempiras para comprar productos  como arroz, frijoles, huevos, churros,  pan, productos de aseo, y otros. Esta inversión le ayudara a mantener las ventas. Su sueño es hacer un local mas grande para la pulpería y mantenerla bien surtida.
texts.en: María is 51 years old. She is married, has two children and lives in the are of Cofradía, municipality of San Pedro Sula. She has always worked as a merchant. She has had her own store for 9 years and she sells bread, candies, seasonings, rice, lard, oil, meats, dairy products, and more. She needs to invest in her business and she has decided to ask for 5,000 lempiras to buy products such as rice, beans, eggs, churros, bread, cleaning products and more. This investment will help her maintain her sales. Her dream is to have a bigger locale for the store and keep it well stocked.

loans.use: to buy products such as rice, beans, eggs, churros, bread, cleaning products, and other things to sell.

loans.name: Elnur

texts.en:
Elnur, age 27, earns a low income as a worker in a construction company. He lives with his wife and their two children in a simple house in the Imisli region. He is the sole breadwinner for the family.
 
Elnur's second son was born with a disability and the other son is currently suffering from influenza. They are both on bed rest and require medications. Elnur wants to do everything he can to give them proper care, but it is very difficult for him as he cannot afford the expensive medications they need. He has therefore decided to request a loan, as he has no one else to turn to. 

He is relying on your support.

loans.use: to purchase expensive medications for his children

loans.name: Rosie Group

texts.en:
Lucrecia is the featured borrower of Rosie's Group. She and the other group members requested a loan from Al Majmoua because they have been friends since they left their hometown in the Philippines to work in Lebanon.

Lucrecia is 58 years old, married, and has six children. She is works as a housekeeper to cover the expenses and needs of her children and  to improve their living conditions. She is requesting a loan, which she will use to support her family's increasing living costs in the Philippines.

loans.use: to support her family's increasing living costs in Philippine

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary used her previous loan amount from VisionFund Kenya to put up shelves in her general shop, as well as to add some retail goods to her inventory, such as plastic basins and buckets. The investment was profitable and she repaid the loan successfully. 

She will be using her new loan funds to purchase rice, sugar, maize flour, and cooking oil. She is confident that this will help her buy more retail goods in order to meet the high demand of her customers. 

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to expand her business and to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, maize flour, and cooking oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chairs, tables, and supplies for his new cafe business

loans.name: Bekboldu

texts.ru: Бекболду, 21 год, не женат, детей нет, живет с бабушкой. Бекболду работает охранником, также занимается животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду Бекболду, в его хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, он обратился в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец, для увеличения поголовья. Вырученные доходы от бизнеса Бекболду планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и хочет накопить средства на свою свадьбу.
texts.en: Bekboldu is 21, unmarried, doesn't have children, and lives with his grandmother.   He works as a security guard and also raises animals.  Thanks to his persistent work, Bekboldu currently has two cows on his farm.  In order to further grow his business, he is applying to "Bai Tushum" for a loan of 40,000KGS to buy cows to increase his herd.  He plans to use income from the business to further increase his number of animals.  He also wants to put away money for his wedding.

loans.use: to buy additional sheep to increase the size of his herd.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth sells charcoal to earn an income. She has been engaged in this work for the past four years. She sells her wares from her home to her neighbors and to passers-by. Her primary business challenge is the high cost of transportation. 

Elizabeth lives with her husband and their three children in a house that has both electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 
 
She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With her Kshs 50,000 loan, she intends to purchase bundles of charcoal to offer for sale.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of charcoal  to offer for sale

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a creative and hard-working young woman who is dedicated to her family. Anyone watching her at work will admire her for the determination and dedication that she puts into each one of her tasks. 

Farming has been the key to her success. Kapsowar is a rain-fed area popularly known for maize and dairy farming. With the help of her beloved husband, Margaret runs a successful rural enterprise, capitalizing on her small piece of land. The farm consists of her home, a cow, poultry, and trees. 

Margaret is planning to grow her farm business, but the only way she can do this without having to purchase more land is by focusing on poultry. Poultry farming is a very lucrative venture that does not require very much land space to be conducted. Margaret is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to purchase more heads of poultry in a bid to boost egg production and ultimately increase her income. Her family will use the eggs produced to fill domestic needs and to meet commercial ends. Money generated from the sales will be used to settle the loan debt and pay part of their children's education expenses. 

Margaret's vision is to provide for her family and to meet their needs as best as she can.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Linna's Group

texts.en:
Linna, age 29, grows and harvests cassava to earn her living. To supplement her income, she also works for others for a fee. She is a villager living in the province of Mondulkiri, and she is the mother of one child. 

This is Linna's first loan through Kiva partner VisionFund, and she is the leader of a group of four members. She will spend her loan portion on fertilizer to support her farm. 

Her goal is to earn a larger income from her farm in order to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her cassava farm.

loans.name: Clemencue Group

texts.en:
Merly, age 42 and unmarried, is the featured borrower of the Clemencue group, which consists of two other Filipino members, Army and Mayvel. The three of them left their home towns to come and work as housekeepers in Lebanon, hoping to meet the needs of their beloved families at home and offer them a better future. Merly is pictured at right, with Army in the center and Mayvel on the left.
 
The three of them have decided to hold hands and together acquire a loan from Kiva field partner Al Majmoua. They have become best friends and have learned to trust each other ever since arriving to work in Lebanon, and they all share the ambition of raising their families' standard of living back in the Philippines.
 
Merly is the mother of one child, and she works hard to support her son's basic needs and to offer him the best education she can, as her goal is to give him a brighter future. However, her current monthly income is barely enough to cover her own survival. For this reason, her acquired loan funds will be sent to her beloved child in the Philippines in order to provide a better living for him, so that he can better understand why she is leaving him behind and working hard abroad to better support him.

loans.use: to meet the increasing living needs of her beloved child in the Philippines

loans.name: Moustafa

texts.en:
Moustafa is a 26-year-old single man, who has been working as an electrician since 2006. He was only seventeen when he started this business, and he has proved to be highly talented in his domain. He is a hard working man with a very good reputation in his domain, is highly recommended by his customers, and he is working hard to develop his business and expand his working region.

Moustafa is requesting a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a special power engine to support him during his work when electricity is not available, in addition to a specially-required compressor in his business development.

This is Moustafa's second cycle as Al Majmoua borrower. With his previous loan he updated his tools and increased his machines so he could reply to more than one project at a time and to any kind of work requested. In that loan he proved to be a good standing borrower.

He hopes to open a construction company in the future that can provide several linked services at one time.

loans.use: To buy a special power engine to support him during his work when electricity is not available, in addition to a specially-required compressor in his business development

loans.name: Lyudmila

texts.en:
Lyudmila is 70-year-old elderly woman. She lives with his husband in the Imisli region. For almost  50 years, she’s been managing livestock she has three cows and sells milk. Her family’s monthly income includes her pension of 70 azn / month, her husband’s pension of  65 azn / month, and is supplemented by selling milk to some nearby dairy farms.  

Lyudmila has a health problem. She needs your financial help to buy expensive medications. She has no one to turn to. Lyudmila  relies on your support.

loans.use: to buy expensive medications

loans.name: Mali

texts.en:
Mali is a married woman with two kids, each of whom attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mali operates a grocery vegetable selling stall, she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Rokonka

texts.en: Rokonka is 42 years old. He is married with 6 children. He has had a livestock trading business in Narok town for 10 years and it has been profitable. He will be using the loan to purchase cows and goats to supply to butcher shops and his customers in other areas and hopes this will help him buy more goats to sell and increase his overall income and provide for the needs of his family. His hopes and dreams for the future are to trade livestock to other areas and have a successful business.

loans.use: To buy cows and goats to sell and also supply to butcher shops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a well on his small plot inherited from his father so that his wife doesn't have to go far to get water.

loans.name: Haytham

texts.en:
Haytham, age 29, earns a living by running a small cafe business, where he sells soft drinks. He lives with his wife and their son in a small house in the city of Khan Younis. 

Haytham would like to open a restaurant where he can prepare and sell light sandwiches and traditional meals.To start up his new business, he requested a loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy tables, chairs, and supplies for his restaurant. By taking out this loan, Haytham will be able to start his business and become more independent.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, and supplies for his new restaurant

loans.name: Sruon's Group

texts.en:
Sruon, a mother of one schoolchild living in Kampong Cham province, is 34 years old. Nowadays, she struggles to overcome her family hardship via motor repairing and working for others for a fee to earn more income. She can earn an income of about 41,700 KHR per day to support her living conditions. 

For Sruon, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy motor repairing materials. She hopes that she can get more income to improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to buy motor repairing materials.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Maria Leticia

texts.es: Doña María tiene, 45 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja con quien tiene 3 hijos y reside en una aldea del municipio de Macuelizo, Santa Barbara. Doña María decidió hace 5 años tener su propio negocio donde vende harina de maíz y de trigo, manteca, pan, churros, arroz, azúcar, sal, café, especias, carnes, embutidos, lácteos y otros. Ha obtenido varios prestamos para el negocio y ha logrando mantener esa fuente de ingresos. Actualmente solicita el séptimo ciclo en la institución que es por 15,000 Lempiras para comprar harina, carnes, refrescos, y embutidos para vender. Su propósito es hacer crecer el negocio y crecer como comerciante para tener mejor vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Maria is 45 years old and lives in a free union with her partner, with whom she has three children. Maria resides in a village in the municipality of Macuelizo, Santa Barbara. She decided some five years ago to start her own business where she would sell corn and wheat flour, lard, bread, sweet rolls, rice, sugar, salt, coffee, spices, meat, cold cuts, milk products and other items.

She has obtained various loans for the business and has managed to maintain this source of income. 

At present, Maria is requesting her seventh loan cycle from the institution, which is for 15,000 lempiras, to purchase flour, meat, soft drinks, and cold cuts to sell.

Maria's proposal is to make her business grow and to grow as a merchant in order to offer her family a better life.

loans.use: buy wheat flour, meat, soft drinks, and cold cuts to sell.

loans.name: Smart 2 Group

texts.en:
Estelita, age 69 and widowed, is the featured borrower of the Smart2 group. She joined the other two group members, Ida and Jenny, in order to acquire a loan from Kiva field partner Al Majmoua because they have been friends ever since they left their home towns in the Philippines to come and work in Lebanon. They share the primary goal of earning a better income to support their loved ones back in the Philippines.

Estelita, pictured at left, supports her three children by cooking and selling traditional Filipino food. She hopes eventually to help improve the family's overall living conditions. She will use her loan funds to develop her business by purchasing ingredients that will help her provide her customers with new, special meals. 

Ida, age 55 and divorced (pictured at right), is the mother of one child, and Jenny (in the center) is 32 years old and unmarried. Ida and Jenny both intend to use their loan funds to renew their mobile prepaid card businesses.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients that will help her provide her customers with new, special meals

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.es:
