Eugenio es un hombre de 35 años de edad, casado, tiene 1 hijo varón de 9 años y 2 hijas mujeres de 10 y 7 años, y su negocio es la producción de estuco.
Él es buen padre, emprendedor, fuerte, decidido, responsable y trabajador. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la localidad de ‘Vichaya’ localizado a 86 kilómetros de la ciudad y se caracteriza por las importantes estructuras funerarias existentes en el lugar denominadas ‘Chullpares’ y sitios defensivos posiblemente de la época de los denominados “Señoríos Aymaras” 1100 - 1400 dc., estas chullpas se pueden observar a simple vista desde el camino, de clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 5-16 grados centígrados.
Eugenio es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, ojos pardos, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposa que atiende una tienda de barrio y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de adobe con techo de calamina que cuenta con electricidad y agua de pozo, no existe el alcantarillado en el lugar. Su negocio es la producción de estuco que consiste en el tratamiento de la roca (el yeso) encontrada en estado natural, convirtiéndola en una pasta flexible para ser mezclada con agua y aplicada sobre superficies como; muros, cielos rasos y cementos, con la que se pueden hacer rellenos y revestimiento de acabados de la construcción. “nuestra mayor dificultad es el difícil acceso al agua para trabajar debemos transportarla desde el río que queda a 10 minutos del lugar…” comenta. Su sueño es vender estuco por mayor y tener una camioneta dónde poder transportarla, el desea realizar la compra de leña y combustible para la explotación de estuco. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 6 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Eugenio solicita un préstamo para la compra de leña y combustible para la producción de estuco para vender por mayor.
texts.en:
Eugenio, 35 years old, is married and has a 9-year-old son and two daughters aged 10 and 7. His business is the production of  stucco.

He's a good father, enterprising, strong, decisive, responsible, and he works hard.

His business is located in Vichaya. This town, 86 kilometers away from the city, is known for its funerary towers visible on the land, called "chullpares", and for its defensives sites possibly dating back to 1100-1400 AD, the period of the "Señoríos Aymaras" [Aymará dominions]. These "chullpas" may be seen from the road. This is an area of cold, dry climate, with daytime temperatures ranging from five to 16 degrees centigrade.

Eugenio has a dark complexion, short black hair and brown eyes. He has short stature and a thin physique. His mother tongue is Aymará which is spoken in the area, and he speaks Spanish in the community and for commerce.

He shares his life with his wife who tends a neighborhood store, and with his children who go to school. They live in their own home built of adobe with a corrugated metal roof, with electricity and well water available. There is no sewage service in the area.

His business is the production of stucco: the native rock (gypsum) is treated to turn it into flexible paste that is mixed with water and applied to surfaces such as walls, ceilings and cements. It can be used to cover and resurface as finishing touches in construction.

"Our greatest challenge is the difficult access to water for working, we have to transport it from the river which is ten minutes away", he comments. His dream is to sell the stucco wholesale and to have a pickup truck to transport it.

Eugenio wants to buy firewood and fuel for the production of stucco to sell wholesale. This is his first loan cycle with the institution in the six years that he's been doing this work.

loans.use: to buy firewood and fuel for the production of stucco to sell wholesale.

loans.name: Martha Cecilia

texts.es: A sus 36 años de edad Cecilia es madre soltera, vive con sus 3 hijos  de 13, 15 y 19 años de edad, los 2 menores están estudiando y el mayor de ellos  se dedica a trabajar a la agricultura junto a su madre, Cecilia se dedica a la agricultura y al comercio de animales menores y en esta ocasión el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos ya que comenta que mediante las ganancias que le deja su negocio es como ella  puede pagar la alimentación, educación y arriendo de la casa para que vivan sus  hijos.
texts.en: At 36 years of age Cecilia is a single mother of 3 children aged 13, 15 and 19 years old. The two youngest study and the oldest works in agriculture together with his mother. Cecilia works in agriculture and in raising small animals. At this time the loan will be invested in buying pigs. She comments that by way of the gains that the business creates she can pay for food, education and  rent on the house for her children.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Madat

texts.en:
Madat is a 26-year-old invalid single man. Because of his situation, he is not working and lives with his family. His family's monthly income includes his pension of 40 AZN per month, his mother's pension of 65 AZN per month, and proceeds from selling vegetables. 

Of course, this income is not enough to cover family needs and pay for Madat's medical expenses. For this reason, Madat needs your help. He hopes that by taking the loan, he will be able to help his family and pay for his expensive medications. Madat has no one to turn to. He relies on your support.

loans.use: to pay for his expensive medications

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for higher education costs (making monthly university payments) and to buy school supplies.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma sells khanga (traditional Kenyan wrap-style clothing for women) to earn her living, To earn an additional income, she sells charcoal. She offers her wares from her home and door-to-door, selling to her neighbors and passers-by. She lives with her husband and child in a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her child attends school. Fatuma's greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

Fatuma's primary business challenge is lack of capital with which to expand her enterprise. She therefore decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With her requested loan funds, Fatuma wants to purchase bales of khanga to offer for sale.

loans.use: to purchase bales of khanga (traditional Kenyan wrap-style clothing for women) to offer for sale

loans.name: Charlyn

texts.en:
Charlyn is 37 years old and has 3 children. She's been in the transport business for 5 years; she manages it with the help of her husband. They use the motorcycle for transport. 

She joined and became a member of GDMPC last 2009. Recently she decided again to borrow a loan amounting to PHP 30,000 to buy spare parts and pay for repairs for the motorcycle to make it in good condition. 

Charlyn's future plan is to buy an additional motorcycle so that she can transport more passengers and earn more so that she can provide a better living for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and pay for repairs for the motorcycle.

loans.name: Mariya

texts.ru: Мария, 36 лет, замужем, 2 детей дошкольного возраста. У Марии средне-специальное образование, она на протяжении многих лет занимается сельским хозяйством, начав этот бизнес в 2005 году. На сегодняшний день прибыль Марии составляет около 25,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. У нее в хозяйстве есть 3 дойные коровы. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Мария обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойных коров для увеличения объемов реализации экологически чистого молока. Доходы от кредита Мария планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса и ремонт дома.
texts.en: Mariya is 36, and married with two preschoolers.  She has a vocational education.  She's earned her living in farming for many years, having started out in 2005. Nowadays she brings in close to 25,000KGS in profit per month.  She has 3 milk cows on the farm.  In order to further grow her business, Mariya has applied to Bai Tushum for a loan of 100,000KGS to buy milk cows to increase her organic milk sales volume.  She plans to use income from the loan to invest in further development of the business and to do home repairs.

loans.use: to purchase dairy cows in order to increase the volume of organic milk sales.

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Neema operates a retail shop business to earn her living, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She has operated her business for the past five years. Her primary business challenge is seasonality. She lives with her husband and child in a house that has both electricity and piped water. Her child attends school. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With her loan funds, she intends to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour to offer for sale

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: A sus 65 años de edad Elena es una señora muy responsable con las actividades que se dedica, ella esta casada y tiene 5 hijos mayores de edad, Elena vive con su esposo y  2 hijos, uno de ellos esta estudiando y el otro se dedica al jornal, Elena vive en el campo y se dedica a  la crianza de animales mayores,  menores y a la agricultura, Elena necesita el crédito para comprar chanchos, la aspiración de Elena es de seguir trabajando en su negocio comprar más  chanchos y asi lograr aumentar sus ingresos para darle la educación a su hijo y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Elena, age 65, is a woman who is very responsible with her business activities.  She is married and has five grown children.  She lives with her husband and two of her children.  One of them attends school, and the other is a day worker.  Elena lives in the country, raises large and small animals, and farms.  

She needs the loan to buy pigs.  Elena aspires to continue working in her business and to buy more pigs.  This way she will manage to increase her earnings for her son’s education, and she will improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Sophal's Group

texts.en:
A resident living in Kampong Cham province, Sophal is 45 years old and a mother of six children. 

She can earn income to support her family condition via growing corn and working for others for a fee to earn more income. 

For Sophal, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of four, she is the group leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and seed to support her corn farm. 

She hopes that she can get more yields than last year.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seed to support her corn farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: That's Group

texts.en:
That, age 58, is a rice farmer. She lives in the province of Kampong Cham and has five children. She tries to overcome her family's financial hardship by earning an additional income through fishing. She can earn a total income of about 36,100 KHR per day. 

This is the first time That has requested a loan through Kiva partner VisionFund. She is the leader of her group of two members. She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seeds to support her rice farm. Her goal is to obtain a greater yield from her farm than she did last year.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for her rice farm

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Wawa Prana Group

texts.es:
La Asociación Comunal Wawa Prana, está integrada por 10 mujeres emprendedoras (Maura, Mayla Vanessa, Maurita, Victoria, Josefa, Evonicia, Delia, Ardiñas, Thelma y Ellen), todas viven en la comunidad Wawa Boom, conocida por el Río Wawa que recorre 160 Km. surcando una llanura selvática al occidente del municipio de Puerto Cabezas, en la Región Autónoma del Atlántico Norte (RAAN), a 500 km. al Noreste de Managua.

Son mujeres que luchan  por hacer crecer sus pequeños negocios de venta de frito de pescado, pollo, cerdo, venta de ropa usada que ofrecen sus productos en el Lanchón, es una barcaza que sirve de puente para trasladar al otro lado al transporte pesado, buses y vehículos que se dirigen al municipio de Puerto Cabezas o a la Región del Pacifico de Nicaragua. Escogieron el nombre de Wawa Prana, porque en miskito significa la belleza del Rio Wawa.

Maura: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario, organizo hace aproximadamente dos años a 10 mujeres de la etnia miskita, para poder accesar a préstamos con garantía solidaria en Pana Pana. Es una mujer con deseos de superación y cualidades de líder, tiene 52 años de edad, casada con 6 hijos: 2 son mayores de edad e independientes y cuatro adolescentes que estudian su secundaria y primaria. Desde hace 10 años se dedica a venta de fritos en “El Lanchón”, de esta manera genera ingresos propios y contribuye con los gastos del hogar y en los estudios de sus hijos. Está solicitando financiamiento para comprar: filipitas, aceite, sal, pollo, pescado, cerdo, tomate, repollo, entre otros productos para la elaboración de frito. Ella sueña con ser una comerciante exitosa y construir de concreto su vivienda, por mayor durabilidad y seguridad para su familia.
texts.en:
The "Wawa Prana" communal bank is made up of 10 enterprising women (Maura, Mayla Vanessa, Maurita, Victoria, Josefa, Evonicia, Delia, Ardiñas, Thelma y Ellen), who live in the community of Wawa Boom, known for the Wawa river that runs 160 Km. flowing through a jungle plain in the West of the municiaplity of Puerto Cabezas, in the Región Autónoma del Atlántico Norte (RAAN), 500 km north-east of Managua.

These women are fighting to expand their small businesses of selling fried fish, chicken and pork, selling used clothing, who offer their products on the Lanchón which is a barge that serves as a bridge to transport heavy transport, buses and vehicles headed to the municipality of Puerto Cabezas and the Pacific region of Nicaragua. They chose the name Wawa Prana because in Miskito it means the Beauty of the Wawa River.

Maura Is the coordinator of the communal bank which she organized about 2 years ago with 10 ethnic Miskito women to be able to access loan with a group guarantee from Pana Pana. She is a woman with the desire to get ahead and leadership qualities. She is 52 years old, married and has 6 children. Two of them are adults and independent and the 4 adolescents study in secondary and primary schools.

For 10 years she has worked selling fried food on the “El Lanchón” and in this manner has generated her own funds and contributed to the household expenses and her children's studies. She is requesting a loan to buy filipitas (traditional Caribbean food), oil, salt, chicken, fish, pork, tomatoes, cabbage amongst other products to make fried food. She dreams of being a successful businesswoman and building a cement house to last longer and provide more security for her family.

loans.use: to buy filipitas (traditional Caribbean food), oil, salt, chicken, fish, pork, tomatoes, cabbage amongst other products to make fried food.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy grocery items for her retail store and a steamer for her food vending business

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn sends you her thanks for your generosity, because her previous loan helped support her business. She was able to purchase additional grocery items needed to increase her product inventory. The loan also helped her pay for her children's education expenses and daily needs.

Marilyn is very positive that she would be able to improve her business even more if you were to lend her 22,000 PHP. This new loan will go towards the purchase of additional inventory of groceries, toiletries, and beverages. Her customers will likely buy more items if she has more products displayed. An increase in sales will also result in a significant profit increase, which will also let her business become viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she will be able to sustain her family's needs.

In the future, Marilyn hopes to grow her business and dreams for her children to finish school. She is an active community partner of C.C.T. She meets with her fellowship* group every Thursday.

*All C.C.T. community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed to stock her business.

loans.name: Priscila

texts.en:
Priscila is married with two school-going children. They live in their own house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She has been operating a business selling khangas (brightly colored patterned cloth, commonly worn by women as a wrap or scarf) from home and door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital to expand her business.

Priscila decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of khangas for resale.

loans.use: to purchase bales of khangas for resale.

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
A farmer living in Kampong Cham province, Phally is 35 years old and a mother of one child. 

To support her family living, she grows rice as the main source of income and she sells grocery items to earn extra income. She can earn an income of about 46,900 KHR per day. 

This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her loan portion to buy more grocery items to resell. 

She hopes that she can earn more income to support her family better than before.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items to resell.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials for making jewelry.

loans.name: Nin

texts.en:
Nin is a 21-year-old single freshman who is from the Kampong Speu province of Cambodia. Currently, he is pursuing an associate’s degree, majoring in banking, at a university in the city. His father is a traditional wedding-song musician and his mother is a grocer.

Nin is requesting a loan because he lacks the money to cover his university fees from the first to the second year. This loan will help him earn the associate’s degree successfully. Following his dreams, Nin hopes to have a good job and to save money to earn a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to cover his university fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase Load Wallet for Touch Mobile and Globe AutoLoadMax for his loading station business.

loans.name: Kelvin

texts.en:
Kelvin is 24 years old. He is married with 1 child. 

He has had a motorcycle transport business for 5 years. He will be using the loan to purchase another motorcycle and serve more customers as well as make more income and he hopes the income will help him educate his child and provide for his family's needs. His hopes and dreams for the future are to buy more motorcycles and be successful.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle and serve more customers and generate more income.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan has improved her business. She was able to buy spare parts and accessories for their vehicle. The loan also helped her provide for her family's daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she could improve her business more if you would let her borrow an amount of 35,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional supplies of accessories and spare parts for their jeepney. Simultaneously, she could meet the needs of her family if the unit is regularly maintained and in good condition.

Jesusa hopes for her business to grow bigger and better. She dreams of giving her family a good life in the future. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for accessories, spare parts and maintenance for her jeepney.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en: Amos is 39 years old. He is married with one child. He has had a retail business selling household goods for five years and it has been profitable. He will be using this loan to purchase kitchen utensils, water buckets and plastic basins and hopes this will help him meet his clients' needs and demands. He anticipates making more income to educate his children and also buy a plot of land. His hopes and dreams for the future are to be successful in his business and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy kitchen utensils to sell to satisfy his customers' needs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorbike to transport produce to market

loans.name: Dogdurkul

texts.ru: Догдуркул, 43 года, замужем, мать 3 детей. У Догдуркул- среднее образование,она знает как правильно использовать и планировать денежные средства для достижения поставленных целей. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается полеводством и животноводством. Стартовав 19 лет назад с покупки скота на 12,000 сом (KGS), благодаря упорному труду Догдуркул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы, бычок, 11 овец. Для содержания скота есть все условия. На 3,60 Га земли она выращивает картофель и люцерну.  Догдуркул обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян картофеля и сена для скота. Доходы от кредита позволят Догдуркул развить ее бизнес, нарастить активы и улучшить уровень жизни.
texts.en: Dogdurkul is 43 years old, married and a mother of 3 children. Dogdurkul has a secondary education, and she knows how to correctly use and plan finances to achieve her set goals. To provide the primary income for her family, she is involved in farming and animal husbandry. Having started this business 19 years ago with a purchase of livestock for 12,000 som (KGS), today, thanks to Dogdurkul's hard work, her farm contains 2 cows, a bull and 11 sheep. She has all of the necessary conditions for keeping livestock. She grows potatoes and alfalfa on 3.60 hectares of land. Dogdurkul requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy potato seeds and hay for the livestock. The earnings from the loan will allow Dogdurkul to develop her business, increase her assets and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and hay for the livestock

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with six children. They live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

She has operated a khanga (women's wrap cloth) selling business, selling from home and door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital to expand her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of khangas for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of khangas for resale

loans.name: Daniela Abigail

texts.es: A sus 21 años de edad Daniela esta casada y tiene 1 hijo de 4 años que asiste a la escuela, el esposo de Daniela trabaja de albañil, Daniela se dedica  al comercio de frutas juntamente a su madre, Daniela necesita el dinero del crédito para comprar más variación de mercadería en frutas, y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos ya que comenta que ella necesita pagar sus estudios que los realiza  a distancia para terminar la secundaria y tambien espera poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su hijo.
texts.en: Daniela is 21 years old, married, and the mother of a 4 year old son who attends school. Her husband works as a construction worker and Daniela, along with her mother, sells fruit. Daniela needs a loan in order to purchase a greater variety of merchandise with the hopes of improving her earnings. She needs to bring in more money in order to pay for her studies, which she does through distance education so she can finish her secondary school education. She also hopes to improve her son's quality of life.

loans.use: purchase fruit.

loans.name: Lucia Del Rocio

texts.es: La señora Lucia es casada y tiene  46 años de edad, Lucia tiene 4 hijas de las edades de 12, 21, 24 y 27 años, de ellas 2 viven con Lucia, la de 12 años asiste a la escuela y la de 21 es casada, Lucia necesita el dinero del crédito para comprar frutas y comercializarlas los días de feria de las ciudades más cercanas, Lucia vive en la casa de su madre y junto a su esposo se dedican a comercializar frutas,  la aspiración de Lucia es de seguir adelante en su negocio, mejorarlo y de este modo terminar de dar la educación a su hija.
texts.en: Lucia is 46 years old, married, and has four daughters aged 12, 21, 24 and 27 years old. Two of her daughters live with her, the 12 year old still attends school and the 21 year old is married. Lucia needs a loan in order to purchase more fruit and to sell them during festival days in nearby towns. Lucia lives with her mother and her husband who also sells fruit. Lucia's aspiration is to grow her business, improve it and help to give her daughter an education.

loans.use: purchase fruit.

loans.name: Elsa Marina

texts.es: Elsa, tiene 30 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos a su cargo con quienes reside en un sector del Municipio de Quimistán, Santa Barbara. Ella trabajó por varios años en una maquila y hace 8 años decidió tener su propio negocio, vende blusas, vestidos, camisas, pantalones, ropa interior y también vende cosméticos como cremas, desodorantes, champú y calzado.  Este negocio lo tiene establecido en un local que alquila.  Y esta solicitando un prestamo por 10,000 lempiras para comprar más ropa nueva y usada para poder aumentar las ventas y los ingresos. Su meta es tener su propio local para el negocio y terminar de construir el cerco de su casa.
texts.en: Elsa is 30 years old and a single mother of three. They live in the municipality Quimistan, Santa Barbara. She worked for various years in a garment factory, but 8 years ago she decided to start her own business where she sells blouses, dresses, shirts, pants, and underwear as well as cosmetics, creams, deodorants, shampoo and shoes. She runs her business out of a storefront she rents. She is asking for a loan in order to purchase more new and used clothing in order to increase sales and increase her earnings. Her goal is to have her own store and to finish building the fence around her home.

loans.use: purchase new and used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Kujtim

texts.en:
Kujtim is 25 years old and single. He is very ambitious and loves to work, being independent and not relying on his parents or others for help.

He recently started a business selling different types of clothing in a shop. He takes pride in the fact that he has good style and taste and is able to choose the most trendy and in-fashion items that sell quickly.

He is now requesting a loan to purchase some additional clothing and to renovate his shop. He hopes that this loan will help him to be able to expand his business and increase his profits. He knows that this is a Kiva loan and wants to thank all of the lenders for the support.

loans.use: to purchase some additional clothing and to renovate his shop.

loans.name: Norn's Group

texts.en:
Norn, a farmer living in Kampong Cham province, is 54 years old and the mother of five children. To make her living, she grows cassava and vegetables as the main source of her income. She can earn income about 25,200 KHR per day.

For Norn, this is her sixth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid all of her past loans. She leads a group of two to get a new loan. 

As the group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and pesticide and to pay a land fee to support her farm. She hopes that she can get a good yield and make a good income to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide and to pay a land fee to support her farm.

loans.name: Mouna

texts.en:
Mouna is a 45-year-old, married mother of one child. She has been working hard for fifteen years running her shop selling underwear to provide for necessary living needs and best education. Mouna is a hardworking woman, who puts much effort in developing her career to provide her family with a better living.

Her income, combined with her husband’s limited monthly salary, isn’t enough to cover their beloved daughter's unexpected increasing needs. That's why she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to pay for her daughter's increasing university tuition fees, and to make her dream of graduating come true. Mouna hopes to expand her business in the future, and to keep on supporting her family and developing their living.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's university tuition fees.

loans.name: Maya

texts.en:
Maya is 34, married, and lives with her husband, daughter, son, and her ill mother-in-law. All the family members have been planting crops for a long time. She was born into a family of farmers and learned from her parents. Maya plants crops every year and earns income this way. 

The family's main source of income is agriculture, but this year she has had financial problems and she will not be able to plant vegetables and fruits. Using this loan, Maya will purchase a crop and pay her mother-in-law’s medical expenses.

loans.use: to purchase a crop and to pay her mother-in-law's medical expenses.

loans.name: Bubuzuura

texts.ru: Бубузуура, 44 года, вдова, мать 4 детей. У Бубузууры среднее образование, уже 16 лет занимается полеводством и животноводством. Стартовав с 10,000 сом (KGS), благодаря упорному труду, на сегодняшний день у Бубузууры имеется 2,05 ГА собственного земельного надела, на котором она ежегодно выращивает пшеницу и люцерну для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Также в хозяйстве есть 6 коров. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS), в основном от продажи молока. Этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь, так как сельское хозяйство- единственный источник дохода семьи, в целях дальнейшего развития своей деятельности, Бубузуура обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 35,000 сом (KGS) для покупки 7 овец. Доходы от кредита Бубузуура хочет вложить в приумножение количества домашней скотины, что увеличит ее доход в будущем.
texts.en: Bubuzuura is 44 years old, a widow and a mother of 4 children. Bubuzuura has a secondary education and has been involved in farming and animal husbandry for 16 years. Having started this business with 10,000 som (KGS), today, thanks to her hard work, Bubuzuura has 2.05 hectares of her own land, where she annually grows wheat and alfalfa for the farm consumption and sale. She also has 6 cows. Her monthly income amounts to 15,000 som (KGS) primarily from sales of milk. This money is not enough for a decent life and agriculture is the sole source of income for her family. This is why, to further develop her business, Bubuzuura requested a loan in the amount of 35,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy 7 sheep. Bubuzuura wants to invest the earnings from the loan into increasing her livestock headcount, which will result in increased income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase 7 sheep in order to increase her income

loans.name: Tonkei

texts.en:
Tonkei is 42 years old. He is married with five children. He has had a livestock trading business for 10 years. He will be using the loan to purchase goats and cows to sell, and hopes this will help him meet the high demands of his customers. 

He will use the income to buy more goats to sell, and also to provide for the needs of his family. His hopes and dreams for the future include being successful in his business.

loans.use: To buy goats and cows to sell and meet the high demand of his customers.

loans.name: Mariya

texts.ru: Марии 59 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Марии - средне-специальное образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав много лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду Марии, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 9 коров, 7 лошадей и 40 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет до 35,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Мария обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 3 дойных коров для увеличения поголовья скота и объемов реализации домашнего, вкусного и очень полезного молока. Доходы от кредита Мария планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на проведение свадебного торжества для сына.
texts.en: Mariya is 59 years old, married and, together with her husband, raising 2 children. Mariya has a specialized secondary education and, to provide the primary income for her family, has been involved in animal husbandry and farming for many years. Thanks to Mariya's hard work, today her business contains 9 cows, 7 horses and 40 sheep. Her monthly income amounts to up to 35,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Mariya requested a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy 3 dairy cows to increase her livestock headcount and sales volume of home, delicious and very nutritious milk. Mariya plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increase her livestock quantities and savings money to hold a wedding for her son.

loans.use: to buy 3 dairy cows to increase her livestock headcount and sales volume of home, delicious and very nutritious milk

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is 30 years old and he is married with three children. He has had a cash crop and dairy farming business for five years. He will be using the loan to purchase a dairy cow and dairy feed, and hopes this will help him to increase milk production and generate more income to pay school fees for his children, and also to buy food for the family. His hopes and dreams for the future are to expand his farming business and become a large-scale farmer.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and dairy feed to increase his milk production to sell.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is from Gyumri, a town in the Shirak region, where she is involved in a retail business.

From her house, Anahit trades with different types of household appliances and has already been able to establish a loyal client base.

To be able to cover current orders of her clients and pay for required new stock of supplies, Anahit asks for this loan.

Her loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans to informal businesses that do not qualify through normal channels.

loans.use: to pay for supplies for her retail business (household appliances)

loans.name: Yoeurng's Group

texts.en:
A local resident living in the Kampong Cham province, Yoeurng is 61 years old and a mother of six children. She earns income to support her family’s living via teaching in school and working for others for a fee. She can earn income of about 14,700 KHR per day. 

This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of two to get a new loan. She will spend her loan portion to build her house. She hopes that she can improve her living conditions so they are better than before.

loans.use: To build her house.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Sokny's Group

texts.en:
Sokny, 33, lives with family members in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province. She has two children, one who is in school and one who is too young for school. 

For her family's living, she grows rice and drives a car to earn additional income. She has been involved this business for ages, and it earns her about 44,000 KHR per day. 

This is the third cycle for Sokny with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid her past loans. In her group of two, she is the group leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and seeds and to pay plowing fees. She hopes that she can earn more income to improve her house.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds, and to pay plowing fees.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Levan

texts.en:
Levan, who is a 31-year-old married man, lives in the capital of Georgia. He has a wife who is employed and gets a fixed salary. 

Levan was unable to find any stable job and started his own private activity. Particularly, he works as an artisan and generates insignificant income. He wants to start a more stable business that will help him to increase his income. 

According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the vulnerable poor category. Levan requested a loan from Credo to start up a new type of business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to poor people, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit, Tengiz plans to purchase a car and start providing taxi service. He will have costumers among local people and will make his work more productive for his family's welfare. 

Levan will be very grateful for the help and will highly appreciate it.

loans.use: To purchase a car and start a taxi business

loans.name: Marwa

texts.en:
Marwa is 25-year-old married mother one child. She has been running her beauty cream business from her house since February 2014, and is working hard to support her family's social and financial conditions. 
Marwa is acquiring a Youth Loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with special Mother's Day cosmetics, accessories and perfume collections.
She intends to increase her products and diversify her collection to open her own separate shop, and add clothes-selling in the future.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with special Mother's Day cosmetics, accessories and perfume collection.

loans.name: Ramziya

texts.en:
Ramziya is a 35-year-old married mother of two children. She has been working from her house selling women's accessories since 2012 to support her husband who traveled abroad seeking a better future for his beloved family with a better income business.

Ramziya is a hardworking lady with a very good reputation in her region. She is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business with a special Mother's Day collection (21st March) to make sure she can provide her customers with a wide diversified collection.

This is Ramziya's first loan experience from Al Majmoua, she intends to expand her business in the future through moving to a small shop to display her diversified collection properly and attract more customers.

loans.use: To increase her business with a special Mother's Day collection to make sure she can provide her customers with a wide, diversified collection

loans.name: Maaroufa

texts.en:
Maaroufa is a 54-year-old married mother of three children.  With her husband, she has run a convenience store in their village since 2012. They used to have a bakery, but they decided to shift to a business that required less effort because of their age.
Maaroufa is well known in her region and has a good reputation, attracting special customers all the time. She is working hard to develop their current business to make sure it can provide her family with a good income for a better living.
Thus, for this reason she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with seasonal products and to buy a refrigerator to cool the beverages at her shop.
She is willing to keep on expanding her business and diversifying her products, including a variety of special summer ice creams requested by her customers.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with seasonal products and to buy a refrigerator to cool the beverages at her shop

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia es una mujer de 27 años, vive con su pareja, sin hijos, y su negocio es la venta de locoto.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, optimista, generosa, amable, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la localidad de Sacaba. Un área rural caracterizada por la variedad de restaurantes de comida tradicional y por sus chicherías, donde se elabora y comercia la ‘Chicha’ (bebida fermentada de maíz), de clima templado con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 13 y 24 grados centígrados.
Lidia es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, ojos pardos, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Quechua que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica a la venta de verduras, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento y cuenta con energía eléctrica, no tiene alcantarillado ni agua potable, el agua la obtienen de un camión cisterna que ronda el lugar 2 veces por semana. Su negocio es la venta de locoto —del quechua rukutu o luqutu—, que es un fruto del género Capsicum utilizado como condimento picante en la cocina boliviana. Su color puede variar desde el rojo, verde naranjo o amarillo. Se comercializa en su estado natural como también en pasta y en polvo. Sus años de trabajo le brindaron frutos; logrando construir su casa de ladrillo y cemento, que consta de 2 cuartos, 1 baño, una cocina y una lavandería, el lugar es una zona rural donde la mayoría de los pobladores extraen agua de pozos mediante bombas y otras formas más precarias, el agua obtenida es de color rojizo y debe ser tratada antes de ingerirla. “trabajo desde muy niña, mis padres cultivan el locoto que yo me encargo de vender, construí mi casa y quiero instalar agua potable para algún día formar una familia y darles todo lo que necesitan para vivir…” comenta. Su sueño es terminar de construir su casa, ella desea realizar la instalación de agua potable, en su cocina, baño y lavandería para formar una familia y darle las condiciones básicas de vida. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que construye su casa.
Es por esos motivos que Lidia solicita un préstamo para la instalación de agua potable en su cocina, baño y lavandería para poder formar una familia en su hogar.
texts.en:
Lidia is a 27 year-old woman. She has no children, and lives with her partner. She sells locoto peppers.

She is enterprising, independent, optimistic, generous, pleasant, responsible, and hardworking. Her business is in the town of Sacaba. It is a rural area characterized by the variety of restaurants serving typical foods, and by the chicherías where Chicha, a beverage of fermented maize, is made and sold. The climate is temperate, with temperatures varying between 13 and 24 degrees centigrade.

Lidia is dark skinned and brown eyed, with long black hair she wears tied back. She is short and slim. Her native tongue is Quechua, which she speaks at home, while she speaks Spanish in her business and for general interactions. 

She shares her life with her partner, who sells vegetables. They live in their own home, which is built of brick and cement. It has electricity but no sewage system or potable water. They get their water from a tank truck, which comes by twice a week.

Her business is selling locoto peppers, (from the Quechua rukutu or luqutu), the fruit of the genus Capsicum, used as a spicy condiment in Bolivian cuisine. Its color can vary from red to green, orange or yellow. It is sold in its natural state and also as a paste or powder. 

Her years of work have yielded results: she has been able to build her own brick and cement home, which consists of 2 rooms, one bathroom, a kitchen and a laundry room. It is in a rural area where most of the inhabitants get water from wells, using pumps and other less reliable methods. The water is reddish in color and it must be treated before drinking.

“I’ve worked ever since I was a child. My parents grow the locoto that I sell. I built my home, and I want to install potable water so that one day I may start a family and give them everything they need to live well…”, she says.

Her dream is to finish building her house. She hopes to install potable water in her kitchen, bathroom and laundry room so she can start a family and give them basic living conditions. This is the first loan cycle with the institution in the 3 years she’s been building her house.

These are the reasons that Lidia is requesting a loan to install potable water in her kitchen, bathroom and laundry room, in order to start a family in her home.

loans.use: to install potable water in her kitchen, bathroom, and laundry room, in order to be able to start a family in her home.

loans.name: Albina

texts.ru: Альбина, 33 года, замужем. У Альбины 3 детей. На протяжении 7 лет она занимается полеводством и животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду Альбины в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 4 коровы, 2 лошади и 5 овец. Дополнительно Альбина ежегодно сажает люцерну и картофель, сеют культуры на 1,60 Га земли. Также предоставляет услуги общественного питания. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Альбина обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы для продажи экологически чистого молока и семян картофеля. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение домашней скотины.
texts.en: Albina is 33 years old, married and has three children. For seven years, she has been growing farm crops and raising livestock. Thanks to Albina’s hard work, she now has four cows, two horses and five sheep on her farm. In addition, Abina plants sainfoin [a plant used for animal fodder] and potatoes   on a land plot of 1.6 ha [four acres] every year. Albina also cooks food for sale. In order to develop her business further, Albina has applied to the Bai Tushum microfinance institution for a loan in the amount of 150,000 KGS to buy a dairy cow, so as to sell environmentally clean milk, as well as potato seeds.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow and potato seeds   in order to sell eco-friendly products.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 44 years old and is married with eight children. He has had a farming business for five years. He will be using the loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer and dairy feed, and hopes this will help him get more farm produce to sell and increase his income. 

He will use the generated income to pay school fees and enlarge his farming business by buying more farm inputs. His hopes and dreams for the future are to grow more cash crops and generate more income to support his family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and dairy feed for more farm produce to sell.

loans.name: Mamuka

texts.en:
Mamuka is a 40-year-old married man from the village of Dilikauri. He lives with his wife and two sons, who are temporarily unemployed.

To take care of his family’s everyday needs, Mamuka is engaged in dairy farming. He  sells the dairy products in the local market, which is the main source of the family’s income. They find it hard to cover even basic needs and live with poverty.

Mamuka decided to start his own business, which will be profitable for his family, and to seek for credit among local credit providers. His loan application was approved within the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program gives a chance to rural people living with poverty, to start or re-start businesses.

So Mamuka will purchase a car with the requested amount and will start selling used clothing door-to-door in his village and nearby villages. He will purchase a stock of clothing at wholesale prices and will sell with price mark-ups.

His wife will also help Mamuka with the clothes trading business. They will be very thankful to all Kiva lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to purchase a car and start selling used clothing

loans.name: Mounir

texts.en:
Mounir is a 41-year-old married father of two children. He is a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. He started a year ago selling coffee and juices to cover the increasing needs and expenses of his family.
Mounir is a hard worker and ambitious man who is trying hard to develop his business. He is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a car which will help him transport goods easily.
Mounir hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a car to help him transport goods easily

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase expensive medications.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
From Batasan Quezon City, Vivian has been an active member of CCT for years now, and she was able to acquire several loans to make good profits from her business. At the age of 51, she is helping her husband to provide for their daily needs. She was inspired to improve their lives because she wants to give her family the best for their future. She works hard each day, and she is quite sure that she is closer to reaching her goals.

Vivian owns a variety store. She believes that business is her stepping stone of making her dreams become reality. She knows how important it is for her neighbors and daily consumers to have a nearby store where they can buy a sachet of shampoo, a bar of soap, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, an egg, a toothpaste, or even an ice tube. She gets her products from a wholesaler at a lower price, and then she sells them, by the piece, for a higher price to make a profit.

She desires to manage a bigger store someday, so she is requesting an PHP 8,000 loan, which she will use to buy additional groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She is positive that she will become a successful businesswoman in the future through all of her hard work and perseverance.

Vivian meets up with her fellowship group* to share stories of her life and business every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries and other supplies she needs to display in her store.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en: Sakina is 42 years old and married. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing goods from the market and dealing with customers by sitting at the shop. The store has become popular in their community for providing good quality products. They earn enough to meet the expenses of their two children. She is requesting a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase more grocery items, including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea to satisfy customer demand and increase income. She is positive about her future earnings and will spend part of her income to buy more items for her store.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea to satisfy customer demand and increase income.

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en: Sughran is a 60-year-old married woman running a business selling milk. She has been in business for many years with the help of her husband. She has buffalos for milking. She sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay her family’s expenses. She has seven children. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children. She has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation. She has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR  to purchase one more buffalo to increase milk sales to earn good income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions for her children.

loans.use: To purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales to earn more income

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en:
Sughran is a 40-year-old married woman, who she has six children. Sughran is very skilled in the art of hand embroidery and has been using this skill for many years to earn a living. She can make beautiful designs and patterns with her hands. Her skill is known throughout the town. 

She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. This loan will enable her to purchase more beads, threads, and frames to meet the orders of her customers on time, to earn good amount of profits. This monetary help can take Sughran closer to her dream of providing quality education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more beads, threads, and frames to meet the orders of her customers on time, to earn a good amount of profits.

loans.name: Khachik

texts.en:
Khachik is from Agarakadzor village of Vayots Dzor region, where he lives with his parents.

Khachik rents a small garage where he provides auto repair and selling business to locals in region. 

Now, in order to purchase a damaged car to sell its spare parts, Khachik has applied for this loan. His loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans to informal businesses that do not qualify through normal channels.

loans.use: to purchase a damaged car to sell its spare parts

location.town: Agarakadzor village of Vayots Dzor region

loans.name: Yehowa Akwe 2 Group

texts.en:
The borrower, Gifty, has been working in retail for the past 10 years. She has been a member of this group for five years. She is 46 years old, and an experienced entrepreneur. She is also married with three grown up children, all of whom are on their own. 

Gifty sells used plastic chairs, tables, bowls, and blenders and she displays her merchandise at her markets. She is requesting a loan from ID Ghana in order to expand her business. She is going to buy plastic chairs, tables, bowls, and blenders which she will sell to customers at the market. 

She started her business with some money received from her husband. In the future, she would like to buy a plot of land and build on it. 

She thanks ID Ghana for its support of women entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system, and for granting them loans without any collateral guarantee. She, together with her colleagues, who are selling slippers, groceries, sauce pans, silver bowls, and gari (cassava flour), need a total amount of GHS 7,600 to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy plastic chairs, tables, bowls, and blenders which she will sell to customers at the market.

loans.name: Marium

texts.en:
Marium is 33 years old, a married woman, and a mother of three children. She has been doing a business of tailoring for many years to support her husband. She accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of household, with the educational needs of her children. That is why she started tailoring at home to support her family as well. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Now she has requested for a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase more reels of threads, packs of buttons, ribbons, and laces to meet the orders on time. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Marium hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of threads, packs of buttons, ribbons, and laces to meet the orders on time.

loans.name: Tasleem

texts.en:
Tasleem is 40 years old, and a hardworking woman who has four children. She has been providing the service of stitching clothes in her locality. She is quite popular for her skills in stitching. Tasleem ’s work brought the family out of a financial crisis that they were facing when she started working. Over the years, she has established a good clientele. 

Tasleem has requested a loan amount 40,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan to purchase a new stitching machine, some spools of threads, and laces to consistently meet the demands of her customers. She aspires to save money for their prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine, some spools of threads, and laces to consistently meet the demands of her customers.

loans.name: Tamas

texts.en:
Tamas is a farmer in the village of Ruisi in the Kareli region. His main source of income is the cultivation and sale of cabbage. He plants the seedlings by hand, which means plenty of hard work. But that is not a problem for Tamas because he loves his work.

The loan allows him to buy cabbage seedlings. Furthermore, he will be able to buy pipes and improve the irrigation for his field. This will reduce the risk of harvest loss in dry summers.

The repayments for this loan are scheduled in a way that allows Tamas to first sell his cabbage on the market and then repay the loan from the money he earns.

loans.use: to buy cabbage seedlings and irrigation pipes in order to have a good harvest.

loans.name: Teresiah

texts.en:
Hello, Kiva Lenders! Meet Teresiah from Kapsowar, Kenya, a woman from a community not known for farming, but one who is earning a living through agriculture. She is happily married and, together with her husband, is blessed with a lovely family.

For the past 10 years, Teresiah has been practicing mixed farming and, due to the experience she has, commands a lot of respect from fellow farmers who regard her as a mentor. Selling milk, eggs and vegetables has allowed her to earn a decent income. To make extra money, Teresiah also engages in a small personal business.

Teresiah passionately loves dairy farming, and one of the animals on her farm has been given a nickname. Milking and feeding her cow makes her very proud. Through milk selling, she has had quite good returns, and the demand for milk has been expanding.

Because demand has been overwhelming, Teresiah is requesting a loan to buy a quality dairy cow, a distinct breed that is easy to manage and has a natural ability to produce 5-10 litres of rich, creamy milk daily. The increased milk production will result in more income, and Teresiah will be able to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Kumba

texts.en:
Kumba is 29 years old. He is married with 2 children. He has had a cash crop farming business for 5 years and it has been profitable. 

He will be using the loan to purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer and hopes this will help him get more farm produce to  sell and generate more income. He will use the profits to educate his children and buy more farm inputs. 

His hopes and dreams for the future are to expand his farming business and become the largest producer of wheat in the area.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Erik Reynaldo

texts.es:
Erik es un hombre joven de 26 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos, y trabaja como mototaxi. 
Él es emprendedor, independiente, de buena actitud, optimista, responsable y trabajador. Su trabajo lo desarrolla en la zona Sur de la Ciudad, dicha zona se caracteriza por su gran densidad poblacional y cuyas principales actividades económicas son las de comercio y manufactura, de clima templado casi todo el año con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 18-25 grados centígrados.
Erik es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, ojos obscuros, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Quechua que habla en familia y con los amigos y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su negocio es el transporte como mototaxi que significa; “motocicleta que se usa como medio de transporte popular para trechos cortos” a cambio de dinero de la misma forma que un taxi. Inicio su negocio con la ayuda de un amigo que realiza el mismo trabajo. “trabajo como mototaxi desde hace 2 años, y la zona donde trabajo es un lugar comercial con mucho movimiento diario…” comenta. Su sueño es tener su propio negocio con varias motocicletas. Debido al constante uso de su moto esta se encuentra averiada y necesita cambio de repuestos, él desea realizar mantenimiento a su motocicleta para poder trabajar y ayudar con los gastos en su hogar. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Erik solicita un préstamo para arreglar su motocicleta para trabajar como mototaxi y ayudar a pagar los gastos de su familia
texts.en:
Erik is a 26-year old young man who is single and has no children.  He works as a "mototaxi" driver. 
Erik is enterprising, independent, optimistic, responsible, hard-working and has a good attitude.  He works in the southern area of the city.  The area is characterized by its large population density.  The main businesses there are shops and manufacturing.  The climate is temperate and varies between 18 and 25 degrees centigrade during the day.  
Erik has dark skin, short, black hair and dark eyes.  He is short and thin.  Erik's first language is Quechua, which he speaks with his family and friends.  He speaks Spanish with the general population and in the work he does.  
Erik's business is providing transportation as a "mototaxi" driver, which means “using a motorcycle as a means of transporting people for short distances" in exchange for money, just like a taxi.  He started the business with the help of a friend who is also a "mototaxi" driver.  "I have worked as a 'mototaxi' driver for two years, and the area where I work is commercial with a lot of daily activity..." Erik says.  His dream is to have is own business with a number of motorcycles.  
Since he uses his motorcycle constantly, its is currently broken down and needs some replacement parts so Erik can continue working and help with the household expenses.  This is Erik's first lending cycle with the institution in the two years that he has been working in this business. 
This is the reason Erik is requesting a loan- to fix his motorcycle so he can keep working as a "mototaxi" driver and help with his family's expenses.

loans.use: to fix his motorcycle so he can work as a "mototaxi" driver and help with his family's expenses.

loans.name: Chhai's Group

texts.en:
Chhai, age 52, grows and harvests rice and corn to earn an income. She has been engaged in this business for many years and is able to earn about 30,000 KHR per day. She lives with her four children in the province of Siem Reap. 

This is Chhai's fifth cycle with Kiva partner VisionFund, and she has fully repaid her previous loans. She is the leader of a group of two members, and she will use her loan portion to build a decent latrine for her home. 

Her goal is to improve her family's overall health and standard of living.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine for her family

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Rani

texts.en:
Rani is a happily married woman. Some years ago, she decided to support her family by starting a business of tailoring at her home, as her husband’s income was barely enough to meet their day-to-day expenses. Rani is popularly known in her area for her stitching skills. However, due to a shortage of raw materials, she is facing difficulty in meeting daily expenses related to her business. 

Therefore, she has requested a loan of PKR 40,000. With the requested loan, she wants to purchase stitching materials, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth to stitch up more dresses on time, to generate a healthy income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase stitching materials, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth to stitch up more dresses on time, to generate a healthy income for her family.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is 28 and is a married woman and a mother of 4 children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. 

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business; currently she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR  to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earn profits so she can provide her family with the basic necessities of life.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house neither has electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past four years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation.

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: With God Group

texts.en:
These members are part of the group called With God and are beginning their fifth loan cycle with ID-Ghana. The group is made up of three members who are involved in the sale of ladies shoes, second hand goods and cooking rice and stew. The loan they are taking out will benefit these small entrepreneurs, one of whom is Janet. 

She says that she joined ID-Ghana three years ago, at the invitation of a relative who was a client of the institution. At present, Janet has a business selling sandals and ladies shoes. She began this business with the eight loans that she obtained through ID-Ghana. The loan that she will obtain this time is to increase her capital for the purchase of more sandals and ladies shoes from the market at a wholesale price. Later, she will sell these sandals and ladies shoes to her clients at another small market. 

This kind of work enables her to generate resources to assist her family, since she is married and has no children. When she was asked what she liked about ID-Ghana, she replied that she was pleased with the loan and with the training that the institution offers her.

loans.use: To purchase of more sandals and ladies shoes from the market at a wholesale price.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is 40 years old and is a married woman. She has been in a beauty parlor business for many years. She offers many facilities to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials. Over time she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. 

She needs to have more customers time after time. That is why she has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR through Kashf Foundation. It will allow her to purchase combs, hair straighteners, make up kits and cleansers so she can treat many customers at a time and earn more revenue for running her household activities efficiently. 

She is very experienced in her business and confident that her business will move in a positive direction as a result of the loan investment.

loans.use: to purchase combs, hair straighteners, make up kits, and cleansers.

loans.name: Aziz

texts.en:
Aziz is 47 years old, a married woman, and a mother of six children. She has been doing a business of tailoring for many years to support her husband. She accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of household, with the educational needs of her children. That is why she started tailoring at home to support her family as well. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Now she has requested a loan of 55,000 PKR to purchase more reels of threads, packs of buttons, ribbons, and laces to meet the orders on time. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Aziz  hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of threads, packs of buttons, ribbons, and laces to meet the orders on time.

loans.name: Al Mahaba Kayfoun Group

texts.en:
Rowaida, age 31 (pictured at left), is the featured borrower for the Al Mahaba Kayfoun group. She joined her other group members to request a loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. All three are working hard to develop their businesses and and improve their families' standard of living.
 
Rowaida and her husband have three children. She opened her grocery store four years ago in order to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family. She is trying hard to develop her business, which is why she is requesting a loan from Kiva field partner Al Majmoua. The loan funds will allow her to increase her business merchandise with new, frequently requested products to satisfy customer demand. 
 
The other two borrowers are Fatima and Sawsan. Fatima (pictured in the middle), age 37, and her husband have three children. Fatima requires necessary dental treatment as the result of an accident.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with new, frequently requested products to satisfy customer demand

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson, age 38, farms wheat to earn an income. He has been engaged in this business for eight years. He and his wife have four children.

He will be using his loan funds to purchase fertilizer and seeds for use on his farm, so that he can grow more wheat to offer for sale and thereby increase his income. He hopes that this will help him educate his children and expand his farming business. 

His hopes and dreams for the future are to grow more wheat and generate more income by building an ever more sustainable farming business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds for use on his farm

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience sells cosmetics to earn an income, selling her goods on a retail basis to her neighbors and to passers-by. Her primary business challenge is the high cost of transportation. She has one child, who attends school. The family lives in a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.
 
Patience dreams of establishing a retail shop business in the future. She decided to join Yehu to boost her business. With her loan funds, she intends to purchase a stock of cosmetic items to offer for sale.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of cosmetic items to offer for sale

loans.name: Shah  Begum

texts.en:
Shah Begum is 30 years old, married, and six children. She operates a business selling milk, which she has been doing for many years with the help of her husband. She has buffaloes for milking purpose and she sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. 

Shah Begum requested another loan from Kashf Foundation for 45,000 PKR, which she will use to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales. She hopes to earn additional income to provide better living conditions to her children.

loans.use: to purchase a buffalo

loans.name: Kishwar

texts.en:
Kishwar is 49 years old, married, and has children. After her marriage, she felt that she should support her husband to improve their financial condition so she started a business selling cloth. Kishwar  is famous among her neighbors for her collections and has a good client list. 

Kishwar requested a loan for 45,000 PKR, which she will use to purchase good quality cloth of different colors to earn substantial profits. This loan will help her to live a decent life, improve her standard of living, and provide for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase good quality cloth of different colors

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 45-year-old widow woman. She has been in the work of hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home.

To help her to continue her operation, Shamim has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR  to buy spools of threads in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for its embellishment.  This will allow her to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful to get an increase in her income by targeting more customers. Shamim dreams for her bright future and desires to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy spools of threads in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for its embellishment

loans.name: Uzma

texts.en:
Uzma is 33, a married woman and a mother of 3 children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality.

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. Currently she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR  to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earn profits for providing her family with the basic necessities of life.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earn profits for providing her family with the basic necessities of life

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase root vegetables.

loans.name: Kimaren

texts.en:
Kimaren is 30 years old and he is married with two children. He has had a farming business for three years. He will be using the loan to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer and seeds for planting in his farm to get more farm produce to sell. 

He hopes this will help him to educate his children by paying for their school fees, and also to improve the living standards of his family. His hopes and dreams for the future are to have a sustainable farming business and a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer and seeds to get more farm produce to sell to support his family.

loans.name: Artak

texts.en:
Artak lives with his mother in Eghegnadzor town. He trades with food and drinking products in a small rented space in town. He is hardworking and does his best to run his retail business successfully and earn income for living. 

To be able to purchase supplies for selling in the store, Artak asked for this loan. His loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans to informal businesses that do not qualify through normal channels.

loans.use: to pay for supplies to sell in the store.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 44 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family.

She runs a business by selling milk, Milo, rice, egg, sugar, canned drinks, boxed drinks and slippons in Teshie, Accra. She has been selling milk, Milo, rice, eggs, sugar, canned drinks, boxed drinks and slippons for 5 years. Elizabeth has requested a loan of 1,200 GHS through ID Ghana to buy more milk, Milo, rice, egg, sugar, canned drinks, boxed drinks and slippons to sell. She has borrowed and repaid 2 loans from ID Ghana before this loan.

Elizabeth aspires to save enough money so she can afford to take care of herself.

loans.use: to buy more milk, Milo, rice, eggs, sugar, canned drinks, boxed drinks and slippons to sell.

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma is a 46-year-old married woman, who has had a business of buying and selling animals with the help of her husband for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of seven children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with a good education, food and clothing. 

She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater more customers.

loans.name: Nurila

texts.ru: Нурила 50 лет, замужем, есть 4 детей, супруг и дети активно помогают по хозяйству. У Нурилы высшее педагогическое образование, в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, она работает преподавателем, также на протяжении 11 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Нурилы в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы, 15 овец. Также есть земельный надел мерою 2,40 ГА собственной и 2,0 Га арендованной земли, где она выращивает помидоры, хлопок, фасоль, сезонно яблоки и сливы. Ежемесячный доход Нурилы от бизнес деятельности составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 1 дойной коровы для увеличения объемов реализации экологически чистого молока. Доходы от кредита Нурила планирует вкладывать в развитие бизнеса, в будущем это поможет ей посадить саженцы слив и яблонь.
texts.en:
Nurila is 50 and married with four children. Her husband and children actively help with the farm work. She has a higher education in pedagogy and works as a teacher as the primary source of income for her family. She has also been working in animal husbandry and agriculture for 11 years. Thanks to hear hard work, she currently has two cows and 15 sheep on her farm as well as 2.4 hectares of her own and 2 hectares of rented land where she grows tomatoes, cotton, beans, apples and plums. Her monthly business income is about 10,000 KGS.

With the goal of further developing her business, Nurila has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 KGS to purchase a dairy cow to increase her sales of organic milk. She plans to put profits from the loan into further developing her business, which will help her to plant plum and apple saplings in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow in order to increase her sales of organic milk

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is a 51-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband, who is also shown in the photo. He assists her by purchasing a stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is a mother of 2 children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health.
