She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy packs of salts, biscuits, rice, spices and juices to efficiently handle increasing demands of her customers to get a boost in her earnings for expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits, rice, spices and juices to efficiently handle the increasing demands of her customers

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is 36 years old and she is a married woman. 

She deals in a business selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. Parveen makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income.

Parveen needs to improve her business to be able to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more animals to inflate her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to inflate her sales

loans.name: Gita

texts.en:
Gita lives in Mestia in the mountain region of Svaneti together with her husband and their daughter. She has a small farm with two milk cows and a field. Thanks to the increasing number of tourists, there is a high demand for milk and cheese. So Gita decided to jump at the chance and improve their meager situation. 

With the help of the loan, she will buy three more milk cows to have more milk to generate more income for the family. Furthermore, she will use the loan to rent a hayfield where she can make hay for her cows.

loans.use: to buy three milk cows and rent a hayfield to increase the family's income.

loans.name: Basyam3 Group

texts.fr:
Honorine, membre représentatif est mère de 2 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle vend la boisson. les autres membres du groupe exercent dans plusieurs domaine d'activité. Ce groupe est à son 8ème contrat de prêt et les remboursements se font à bonne échéance. Elle a besoin de ce crédit pour acheter de la boisson pour satisfaire à la demande de sa clientèle.
 Après les ventes, son bénéfice lui permettra de s'occuper de ses enfants et de continuer son activité.
texts.en:
Honorine, the group's representative member, is the mother of two children, both of whom attend school. She sells drinks, and the other members of the group run several different types of businesses.

This group is on its eighth loan contract, and the[ir] repayments have been timely. Honorine needs this loan to purchase drinks in order to satisfy customer demand.

After her sales, Honorine's profit will allow her to care for her children and continue her business.

loans.use: To purchase drinks to sell.

loans.name: Mungu Ni Msaada Group

texts.en:
Adolphine (second from the right) is a 42 year old married mother of 8 children who has been working from her house since 2000. She sells charcoal and others small things like salt, sugar, staples for everyday life. Adolphine is a hardworking woman who supports her husband in covering their family's increasing living needs and children's education fees. Her business is going well, but unfortunately the acquired income is still not enough to cover unexpected living needs. 

Adolphinea loan from Kiva field partner Wezesha Project to do buy more charcoal for sales. From the profits she makes she wants to do the necessary maintenance at her house to keep it a healthy living place as well as her place of business. In addition to getting an iron main door for security reasons, she hopes that in the future she can open a separate shop outside her house, where she can display her merchandise in a way that will encourage people to buy from her, and improve sales. This is her 6th loan and everyone in the group has an excellent repayment records.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal

loans.name: Rasoolan

texts.en:
Rasoolan is a 43-year-old divorced woman and she has 3 children. She is a vigorous lady and for the past many years has been running a cloth purchase and sales business. She buys cloth in various fabrics in different colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. Rasoolan has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business.

Now, she has requested for a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan. Rasoolan expects a boost in her earnings with the loan and she plans to spend part of her profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business.

loans.name: Dalia

texts.en:
Dalia is a 24-year-old, married mother of two children, who has been working as a tutor from her house since 2006. She was only 15 when she started providing educational services, and is working hard to develop this career, so that one day she can open her own tutoring center outside of her house.

Currently, Dalia is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, in order to buy a new living room and curtains to keep her house a healthy living place and inviting to her students, so they can feel comfortable and be more creative. This is her first loan cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower. She hopes that her future relationship will end in establishing her own tutoring center.

loans.use: to buy a new living room and curtains to keep her house a healthy living place and inviting to her students.

loans.name: Mila 2 Group

texts.en:
Samar is the featured borrower for Mila 2 Group. She joined with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan, because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Samar is a 36-year-old, married mother of three children, who has worked as a cosmetics saleswoman for eight years to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family. She is a hardworking and ambitious lady who is trying hard to develop her business. Thus, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with a new collection of cosmetics. 

Samar is the first lady on the left of the photo. With respect to the other group members, Wahida is the first lady on the right and Badea is the lady in the middle.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with a new collection of cosmetics.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 37 years old, married, and has two children. She operates a tailoring business, which she has been doing for six years. 

Sarah requested her fourth loan from VisionFund Kenya for 36,000 KES, which she will use to purchase more stock of fabric materials for making dresses to meet the demand of her growing clientele. She hopes to expand her business and be stable financially.

loans.use: to purchase stock fabric materials for making dresses

loans.name: Ivan Mauricio

texts.es: Ivan tiene 30 alños de edad es soltero vivie solo en guaranda, provincia de Bolivar, el es mesero de la cevicheria el Mono de la ciudad de Guaranda solicita el credito para la compra de una refrigeradora ya que la que el tenia se le daño y necesita comprar en efectivo para que le hagan algun descuento, realizara la compra el el almacer Tia, Su sueño es tener un negocio propio de comidas rapidas, el desafio al que se enfrenta es formar una familia con mucho amor. En su tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte el fin de semana.
texts.en:
Ivan is 30 years old. He is single and lives in Guaranda in the province of Bolivar. He is a waiter at the El Mono ceviche restaurant in Guaranda. He requests this loan in order to purchase a refrigerator because his refrigerator broke. In order to receive a discount, he needs to purchase the refrigerator in cash. He will purchase the refrigerator at a store called Tia.

His dream is to own a fast food restaurant. A challenge that he faces is forming a family with great love. In his free time on the weekends, he enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator.

loans.name: Mayasa

texts.en:
Mayasa is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has no piped water, but has electricity.  She has operated a coconut business, selling at the market to her local customers. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. In addition, she also sells clothes and maize at the local market.

With the KES 100,000 she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts, a bale of clothes, and four bags of maize to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts, a bale of clothes, and four bags of maize to sell.

loans.name: Dopoi

texts.en:
Dopoi is 28 years old and he is married with three children. He has had a wheat farming business for seven years. He will be using the loan to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer, pesticides, and seeds for planting in his farm, and hopes this will help him get more farm produce and generate more income. 

He will use the profits to educate his children and to buy more farm inputs. His hopes and dreams for the future are to have a prosperous farming business and a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer, pesticides, and seeds to help him get more income and educate his children.

loans.name: Nuvia Nathaly

texts.es: A sus 25 años de edad Nuvia es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos, el menor de 2 años y la mayor de 5 años y ya asiste a la escuela, Nuvia vive en la casa que le presta una prima, son 6 años que se dedica a la crianza de chanchos y por este motivo el crédito lo necesita para  comprar estos animales, la aspiración de Nuvia es mejorar su negocio y por ende sus ingresos para tener para la  mantención y cuidado de sus hijos.
texts.en: At 25-years old, Nuvia is the single mother of two children.  The youngest is 2-years old, and the eldest is 5-years old and goes to school.  Nuvia lives in a house that a cousin is lending to her.  For six years, Nuvia has made her living raising pigs, and that is why she needs the loan- to purchase pigs.  Nuvia's hope is to improve her business and therefore improve her income so she can support and take care of her children.

loans.use: to purchase pigs.

loans.name: Gabriela Del Carmen

texts.es: Gabriela es una señora casada, tiene 39 años de edad, ella tiene 3 hijos de las edades de 6, 13 y 17 años de edad mismos que están estudiando, el esposo de Gabriela trabaja de chofer, Gabriela se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, el crédito lo necesita para comprar chanchos y de esta manera mejorar su negocio, sus ingresos y cumplir con su aspiración que es de ver a sus hijos terminar sus estudios.
texts.en: Gabriela is a married woman who is 39-years old.  She has three children who are 6-, 13- and 17-years old respectively.  They all go to school.  Gabriela's husband works as a driver.  Gabriela makes her living raising small animals.  She needs the loan to purchase pigs so she can improve her business and her income and meet her goal of seeing her children complete their educations.

loans.use: to purchase pigs.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is from Goris town. She lives there with her husband and two school aged children.

Anahit is involved in the retail business to support her family. She trades in clothing supplies and shoes from her house. Over six years of experience in the retail business, allows Anahit to meet her clients' needs and acquire high quality products targeted for them. Anahit has now applied for this loan to purchase new stocks of clothing and shoes to cover her customers' orders.

Her loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans to informal businesses that do not qualify through normal channels.

loans.use: to pay for new stocks of clothing and shoes to cover her customers' orders.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 40-year-old, married woman with three dependent children. She sells waakye (cooked rice and beans) and stew. She has been doing this for eight years, on a pavement at her residence. Florence needs a loan to buy rice, beans, oil and other ingredients to prepare waakye and stew to sell to customers. 

The profits will be used to pay for household expenses, and to help pay for her children's education. She became a member of ID-Ghana in March 2014, to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil and other ingredients to prepare waakye and stew to sell to customers.

loans.name: Fofo

texts.en:
Fofo is 42 years old and single with two children. Fofo works hard to provide for her children. She runs a smoked fish business in Ghana. She requested a GHS 1,300 loan through ID-Ghana to purchase more fish and firewood to smoke fish to sell to customers.

Fofo has borrowed and repaid four loans from ID-Ghana before this loan. She has been running this business for six years. Fofo aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to higher education.

loans.use: to purchase more fish and firewood to smoke fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS está en su ciclo número 2do del programa de comité de mujeres, donde desarrollan el trabajo en equipo y la ayuda solidaria. Todas forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, para poder conocer la situación de vida de cada una y conforme a ello poder ir mejorando.
La Sra. Lorena, es una  las integrantes quien se dedica a las ventas en su copetín, es una persona muy sacrificada, que cada día empieza su jornada de trabajo desde muy temprano en el día. Ella comenta que empezó con muy poco, y poco a poco se fue abriendo camino y hoy en día ya tiene muy buena clientela, y con este negocio ayuda a su familia y a sus seres queridos.
La Sra. Lorena solicita de este préstamo para la compra de mesas, sillas, cubiertos, manteles y otros elementos que hacen de su copetín un lugar agradable para desayunar, almorzar y merendar.
texts.en:
The MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS communal bank is in its second loan cycle with the Women's Committee Program, where the members develop teamwork and mutual support skills. The group is taking part in the poverty elimination program, which lets its members know their individual living situation so that they can act accordingly to keep improving.

Lorena is one of the members. She makes a living running a fast food counter. She is a very selfless person, whose working day begins. She mentions that she started her business with very little and worked her way slowly but surely. Now, she has a good customer base. Through her business she supports her family and her loved ones.

Lorena is asking for a loan to buy tables, chairs, cutlery, tablecloths, and other items, a purchase that will make her restaurant an inviting place to have breakfast, lunch, and dinner.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, cutlery, tablecloths, and other items

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.es:
Rodrigo es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, está estudiando la carrera de contabilidad. Su sueño es poder terminar la carrera de contabilidad y auditoria; y empezar a ejercerlo, y de a poco abrir un negocio con lo cual pueda tener un hogar y una familia.
El pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: Rodrigo is from the city of Carapegua. He says that he is studying Accounting. His dream is to finish his Accounting and Auditing career, and to start working, so he can soon open a business and have his own home and family. He is requesting this loan to pay for his tuition payments, and in this way continue with his studies as he has been doing so far.

loans.use: To pay for his college tuition.

loans.name: Parselian

texts.en:
Parselian is 39 years old and he is married with four children. He has had a farming cash crop business for seven years and it has been profitable. He will be using the loan to purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer, and hopes this will help him get more farm produce to sell. 

He will use the generated income to educate his children and expand his farming business by buying more farm inputs. His hopes and dreams for the future are to grow more cash crops such maize and vegetables, and to have a good farming business and a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer to help him get more farm produce to sell.

loans.name: Nayade Del Socorro

texts.es: Nayibe de 47 años de edad, se dedica al oficio de confecciones de ropa en general y decoraciones desde hace 14 años. Ella estudió diseño de modas y después gerencia básica  de microempresas; por eso empezó primero trabajando como coordinadora de impulso y durante las noches se dedicaba a diseñar y así fue como comenzó su negocio; cuando con su propia experiencia como empleada inició la organización de su propio taller de confecciones, aplicando los principios administrativo, técnicos y tecnológicos aprendidos en la universidad además de ser  apoyada por su madre.  Hoy Nayibe ofrece a su clientela ropa en general, para damas, caballeros e infantil, y elabora lindos disfraces, producto que tiene sus picos más altos de venta en las temporadas de carnaval y como son de mucha calidad y con precios accesibles al público logra  permanentemente ganar más clientes.   Sus ventas las realiza de contado y a crédito con una frecuencia quincenal en los horarios de 9 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche, sus compras las realiza de contado en almacenes especializados que venden insumos de confecciones y accesorios. Como meta se propone más adelante,  tener una boutique y ganar mucho más para  lograr apoyar la educación universitaria de sus hijas, potencializando así su éxito futuro. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará  una máquina industrial, una fileteadora y una máquina recubridora; con toda esta inversión mejorará los tiempos productivos y la calidad será mucho más visible en el internet, medio por el cual comercializa en forma directa a almacenes y misceláneas los  artículos que con su creatividad produce.
texts.en:
Nayada, who is 47 years old, has made clothing in general and decorations for 14 years. She studied fashion design and then basic micro-business management. For this reason, she began at first working as a sales promoter, and during the nights she worked on design. This was how she began her business, when, with her own experience as an employee, she began the organization of her own sewing workshop, applying the administrative principles, techniques, and technologies learned at the university, in addition to being supported by her mother. Now Nayada offers her customers clothing in general for women, men, and infants, and she makes pretty costumes, products that have their highest sales peaks in the carnival season, and as they are of high quality and at affordable prices for the public, she manages to permanently win more customers.

She makes her sales for cash and on credit with biweekly payments. Her hours are from 9 in the morning to 8 at night. She makes her purchases for cash in the specialty stores that sell supplies for clothing and accessories. She proposes as a future goal to have a boutique and earn much more to be able to support the university education of her daughters, thus reinforcing their future success. 

She is now applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing that she has had from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy an industrial sewing machine, an overlock machine, and a coverstitch machine. With all this investment, she will improve her production times and the quality will be much more visible on the internet, the medium through which she sells the articles that her creativity produces directly to stores and corner shops.

loans.use: to buy an industrial sewing machine, an overlock machine, and a coverstitch machine

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy firewood

loans.name: Lenkoko

texts.en:
Lenkoko is 34 years old and is married with 6 children.

Lenkoko has had a wheat farming business for 6 years. He will be using the loan to purchase farm inputs like fertilizer and seeds. He hopes this will help him get more farm produce to sell and make more income. He will use the generated income to educate his children and expand the farming business.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to have a big and profitable farming business and a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs like fertilizer and seeds to help him get more farm produce to sell.

loans.name: Sikinan

texts.en:
Sikinan is 37 years old and is married with four children. She has had a wheat farming business for six years. She will be using the loan to purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer, and hopes this will help her get more farm produce to sell and get more income.

She will use the generated profits to educate her children and renovate the family's house. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a good farming business and a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer, so she can get more farm produce to sell to help her educate her children.

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael is a married woman with five children. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. She has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is a needlewoman from Gyumri town, where she lives with her parents and her elderly, retired grandmother.

Anahit receives orders from local people living in Gyumri town for sewing clothing and household supplies. She works hard and provides high quality service for her customers.

Anahit has applied for this loan to purchase a sewing machine. Her loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans to informal businesses that do not qualify through normal channels.

The sewing machine which Anahit owns now, is old and needs to be changed with the new and better one, so your support is very important for her.

loans.use: to pay for a sewing machine.

loans.name: Zhenya

texts.en:
Zhenya lives in Gyumri with her husband and two school-age children. Zhenya's husband is now a migrant worker in a neighbouring country and tries to support his family's living.

To tackle the financial hardships, Zhenya started her own retail business 17 years ago. She trades in clothing supplies from her house. She brings the selling products from a neighbouring country at the beginning of each season.

Zhenya has applied for this loan to ask lenders to support her in purchasing new stock of clothing supplies for the spring season.

Her loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans to informal businesses that do not qualify through normal channels.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of clothing supplies for the spring season.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a woman eager to get ahead. She is 38 years old and is blessed with 4 adorable children. She lives with her large family in the Nandihills area of Kenya. Her children are her greatest motivation to persevere in life, because she wants to provide them with a better future.

Ann was unable to study to get a professional career because of the economic situation that her family faced. However, she never gave up and she has been practicing farming for the past 15 years. She always says, “I have always had an affinity for farming, and it runs in my blood.”

Ann is kindly seeking a loan to buy cereals. Through the loan, she will be able to buy cereals for resale. Nandihills area has a ready market for cereals and therefore Ann will never have a problem in selling her produce. Ann is very visionary and she plans to increase her farming business. All this can be achieved through lenders’ help and goodwill.

Ann believes that through the loan, she will turn around her family life and be able to give her children a solid educational background. This loan will be Ann’s way out of the poverty bracket that she is in currently.

loans.use: to buy cereals to sell.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married mother of two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over three years, she has operated an open-air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. In addition, she also owns an mpesa shop. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the KES 100,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel, estudio hasta noveno grado de educacion básica, está casado y su pareja trabaja en los oficios domesticos y tiene una tienda, tiene tres hijos, que viven en casa.

Isabel, tiene negocio de tienda, lo ha hecho por más de 5 años y lo aprendio por motivación de su esposa y decidio hacerlo para buscar un ingreso economico extra, para el sustento de la familia.- Tambien trabaja con ganado y venta de pan en las tiendas de los cantones vecinos, antes solo era empleado. 

Isabel, necesita el crédito para compara productos para la tienda, esto mejorara mucho su negocio porque podra comprar variedad de productos y esto le permite obtener mayores ganancias.

Sus sueños son poder trabajar fuerte para buscar un mejor futuro para su familia y espera que sus hijos se preparen academicamente.
texts.en:
Isabel only studied until ninth grade. He's married with three children that still live at home and his wife takes care of the house chores.  Isabel has had a store for more than 5 years which he started due to his wife's motivation to obtain additional income for supporting his family.  He also works with cattle and sells bread in the nearby neighborhoods, but before he was only an employee.  
Isabel needs the loan to buy more products for his store which will improve business by buying a greater of products and thus obtaining a better income.  His dream is to work hard so he can obtain a better future for his family and he hopes that his children can be prepared academically.

loans.use: to buy products for his store.

loans.name: Margarit

texts.en:
Margarit is a furniture maker from Gyumri town. She is involved in the manufacturing business together with her husband, who helps her a lot. Margarit's children attend the local school and her mother in-law is elderly and retired.

In their small, rented garage, Margarit and her husband receive different orders for furniture making and work hard to meet their clients' demands.

The loan is important for Margarit to purchase tools and raw materials needed for their work. Her loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans to informal businesses that do not qualify through normal channels.

Margarit and her family rely on your support and trust, because the loan will help them to cover current orders and earn an income for living.

loans.use: to pay for tools and raw materials for making furniture

loans.name: Mevlide

texts.en:
Mevlide is very grateful to the lenders for the loan, which she used to provide food for her bees so that they can produce a higher quantity of honey. She loves what she does and hopes to be able to continue her unique and special business. 

She was very satisfied with the loan process and the results, and is therefore asking once again for a second loan in order to purchase more food for the bees, to purchase more bees and a place to keep them. This loan will help her to continue her business, expand it even further, and allow her to provide for her family. She promises to again pay on time and is very grateful for the continued support.

loans.use: to purchase bees and more food for the bees, and a place to keep them.

loans.name: Guerilleras Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario, es mixto está conformado por un hombre y 2 mujeres emprendedoras (JULIO CESAR, GLENDA y MARLENI) de la  ciudad de Bilwi, Puerto Cabezas. Se organizaron hace aproximadamente dos años, con el propósito de trabajar de manera solidaria para accesar a préstamos en Pana Pana y tener la oportunidad de mejorar sus pequeños negocios, aumentar sus ingresos y así mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias.

MARLENI: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario, es una señora jovial de 36 años de edad, casada con 4 hijos en edad escolar. Tiene varios años de experiencia como pequeña comerciante, vende fito y tiene una pequeña pulpería en el corredor de su casa de tambo de madera, de esta manera contribuye con los gastos del hogar y estudios de sus hijos. Solicita financiamiento para comprar insumos e ingredientes para elaborar frito, chiverías, granos básicos, entre otros productos. Ella sueña con ser una comerciante exitosa.
texts.en:
This is a mixed solidarity group since it consists of one man and two women entrepreneurs (Julio Cesar, Glenda, and Marleni) who are from the city of Bilwi, Puerto Cabezas. They organized their group approximately two years ago so that they could work together and access loans offered by Pana Pana. This will give them the opportunity to improve their small business, increase their incomes, and improve the quality of life for their families.

Marleni is the solidarity group coordinator. She is a cheerful woman who is 36 years old, married, and has four children who are of school age. Marleni has several years of experience as a small merchant. She sells fried foods and has a small store set up on the porch of her wooden stilt house. This enables her to contribute toward the household expenses and her children’s education.

Marleni is requesting a loan in order to buy supplies and ingredients for preparing fried foods, as well as yogurts, basic grains, and other products. She dreams of being a successful merchant.

loans.use: to buy supplies and ingredients for preparing fried foods, as well as yogurts, basic grains, and other products to sell.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is retired but she is working by herself. She takes care of the internet business of her son. Victoria needs a loan to fix the internet cafe computers because they need repairing. 

Victoria is a widow and she has two sons. Victoria used to be a nurse and that is a job that requires patience, something that is very useful  when you are looking after the internet business

loans.use: to fix the computers because they need repair

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara is an enthusiastic cook she makes fast food (hot dogs, hamburgers), she is a single mother of one son (the kid that is in the picture with her), and she takes care of her grandma (the only relative that she has).
Tamara needs a loan to buy a refrigerator to maintain the food fresh. Tamara has a stand where she sells food in the street (she is in front of it in the picture) and she hopes you can help her because she doesn't have anyone that can help her.
She is healthy she works hard and she promises that she will give her best to her business. The refrigerator will be at her house.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Samoeun

texts.en:
SamOeun(Shown in photo) is 37 years old , lives at Chroy Changva district, Phnom Penh ,Cambodia.
She had been married since 1998, has one son and three daughters. They are still young.

SamOeun is a cleaner for one year in her experience at private company while her husband is a Tuk Tuk driver for two years. She is applying for a loan to purchase a motorbike and repair her house. She wants to buy a motorbike for take to her work. Nowadays, she carried by his husband to work everyday.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and repair her house.

location.town: Chroy Changva district Phnom Penh city

loans.name: Eduarda

texts.es:
La señora Eduarda tiene 51 años de edad, su esposo es comerciante y ella se dedica a la ventas de artesanías en ao poi, un tejido típico paraguayo. Tiene 3 hijos con su esposo, por quienes ambos están luchando.
Eduarda desde joven empezó a realizar trabajos de artesanía en a poi, es un tejido fino autentico, originario de la región, se confeccionan del mismo blusas llamadas typoi, atuendo típico  de la danza de paraguaya. 
Recurre al préstamo para invertir en la compra de telas de ao poi en fardos, para poder cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Eduarda is 51 years old and her husband is a business man. She makes a living selling "Ao Po'i", a traditional Paraguayan handcraft. She has 3 children with her husband for which they are working hard to get ahead. Eduarda started very young to make “Ao Po'i ” crafts, it’s a fine authentic weave from the region. They make shirts with it called “Typói”, the traditional attire of the Paraguayan dance. 

She requests the loan to invest in the purchase of "Ao Po'i"  material in bulk to be able to meet with the orders from her customers.

loans.use: to buy ao poi fabric in bulk.

loans.name: Kuña Aty Group

texts.es:
El comité se denomina KUÑA ATY es un grupo unido y antiguo, actualmente se encuentran en el octavo ciclo con 18 integrantes, demuestran interés y entusiasmo por continuar trabajando con el programa de comité de mujeres. 
Una de las integrantes la señora Claudelina, cuenta con una despensa en su propia casa, donde ofrece productos variados de necesidades básicas del hogar, con el préstamo piensa invertir en la compra de carne, panificados, verduras, frutas, y otros, con lo cual podrá seguir invirtiendo en su microemprendimiento. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir con sus ventas y luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The committee named “Kuña Aty” is a longtime group that is close-knit. It is currently in its eighth loan cycle with 18 members who has demonstrated an interest and enthusiasm for working with the Women’s Committee Program.

One of the members is Sra. Claudelina, who manages a food pantry out of her home. She offers various basic necessity products for the home. With her loan, she plans to invest in the purchase of meat, baked goods, vegetables, fruits, and other products so that she can continue investing in her microenterprise. Claudelina is grateful for the opportunity she has received so that she can continue her sales and strive to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy meat, baked goods, vegetables, fruits, and other products.

loans.name: Al Nahda Group

texts.en:
Mayyasa is the featured borrower for Al Nahda Group. She joined with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Mayyasa is a 50-year-old, married mother of two children, who has worked in a school for 14 years to cover the needs and expenses of her family. She is a hard worker who is trying desperately to improve her family's living conditions. Thus, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to pay for her daughter's university tuition fees.

Mayyasa is the lady standing in the middle. With respect to the other group members, Hiba is the first lady on the right, and Insaf is the first lady on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's university tuition fees.

loans.name: Zuhrokhon

texts.ru: На фотографии запечатлена Зухрохон. Ей 42 года. Она проживает вместе семьей в районе Вахш. Она замужем и мать троих детей. У нее одна дочка и два сына. Дети ходят в школу. Ее муж занимается выращивание скота и земледелием. Зухрохон сама занимается выращивание крупнорогатого скота уже более 5 лет. Она хочет расширить животноводческую деятельность, путем увеличение поголовье скота. Зухрохон покупает крупнорогатого скота от скотного рынка, откармливает их в течение 40 и 60 дней, потом перепродает их на скотном рынке. Ей в работе помогает муж.  У нее не хватает средств для купли скота, и она обратилась за кредитом.  Это кредит поможет ей продвигаться дальше, и расширить маленький бизнес.
texts.en: Zuhrokhon is shown in this photograph.  She is 42 years old and she lives with her family in the Vakhsh region.  She is married with three children: one daughter and two sons, all of whom are in school.  Her husband raises livestock and grows crops.  Zuhrokhon herself has been raising livestock for more than five years.  She wants to expand her livestock business by increasing her head of livestock.  Zuhrokhon buys cattle from the animal market and fattens them up for 40-60 days, at which point she resells them at the animal market.  Her husband helps her in this work.  She does not have enough money to buy cattle, so she has asked for a loan.  It will help her move forward and expand her small business.

loans.use: to expand her livestock business and buy cattle

loans.name: Safaa

texts.en:
Safaa is a 49-year-old married mother of four children. She established in 2012 her own convenience store to support her husband in increasing their family's income to develop their living.

Safaa is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with special spring and summer beverages and offers, in addition to making necessary maintenance at her house, especially after the cold winter season they faced.

Safaa is working hard to open a mobile phones selling shop to make sure she can provide her family with an increasing income.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with special spring and summer beverages and offers.

loans.name: Cross Fire Group

texts.en:
Marilyn is the featured borrower of Cross Fire group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua because they have always been friends, since they left their hometown in the Philippines to come and work in Lebanon. They moved to have a better income to support their beloved ones back in the Philippines.

Marilyn is a 42-year-old widowed mother of three children who is working hard as a housekeeper to cover the expenses and needs of her beloved kids and improve their living conditions. Thus she is acquiring a loan to support her family's increasing living expenses in the Philippines.

Marilyn is the first lady on the right of the photo. With respect to the other group members, Simeona is the first lady on the right, and Rosemarie is the lady standing in the middle.

loans.use: to support her family's increasing living expenses in the Philippines.

loans.name: Souheir

texts.en:
Souheir is a 34-year-old married mother of five children. She is a Palestinian refugee, who runs her own clothes selling business, living in a Refugee camp since she was born.

Souheir is a hard working woman, who works very hard with her husband to provide their family with the necessary living needs and make sure they can have a better future.

Souheir has run her current clothes selling business since 2011. She used to sell clothes from her house but she has worked hard to diversify her products and increase her business capital. She was able to move to a bigger place to attract more customers and display her stock in a proper way.

Her business is going on just fine, but not enough to increase her business capital due to increasing family day to day living demands. That's why she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with the special Spring and Summer collection especially for requested gifts for the Mother's Day celebrations.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with the special Spring and Summer collection especially for requested gifts for the Mother's Day celebration.

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre de 38 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos, y estudia la carrera de derecho.
Él es inteligente, emprendedor, optimista, solidario, responsable y trabajador. Sus estudios los realiza en la universidad pública. Ubicada en la zona ‘16 de julio’ caracterizada por el comercio informal; donde se puede encontrar desde una aguja para coser hasta un tractor para arar. De clima frio y seco (2ºC -12ºC), a una altura promedio de 3800 metros sobre el nivel del mar.
Juan es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, ojos obscuros, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por los estudios que realiza. su vida la realiza en casa de sus padre que no trabajan porque son mayores, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo, que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Sus estudios lo realiza en la universidad, estudia la carrera de derecho para luego tener la habilidad para adaptarse en el desempeño de sus labores a los cambios constantes que en materia jurídica, política, social, económica y tecnológica ocurren de manera constante. Paralelamente trabaja como técnico en administración. “mi anhelo es terminar mi segunda profesión y trabajar para ayudar a mi familia…” comenta. Su sueño es terminar de estudiar y trabajar en el rubro para generar mejores ingresos y apoyar a su familia con los gastos. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 14 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Juan solicita un préstamo para cubrir los gastos de titulación para obtener el título profesional.
texts.en:
Juan is a 38-year-old man, he is single, has no children, and is studying law.  He is smart, enterprising, optimistic, caring, responsible, and hard-working.  He goes to school at the public university.  It is located in the "16 de julio" area, which is known for informal trade and is where you can find everything from a sewing needle to a tractor for plowing.  It has a cold and dry climate (2ºC -12ºC), and is at an average altitude of 3,800 meters above sea level.  

Juan has a dark complexion, short black hair, and dark eyes; and he is short and thin.  His native language is Aymará, which he speaks at home, but he speaks Spanish for everyday use and at school.  He lives at home with his parents who do not work because they are older.  They live in their own brick house that has potable water, electricity, gas, and sewage.  He goes to school at the public university and is studying law so that later he will have the ability to adapt his work performance to the constant changes occurring in legal, political, social, financial, and technological matters.  At the same time, he works as an administration technician.  

"My goal is to finish my second occupation and work in order to help my family," he says.  His dream is to finish school and work in the field in order to generate greater income and help his family with their expenses.  This is his first loan cycle with the institution in the 14 years that he has been carrying out this work.  For these reasons, Juan asks for a loan in order to cover the costs of a degree so that he can get his professional title.

loans.use: to cover the cost of a degree so that he can get his professional title.

loans.name: Flamingo Group

texts.es:
Nieves es una mujer de 35 años de edad, soltera, tiene 1 hijo de 7 años, y su negocio es el horneado de tortas y masitas
Ella es buena madre, independiente, trabajadora, constante y muy responsable. Su trabajo lo realiza en un mercado de la zona ‘Sur’ caracterizada por encontrarse situado en los márgenes del majestuoso curso de agua, paseo tradicional del fin de semana, construcciones rústicas con materiales regionales en donde se puede degustar comida tradicional y realizar algunas actividades deportivas, de clima tropical con una temperatura que varía de 27-32 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Nieves es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, ojos obscuros, complexión física robusta, viste a la moda, su lengua nativa es el Guaraní y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (sentada viste, pantalón negro y polera color crema). Su vida la realiza con su hijo que  estudia en la escuela, viven en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con los servicios de agua, luz y alcantarillado. Debido a las necesidades de su familia y su negocio, formó una banca de personas con negocios como; servicio técnico tv color, tienda de barrio, carnicería, venta de sándwiches, artesanía en yeso, venta de refrescos y venta de zapatillas, para solicitar un préstamo y prosperar en sus actividades comerciales. Su negocio es la elaboración y venta de tortas y masitas, negocio que inicio desde su casa, realizando una mínima inversión con la venta de masitas tradicionales, como; Cuñapé (Pequeño bollo hecho de harina de yuca con queso), Empanada de arroz (Horneado de arroz y queso), Empanada de jigote (Masa delgada de harina de trigo rellena con mezcla de carne o pollo y verduras), Bizcochos de trigo (Bollitos duros de harina de trigo) y otros, también hornea queques de vainilla y tortas de chocolates que llevan insumos fáciles de encontrar en el mercado, a medida que recuperaba su capital, invertía en la oferta de masitas para el público. “las masitas tradicionales son parte de la comida diaria, todos los lugareños las consumen a diario y los extranjeros les fascina…” comenta. Su sueño es tener una pastelería grande y vender por mayor, ella desea realizar la compra de un horno industrial y una garrafa de gas para ampliar su negocio. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 6 años que viene realizando esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Nieves solicita un préstamo para la compra de variedades de harinas por quintal para hornear deliciosos pasteles y masitas.
texts.en:
Nieves is a 35-year-old woman, who is single and has a 7-year-old son. She makes a living baking cakes and pastries.

She is independent, hard-working, perseverant, very responsible, and a good mother. 

She works at a market in the south. With a tropical climate and a temperature of 27 to 32 degrees Celsius (80 to 89 degrees Fahrenheit) all year round, the area is known for being nestled on the banks of a majestic river, for its traditional weekend strolls, for its rustic constructions made of local materials, and for being a place where people can savour traditional food and engage in sporting activities.  

Nieves is short with a heavy build. She has a tanned complexion, dark eyes, and dark long hair—which she ties up. She dresses fashionably. Her mother tongue is Guarani, and she speaks Spanish for general knowledge and business purposes. (In the picture, she is the one sitting down, wearing black pants and a cream T-shirt).    

She shares her life with her son, who goes to school. They live in a rented house—which is made of brick and concrete; has a corrugated iron roof; and is equipped with basic utilities (water, electricity, and a sewer system). 

Because of her family and business needs, she formed a communal bank in order to apply for a loan that would help the members prosper in their business activities, which include servicing colour TVs, running a grocery store, running a butcher's shop, selling sandwiches, selling plaster handicrafts, selling beverages, and selling shoes.  

She makes a living baking and selling cakes and pastries. With a minimum investment, she started her business from her home selling traditional pastries such as "cuñapé" (small bread roll made with cassava flour and cheese), "empanada de arroz" (baked rice and cheese turnover), "empanada de jigote" (thin pastry turnover made with wheat flour and filled with a mixture of meat or chicken and vegetables), "bizcochos de trigo" (wheat biscuits), and other products. She also bakes vanilla sponge cakes and chocolate cakes, whose ingredients are easy to find at the market.      

As she recoup her investment, she reinvested the profits in the sale of pastries. She says, "Traditional pastries are part of the daily meal; local people eat them every day, and foreigners love them […]"
 
Her dream is to have a big bakery and sell wholesale. She also wants to buy an industrial oven and a propane tank to expand her business. 

This is the first loan cycle with the institution in the six years that she has been following this occupation.

For these reasons, Nieves is requesting a loan to buy different types of flour by the quintal in order to bake delicious cakes and pastries.

loans.use: to buy different types of flour by the quintal in order to bake delicious cakes and pastries.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase a car to transport her merchandise more conveniently, instead of paying for the service as she does today.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Jose Arnoldo

texts.es: La justicia en todo momento es lo que le practica José Arnoldo, a pesar a su edad no se da por vencido y siempre mantiene las ganas de salir adelante para mantener a sus hijos. El combina su carrera con la profesión de transportista y electromecánico. José Arnoldo estudia Derecho en una universidad capitalina y está a punto de culminar la carrera con éxito, pero para lograrlo satisfactoriamente solicita un crédito para pagar su curso de titulación. De esta manera podrá cumplir una de sus metas que es obtener su título de derecho.
texts.en:
Justice in every moment is what José Arnoldo practices. 

Despite his age, he hasn’t given up, and has kept up his desire to make a living and provide for his children.

He has combined his legal studies with working as a chofer and electromechanical technician. 

José Arnoldo is studying law in a university in the capital, and is about to successfully complete his degree, but he still needs this loan to complete his certification course. In this way he can accomplish one of his life goals, which is a degree in legal studies.

loans.use: to pay for his certification course.

loans.name: Nurizat

texts.ru: Нуризат, 41 год, вдова, есть сын школьник, он один поддержка и опора для матери. Нуризат в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, занимается сельским хозяйством. Стартовав в 2000 году, на сегодняшний день она занимается продажей сухофруктов и животноводством. В хозяйстве Нуризат есть 3 коровы, 3 бычка и 25 овец. Ежемесячная прибыль около 10,000 сомов (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 125,000 сом (KGS) на покупку двух дойных коров для увеличения объемов реализации молока. Доходы от кредита Нуризат планирует вкладывать в образование и воспитание своего любимого сына.
texts.en: Nurizat is 41 years old and a widow.  She has a son who is in elementary school and who is her only support.  As the main source of income for her family, Nurizat is involved in farming, having started in this field in 2000.  She currently sells dry fruits and raises livestock.  At the moment, she has three cows, three young bulls and 25 sheep on her farm.  Nurizat makes a monthly income of about 10,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 125,000 som (KGS) to purchase two dairy cows, which will allow her to sell more organic milk.  Nurizat is planning to use the earnings from her loan to raise and educate her beloved son.

loans.use: to purchase two dairy cows in order to produce and sell higher volumes of organic milk.

loans.name: Mesrop

texts.en: Mesrop runs a small cafe in Haghtanak village of Tavush region. The village is not big and Mesrop's cafe is the only one there. To be able to provide good service to clients, Mesrop continuously makes improvements. Now, to be able to expand the cafe and renovate the building which is located near it, Mesrop has applied for this loan. His loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans to informal businesses that do not qualify through normal channels.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of a building near his cafe in order to expand his cafe.

loans.name: Lali

texts.en:
Lali is a 47-year-old, married woman from village Chaladidi. She has a husband, a son, a daughter and a little grandson. The family has insignificant income from a small agribusiness and also from her husband's pension. They find it hard to cover even basic needs and live under poverty. In order to contribute to the family's welfare and generate her own income, Lali decided to start a small trading with food products. She will buy products at wholesale prices and will sell them with price mark-ups to her neighbors. She will get the chance somehow to increase the living conditions of her family and tackle with the financial difficulties. 

She couldn’t receive a loan from the local financial institutions, because of their requirements to have business experience or stable revenue, until the Start Up program began, which is a joint product of Kiva and Credo.The program allows rural poor like Lali to get a chance for starting or re-starting businesses. Lali and her family rely on a good will of Kiva lenders and will be grateful for giving them a chance to earn a living. She awaits your support and kindness.

loans.use: to start trading with food products and to earn her own income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase animal feed and two pigs to fatten so she can improve her business.

loans.name: Aura Elisa

texts.es: Aura es una señora de 52 años de edad, ella es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos, una de 9 y el mayor de 14 años, y los 2 estan estudiando,  Aura arrienda un cuarto para tener su negocio que es una tienda de confites y abarrotes, Aura va a invertir el crédito en la compra de productos de tienda, Aura tiene la aspiración de ofrecer mas variedad de productos y asi aumentar sus ventas para que mejore su negocio y sus ingresos, y de las ganancias una   parte es para aumentar  mercadería  y la otra para pagar la educación, vivienda y alimentación de sus hijos.
texts.en: Aura is a 52 year old single mother of two children. One is 9 years old and the oldest is 14 and both study. Aura leases a room to have her business which is a candy and grocery store. Aura will invest the loan in buying products for her store. Aura wishes to offer more variety of products and thus increasing her sales so that her business, income and profit improve. Part of the loan is to increase her merchandise and with the other part pay education, housing and food for her children.

loans.use: to buy store products.

loans.name: El Mana Group

texts.es:
Mery es una mujer de 38 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 4 hijos de 7, 8, 12 y 15 años, y su negocio es la venta de alimentos de primera necesidad en una tienda de barrio.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, amable, comprometida con su trabajo, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en el ‘plan 3000’ de la ciudad, caracterizado por ser un barrio donde microempresarios de todas las áreas, como la confección, el diseño y las artesanías, producen y ofertan todo tipo de manufactura; es el barrio más poblado, de clima cálido tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 18-35 grados centígrados.
Mery es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, ojos obscuros, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (segunda de la derecha, viste blusa azul y pantalón negro). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica al transporte y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela y se dedican al deporte, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento y cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su necesidad por abastecer a su familia con los gastos básicos la llevó a conformar una bance de personas con negocios como; panadería, venta de verduras, comercio de repuestos, venta de plásticos, venta de refrescos, reparación de electrodomésticos y carnicería, para solicitar un préstamo y ampliar sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de alimentos de primera necesidad como; pan, azúcar, arroz, fideo, agua, etc., en una tienda de barrio ubicada en su propio domicilio. Debido a la demanda de sus clientes por material escolar ella necesita realizar la compra de materiales escolares, como; cuadernos, lápices, bolígrafos, reglas y todo lo necesario para estudiar en la escuela. “mis clientes me exigen material escolar porque no existe otra tienda cercana y solicitan estos productos para que sus hijos vayan a la escuela…” comenta. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio para tenerla bien surtida y ganar más clientes, ella dese realizar la compra de material escolar para ofertarla a sus clientes y aumentar sus ingresos. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que viene desarrollando este negocio de manera independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Mery solicita un préstamo para la compra de material escolar para ofertar a sus clientes mejorando sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Mery, 38, lives with her partner.  She has four children, ages 7, 8, 12, and 15.  She's an enterprising, friendly, responsible, and hardworking woman and a good mother who's committed to her job.  Her business is selling staple food products in a neighborhood store.

She works in the Plan 3000 area of the city, known for being a booming production sector where microentrepreneurs from all fields--including tailoring, design, and handmade crafts--produce and offer all kinds of manufacturing that are sold in the main local markets.  It's the biggest neighborhood; the climate is warm and tropical with a temperature that varies between 18 and 35 degrees centigrade during the day.

Mery is short, dark, and stocky, and she has dark eyes and wears her long black hair tied back.  (She's the second from the right, wearing a blue blouse and black pants.)  Her native language is Guarani, which she speaks at home, and she speaks Spanish for cultural reasons and for business.  She lives with her partner, who earns a living in transportation, and her children, who attend school and play sports.  They live in their own house, which is made of brick and cement and has potable water, electricity, and a sewage system.

Her need to support her family with the basic expenses led her to form a bank with people to request a loan and expand their business, which include a bakery, vegetable sales, spare parts, plastic sales, soft drink sales, appliance repair, and a butcher shop.

Her business is selling food products such as bread, sugar, rice, pasta, water, and staples in her neighborhood store located in her home.  Because of customer demand for school supplies, she needs to buy notebooks, pencils, pens, rulers, and everything necessary for attending school.  "My customers ask me for school supplies so their children can go to school, because there's no other store nearby," she said.  

Mery wants to buy school supplies to sell to her customers and increase her income.  This is her second loan sequence with the institution in the year she has been working in her business independently.

Her dream is to expand her business and have it well stocked to attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy school supplies to sell her customers and improve her income

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cosmetic products.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en: Julia is 54 years old and lives with her son. To make money, she sells fried chicken, fast food, and pastries. Julia doesn't have her own restaurant; she rents the place where she sells the food. Julia needs a loan to buy a new broaster machine. Julia would like in the future to have her own house and to have her business in the same place.

loans.use: to buy a new broaster machine

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 45 years old and lives in San Isidro, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children. Liza earns a living from agri-farming particularly watermelon and coconut production. She earns approximately 8,000 PHP each month doing this type of work.

She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing melon seedlings, coconut seedlings, barbed wire and other materials for her agri-business. Liza has been a member of PMPC for 8 years.

In the future, Liza hopes to expand her agri-business.

loans.use: to purchase melon seedlings, coconut seedlings, barbed wire and other materials.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn has always had enthusiasm for farming. She and her husband have cultivated their rice land in Mahayag and had good earnings doing this type of work.

Recently, she applied a loan to pay for land and seedbed preparation. This will ensure that the rice field is ready for planting. Roselyn knows that she has to get things right to yield more income for this cropping season.

In the future, Roselyn hopes to buy a haulage truck for easy transport of produce.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation.

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en: It's a normal thing to have cereals in Kenya, but to start selling the cereals is something else entirely. Jeniffer is a smallholder mixed-farmer based in Mbaraga village in Nkubu. She is the mother of four, who has been practicing mixed farming for the last twenty five years. To earn a decent living, she makes income selling milk, poultry, greens and engaging in numerous small personal businesses. Only recently, she started seeing how she could be making big money off cereal selling. She wants to sell cereals to the ready market that is in her region. However, her biggest challenge today is limited funds to expand. Jeniffer is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to purchase cereal for resale. Future proceeds from the commercialization of her cereal selling business are already committed to pay for her children's education. In the long run, she is confident her efforts will translate into her family having a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy cereals for resale

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is from Ijevan town where she lives with her husband and two children (ages 7 and 6 years old). To help her husband with family's growing costs, Susan runs her small retail business. She trades with clothing supplies in Ijevan town and in nearby villages. 

Now, to be able to purchase new stock of spring clothing to sell to her customers, Susan has applied for this loan. Her loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans to informal businesses that do not qualify through normal channels. Susan hopes to receive your support and to develop her retail business.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of spring clothing to sell to customers.

loans.name: Alive For Health Group

texts.en:
The Alive for Health Group is made up of four members. The group representative is named Kwabena. The members of this group all live in the same neighborhood and are into pedicure and manicures, waakye (cooked rice and beans), tiles, ladies tops, and photography. 

Kwabena, 44 years old, attended school to the elementary level. He is married with three children, who are receiving an education and who live under their parents' care. Kwabena has been supporting his wife in the various expenses in his household. In order to do this, Kwabena has been a photographer for 26 years. This business generates revenue, which helps him to meet his various needs, as well as those of his family. 

Kwabena will buy camera accessories from the market to improve his business. This will be the sixth time he has sought a loan from ID-Ghana, along with the other members of the group. This loan will help him grow his business and increase his turnover and revenue. The previous loans have been paid back in full.

loans.use: to buy camera accessories from the market to improve his business.

loans.name: Blanca Isabel

texts.es: Blanca es una joven muy trabajadora, tiene 34 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene una hija de 9 años, Blanca vive en la casa de sus padres y comenta que le gusta mucho su trabajo de costurera y son 15 años que ya lleva en este negocio, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de tela para confeccionar las prendas de vestir que luego las vende ofreciéndolas y a veces las vende por pedido, la aspiración de Blanca es de mejorar su negocio, aumentar sus ventas y de aquí tener los ingresos para la educación de su hija.
texts.en:
Blanca is a hardworking young woman. She is 34 and a single mother with a 9-year-old daughter. She lives in her parent's house.

She works as a seamstress and says she loves her job, which she has been doing for 15 years. She will use the loan to buy fabrics for making clothes, sometimes made-to-order, that she then sells.

Blanca's hope is to improve her business and increase her sales so that she can pay for her daughter's education.

loans.use: to buy fabrics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a solar home solution for her community beauty parlor & increase her income.

loans.name: Kwaku

texts.en:
Kwaku is a US Army Veteran, and a loving single father of four children. Kwaku works full time to provide for his children and to maintain his home in good conditions. Despite his hard work, Kwaku does not have enough disposable income to purchase a much needed new air conditioner unit that would have a meaningful health impact on him and his son.

Kwaku could greatly benefit from a low cost loan so that he can provide a healthy and more comfortable living environment for his family, especially when the sweltering heat sets in during the upcoming Florida summer months. Kwaku has experienced some financial setbacks due to caring for his father who recently passed after a long illness and these setbacks have affected his credit significantly which is why he is turning to SELF and KIVA for help.

Kwaku will use his KIVA loan to pay for a new high efficiency air conditioner which will improve the health and comfort for his family in his home.

loans.use: to purchase a new high efficiency air conditioner which will improve the health and comfort of his family in his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a solar home solution and provide better education for her children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar home solution to place in her school canteen.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a solar home solution for her tuition academy

loans.name: Daylinda

texts.en:
Daylinda is 46 years old and married. She lives in Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. For the past 17 years, Daylinda and her husband have been farmers, focusing on planting rice, corn, vegetables and root crops. This is how they earn a living. Daylinda earns 3,500 PHP each month doing this type of work.

As a new member of PMPC, Daylinda is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan to purchase bags of fertilizer. In the future, she hopes to improve her business and to be able to engage in agricultural business ventures.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build concrete walls in her bathroom and also to install security bars in her home because it currently doesn't have any and is in risk of being broken into.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is responsible and dedicated in her work as a tailor. She has a business in which she produces school uniforms and carries out repairs to clothes. This business has given her the opportunity to work and survive. It is Vivian's only source of income and she is very grateful for her life and being allowed to be independent. 

Vivian has applied for a loan in order to expand her business and increase production. She will buy additional textiles, buttons and sewing supplies. This will allow her to generate more income and to be able to cater for tailoring services.

loans.use: to buy additional textiles, buttons and sewing supplies

location.town: Sindangan - Mandih, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Jenivy

texts.en:
Jenivy earns a good income from her farming activities in Mahayag. She and her husband are both farmers. This is how they support their family and are able to send their children to school. Jenivy wants to increase her farm yield especially as she will have a higher cost of living because she will send her daughter to college this school year. 

Jenivy approached Paglaum (PMPC) to borrow an amount to purchase a knapsack sprayer for insecticides, fertilizer and herbicides. She has high hopes that she will have good produce this cropping season and be able to earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase a knapsack sprayer for insecticides, fertilizer and herbicides

loans.name: Jose Fernando

texts.es: Jose es un señor soltero, tiene 28 años de edad y tiene 4 hijos, el se dedica a la ganadería y también trabaja de albañil en los lugares donde le contraten, Jose es responsable con sus hijos pero por motivos de trabajo no puede vivir junto a ellos, Jose va a invertir el dinero del crédito en la compra de vaconas para aumentarlas en su negocio ya que en la actualidad tiene 4 vaconas, la aspiración de Jose es de seguir trabajando duro y lograr mejorar su negocio y que todo esto sea por beneficio de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jose is a single man, 28, and has 4 children. He raises livestock, and also works as a bricklayer, wherever he is hired. Jose is responsible for his children, but because of his work, he cannot live with them. 

Jose is going to invest the money from the loan in the purchase of cows to enlarge his business, which currently has 4 cows.

Jose's aspiration is to continue working hard and improving his business, and that all this will be for the benefit of his children.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita, a widow from Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur, grows rice for a living. She also plants vegetables and root crops. 

In 2010, Rosita learned about Paglaum MPC and the financial assistance it gives. As a farmer, she tried her luck and acquired a loan to jump start her corn production. After several months, she was able to repay her borrowed capital. To this day, Rosita feels she owes her good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money.

Recently, Rosita requested a new loan to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer for the next cropping season. She wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply corn to the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in the year 2012 and she appreciates the programs, services, and continuous education of the co-op. She is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs and services that the Cooperative offers. 

She has a small piece of farmland near her home. She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 8,000. This loan is intended to buy farm inputs. 

Esperanza dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life and an adequate income out of her business.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Wendyam Group

texts.fr: Koudougou, membre représentatif est mariée et mère de 5 enfants tous scolarisés. Koudougou et les autres membres sont des femmes dynamiques qui font le commerce de détails et la restauration. Ce groupe est à son 14ème contrat de prêt avec notre institution, mais jusque, il n'y a pas eu de problème avec les remboursements. Koudougou, quant à elle, fait le commerce des pagnes et c'est pourquoi, elle a besoin de ce crédit. Elle voudrait acheter des des pagnes de diverses qualités pour vendre. Les pagnes sont accessibles à tout le monde car le prix minimum d'un pagne c'est 1 000 francs CFA. Après les ventes, cette brave dame aura un bénéfice qui lui permettra de continuer à s'occuper de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Koudougou, the representative member is married and a mother of 5 children, all of which go to school. Koudougou and the other members are dynamic women who are in the retail and food trades. This group is on their 14th loan with our institution and there have been no problems with repayments. 

Koudougou trades pagnes and this is why she needs this loan. She would like to buy pagnes of various qualities to sell. Pagnes are available for everyone because the minimum price of one is 1 000 CFA francs. After the sales, this brave woman will have a profit that will allow her to continue to take care of her children.

loans.use: to buy pagnes to sell

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn has enthusiasm in managing her farming activities in Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Aside from indulging in her hobby, she is earning as well. Since she wants to be more productive, Arlyn also has a snack vending business to expand her resources. Being a microfinance member of PMPC, she diligently pays all her obligations from her earnings. 

Arlyn hopes to provide her family with safe and comfortable living quarters, so she has requested a loan to purchase additional floor tiles for her house. She wishes to earn more from her business to continuously benefit her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional floor tiles for her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a solar home solution for a community school canteen.

loans.name: Juvelyn

texts.en:
Juvelyn is 34 years old and lives in Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. She is married and is blessed with two sons who are school-age. 

Juvelyn joined PMPC in July 2012  to access their programs and services. Currently, she is borrowing a loan of PHP 8,000 which is her third loan. The loan will provide additional working capital for her existing business, so she will be able to buy a variety of food products to sell  in her local community.

loans.use: to buy a variety of food products to sell

loans.name: Cherry Rose

texts.en: Cherry Rose, after learning about Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) and hearing about all the the benefits and financial services, never hesitated to become a member. She has tried her luck by operating a business focused on her farming activities. Cherry Rose feels she owes her luck to the cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital. She is now borrowing another loan to pay for seedlings and compost. This will give her farming income a big boost. Cherry Rose is seeking better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost

loans.name: Aurilia

texts.en:
Aurilia, a mother of six, joined PMPC in 2013 after her first business failed. She says that PMPC rescued her by lending her badly needed money that enabled her to get back on her feet.

Now, Aurilia has requested another loan for this quarter's cropping to pay for bags of fertilizer and herbicides to maximize her farm production and generate more income. She perseveres in striving to reach her goals in order to abundantly provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for bags of fertilizer and herbicides

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is 44 years old and lives in Map-an, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with 2 children now at their school age. 

Jenny has been engaged in managing her own sari-sari store and gasoline retailing business for 4 years now. She earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of business activity.  

She has requested a loan to be used for purchasing additional groceries and containers of gasoline for retail. 

Jenny has been a member of PMPC for 9 years. In the future, Jenny hopes to expand her sari-sari store business.

loans.use: To purchase additional groceries and containers of gasoline

loans.name: Josie

texts.en: Josie is 46 years old and lives in Ozamiz City, Philippines. She is married and her husband is a farmer. From her desire to help her family, she has engaged in buying and selling firewood to local community members for the past 12 years. Recently, she has planned to jump into corn production so she has requested a loan  to pay for land preparation and buying fertilizer for corn production. Josie hopes to save money for future emergencies.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation and buying fertilizer for corn production.

location.town: Ozamis-P2 Gotokan Daku, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occid

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria, a 52-year-old widow, lives in Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. 

In order to survive, she engages in farming activities. As the breadwinner, Gloria has experienced hardships, especially in raising her family. This industrious member finds herself in plowing the rice field and planting corn, vegetables, and other crops. 

In need of additional working capital, Gloria decided to join Paglaum Cooperative to gain access to capitalization and financial services. Recently, she requested PHP 5,000 to buy farm inputs and to pay labor costs for cultivating their land. 

Gloria has been able to manage her income and to provide for her family's daily needs. She is very thankful because, if it were not for Paglaum, she might not be able to obtain the needed working capital. She hopes to own a farm tractor someday to use for land cultivation.
