loans.use: to buy farm inputs and to pay labor costs for cultivating their land

loans.name: Vugar

texts.en:
Vugar is a 46-year-old single man who lives in the village Keshalo. He has only a pensioner mother. Sadly, for lack of economic resources and because he had to start working at a very young age, Vugar was unable to study a professional career. 

He works hard on family-owned agricultural land, growing greens and tomatoes. He always has high-quality products, which are sold to local retailers for a good price. 

As it becomes harder to earn a living over time, Vugar wants to expand his agribusiness in order to more effectively meet the daily costs of his family. A loan of 1,500 Georgia Lari (GEL) will be a great support to this hardworking man and his mother, enabling him to purchase cattle and to start selling meat at the local market. 

Vugar has been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

The Start Up credit will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased regards Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase cattle and to start selling meat

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 33 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Jenelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell at her store, like shampoo, canned goods, noodles, sugar, milk, bread, etc.

Jenelyn has been in this business for two years. 

She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell at her store, like shampoo, canned goods, noodles, sugar, milk and bread.

loans.name: Rafik

texts.en:
Rafik is from Kapan town, in the Syunik region. He works in a local company as a technical supporter of wedding machines. 

After more than one year of work experience in that field, Rafik decided to start a coffee-selling business. He asks for this loan to purchase a coffee machine. 

His loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans to informal businesses that do not qualify through normal channels.

loans.use: to pay for a coffee machine

loans.name: Hapiness Group

texts.en:
The six female members of the Hapiness group are living in the same neighborhood. The women live in Chorkor, a neighborhood of Accra. They know one another through family, neighborhood, and business connections. 

The group members sell cosmetics, eggs, porridge, slippers, foodstuff, materials, and provide seamstress services. All of the women want to build up their stock holding so they work with the field partner, ID-Ghana. This will be their ninth group loan. 

Ameley (standing second from the right in the photo) has a strong reputation for selling cosmetics and eggs. She plans to use her loan to buy more cosmetics and eggs to sell to customers. She will resell them for cash to customers in a kiosk at Chorkor. 

Ameley expects to make a good monthly profit, which she will use to pay for the school and healthcare costs of her children and also to repay the loan and save some.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics and eggs to sell to customers.

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es:
Ramiro es un joven hombre de 18 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos, y su negocio es la confección de sombreros.
Él es emprendedor, independiente, constante, activo, responsable y trabajador. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona 16 de febrero una zona residencial alejada de la ciudad, de clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 10-12 grados centígrados. 
Ramiro es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, ojos pardos, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la realiza en casa de su tío que es propia y está construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina, cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado, lo acompaña su hermana menor que estudia en la escuela, su tío le prestó 2 cuartos uno para vivir y otro para utilizarlo como taller. Su negocio es la confección de sombreros, negocio que aprendió en el vecino país de Argentina confeccionando mochilas durante largas jornadas de hasta 16 horas diarias, luego retorno a su pueblo natal de ‘Batallas’ en el alto, para iniciar su negocio, tuvo que trasladarse la ciudad para poder realizar su comercio. “soy vendedor ambulante, mis prendas son manejables fácilmente, y vendo todo lo que produzco…” comenta. Su sueño es aumentar su producción y contratar empleados, él desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de una máquina cortadora de tela y cortes de tela por mayor para aumentar su producción y pagar los gastos escolares de su hermanita. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Ramiro solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina cortadora y tela por mayor para aumentar su producción y pagar los gastos de su hermanita.
texts.en:
Ramiro is a young man of 18-years; he is single, childless, and his business is the manufacturing of hats. He is enterprising, independent, constant, active, responsible and hardworking. His business is located in the zone "16 de Febrero", a remote residential area of ​​the city. It has a cold, dry climate, with temperatures in the daytime ranging between 10-12 degrees Celsius. 

Ramiro is of a dark complexion, short black hair, brown eyes, short stature, thin physique, his mother tongue is Aymara, which he speaks with his family, and Spanish for general culture and for his business. He lives in his uncle's house, which is owned by his uncle, and is built out of brick and cement with a tin roof; the house has water, electricity,  gas and sewage. He is accompanied by his younger sister, who studies in school. His uncle lent him 2 rooms, one where he can live and the other one to use as a workshop.

His business is the manufacturing of hats. He learned this business in the neighbouring country of Argentina by putting together backpacks for long working days, with working hours of up to 16 hours per day. He then returned to his hometown of 'Batallas' to start his business. He had to move to the city to carry out his trade. 

"I am a street seller, my clothes are easy to manage, and I sell everything I produce ..." he says. 

His dream is to increase production and hire employees, he wants to expand his business by purchasing fabric in bulk and a machine that cuts fabric so that he can increase his production and pay his sister's school fees. 

This is the 1st time he asks for loan with the institution since the four years he has been working. It is for these reasons that Ramiro is requesting a loan to purchase the fabric-cutting machine and fabric in bulk to increase his production and pay for his sister's.expenses

loans.use: to purchase a cutting machine and fabrics at wholesale to increase his production and pay his little sister's expenses

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad is an energetic woman. At the age of 67 years old, she still works on her farmland and plants pineapple and corn. She lives in Ventura, Sapang Dalaga, where her farmland is located.  

She applied for a loan through Paglaum MPC which she will use to pay the down payment on 1/2 hectare of land, on which she will plant pineapple. 
 
Trinidad is very happy that she acquired land with the help of Paglaum, and she will save the income for an emergency.

loans.use: to pay the down payment on 1/2 hectare farmland

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en: Alfredo requested a PHP 40,000 loan through PMPC to buy more nipa roofing to sell.  Alfredo has been in this business for 10 years now, which help his two college children and one high school support their daily expenses and payment for tuition fees.  Alfredo would like to save enough to provide an secure future for his family.

loans.use: to buy nipa roofing thatch to resell.

loans.name: Lovell Odilon

texts.en: Lovell Odilon is 45 years old and lives in Northern Poblacion, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. He is married with seven children, five of whom are in school and 1 who is an infant. Lovell Odilon work as security guard in Globe Tower. He has been earning approximately PHP 8,000 each month doing this type of job, but does not have enough to feed his family.  He was given an opportunity where his neighbor offered him a second-hand tricycle for transport, which helps them earn additional income.  Lovell Odilon requested a loan to use for a down payment for tricycle transport. Lovell Odilon has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, he hopes to see his children finish their studies.

loans.use: use for a downpayment for a passenger motor tricycle.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine works hard to support her family. She is married with four children and has an auto repair shop in the Philippines.

Josephine requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials used in her business.

Josephine has been in this business for three years now, and earns additional income from a bakery and from buying and selling personal products.

In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials used in her business.

loans.name: Ne's Group

texts.en:
The members of Ne’s Group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia.  Ne makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. 

In her village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses, as well as save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter for providing safe drinking water to her family.

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en:
The members of Sokha’s Group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sokha makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. In her village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. 

Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter in order to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Sarat's Group

texts.en:
The members of Sarat’s Group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. 

Sarat makes a living cultivating rice and does extra work as a tailor to support his family. 

In the village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each member of the group to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter in order to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Khun's Group

texts.en:
The members of Khun’s Group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Khun makes a living cultivating rice and he does extra work as a tailor to support his family. 

In his village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of the men in the group to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter that will provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Dayami Paola

texts.es:
Dayami es una señorita muy amable y responsable, ella tiene 21 años, es soltera y vive en una comunidad de Sololá. 
Dayami  por ser una persona responsable llego alcanzar la meta, ella es una persona profesional y por su preparación academica, ahora trabaja para una  empresa privada, pero para Dayami esto no es suficiente es por eso que también se dedica a la fabricación de  productos de limpieza desde hace un años, de esta manera ella genera sus ingresos económicos, y su objetivo es ayudar a sus padres con los gastos de la casa, o de  la necesidad que se le presente a su familia  
Dayami con el afán de hacer de su negocio de fabricación de productos de limpieza algo más grande,  ella solicita un préstamo de diez mil quetzales que le servirá para comprar mas materiales tales como agua, talcos especiales y galones, ya que para Dayami este negocio es bastante rentable, Pues con lo que genera con su trabajo estaría pagando dicho prestamo. 
Dayami después de culminar este proyecto, los sueños de esta señorita es comprar un terreno y poder construir su casa. dayami tiene las esperanzas de conseguir el préstamo, para empezar a trabajar lo anhelado, ella es una chica que se destaca por su amabilidad.
texts.en:
21-year old Dayami is very friendly and responsible woman. She is single and lives in the community of Sololá.

As she is responsible, she has achieved her goal. She has a professional job, and because she has academic qualitifications, she has a job with a private company. However, for Dayami this isn’t enough. For the last year she has been earning a living making cleaning products. Her goal is to help her parents with household or other necessary expenses. 

In order to grow her cleaning products business, Dayami needs a loan to buy more supplies like water, special talcs, and plastic bottles. As her business generates a lot of income, she will be able to pay back the loan.

When she has finished this project, her next dream is to buy a plot of land and build a house. She hopes that her application for a loan will be successful so she can begin working on her goals. Dayami is noted for her pleasantness.

loans.use: buy water, talcs, and plastic bottles to make cleaning products

loans.name: Sophy's Group

texts.en:
The members of Sophy’s Group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. 

Sophy makes a living cultivating rice, and he also does extra work as tailor and sells groceries to support his family. 

In the village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter that will provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Vanna's Group

texts.en:
Vanna’s Group members live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Vanna makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor and farm laborer to support her family. 

In her village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter that will provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Phon's Group

texts.en:
The members of Phon’s Group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Phon makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as a tailor to support his family. 

In his village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help the members of Phon's Group to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter for providing safe drinking water to his family.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Felix es un hombre de 49 años de edad, es casado tiene una linda familia de 8 hijos de las edades de entre 12 y 25 años, viven en una comunidad de Sololá.
Felix un padre de familia trabajador y responsable, que para generar sus ingresos se dedica desde hace 10 años a supervisar construcciones en varios lugares de su comunidad, pero viendo las necesidades fuertes que la familia tiene, él también es  agricultor cultiva una diversidad de verduras de su región, él cuenta que esta segunda actividad para él es bastante rentable, pero Félix es un padre de familia que se preocupa por las necesidades de su familia una de ellas ahora es la construcción de su casa, para que sus hijos tengan donde acogerse mejor,pero  Felix tiene una dificultad es que con lo que gana de sus dos actividades no le alcanza para construir su casa, entonces el junto a su esposa han decidido solicitar un préstamo de Q 10,000.00 para comprar los materiales de construcción como cemento, block, hierro y piedrín. El gran sueño de Felix es poder construir su casa este año y darle a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Felix is ​​a 49-year-old man, married, and he has a cute family of 8 children who are between the ages of 12 and 25 years-old. They live in a community of Solola.

Felix is a hardworking and responsible parent. To generate an income he has made a living, for the past 10 years, supervising building constructions in several places of his community. However, seeing the strong needs that the family has, he is also a family farmer and he grows a variety of vegetables from his region. He notes that this second activity for him is quite profitable, but Felix is ​​a parent who cares for the needs of his family, and one of those needs is building his house so that his children have a better place to live. 

Felix has a difficulty, which is that what he earns from his two activities is not enough to build his house. Therefore, he alongside his wife have decided to apply for a loan of 10,000 GTQ to purchase construction materials such as cement, block, iron and gravel. 

Felix's great dream is to build his home this year and give his family a better life.

loans.use: To purchase cement, block, sand, iron, and gravel for the construction of his home.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: francisco cuenta que gracias a los créditos que ha tenido acceso en Adicla en a logrado prosperar en grande, en estos días ya cuenta con una pequeña tienda que fue creciendo con las ganancias que su cultivo le generaba, ahora Francisco solicita un nuevo préstamo que lo utilizara para  ampliar su tienda con en préstamo el piensa compara productos como, gaseosas, jugos, frijoles, huevos y todo lo relacionado con abarrotería, Francisco está completamente seguro que esta nueva inversión le ayudara a que su tienda crezca y así él pueda ofrecerle más productos a la clientela. El gran sueño de francisco es contar nuevamente con este préstamo para realizar esta inversión y con las ganancias que genere poder construir otra casa y comprar más terrenos para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Thanks to the loans Francisco has obtained through Adicia, he has prospered greatly. He runs a small store for which he buys supplies with profits from the crops he grows. Now he wishes to obtain a new loan to buy more merchandise such as soft drinks, juices, beans, eggs, and other grocery items.

Francisco has no doubts that this new loan will help him to expand his store so he can offer his customers more products. His greatest wish is to obtain a new loan once again so that he can better stock his store, and with the money he earns build another house and buy more land for his children.

loans.use: buy soft drinks, juices, beans, eggs and grow his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: rent land and buy seeds so he can plant crops

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 47 years old, married, and has three children. One of the children is still in school. Josephine is in the agricultural business in the Philippines.

She has been in an agricultural business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Josephine requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 3 years now, and also earns additional income from food vending.

Jovelyn requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 46 years old, and has five children. Lorna is married, and has two children who are still in school.

Lorna is in the retail business  in the Philippines. Lorna requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell, like shampoo, breads, soft drinks, noodles, sugar, coffee, etc.  Lorna has been in business for seven years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like shampoo, breads, soft drinks, noodles, sugar, coffee, etc

Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

Rina’s group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia.  Rina makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family.

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en:
Sokha’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Sokha makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. 

Having a water filter at home will help each of these group members to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, save time collecting fuel and time boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Fortunata Rosalia

texts.es:
Fortunata es una mujer de 45 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijos varones de 14 y 10 años y una hija mujer de 17 años, y su negocio es la cría y venta de conejos, patos y gallinas.
Fortunata es de tez morena, baja estatura, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, su lengua materna es el Quechua que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo que cuenta con energía eléctrica, no tiene agua potable ni alcantarillado, para obtener agua se dirigen al rio que queda a 10 minutos de distancia y la recogen en baldes Trabajo que realizan todos los miembros de la familia todos los días, la gente del lugar lava su ropa en el río y muchos se bañan, esa misma agua es recogida más abajo por otros pobladores que la hierven y la toman.. “vivimos en una zona alejada y cuando comenzamos a construir no había agua, la ciudad creció y ahora podemos realizar la conexión de agua potable…” comenta. Su sueño es darle una vida mejor a su familia, ella desea realizar la conexión de agua potable a su cocina, baño y lavandería para que su familia pueda vivir en mejores condiciones. Este es el 2 préstamo con la institución en 3 años que vive en este lugar.
Es por esos motivos que Fortunata solicita un préstamo para la instalación de agua potable, a su cocina, baño y lavandería para darle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida
texts.en:
Fortunata is a 45-year old woman who lives with her husband.  She has two sons, who are 14- and 10-years old respectively, and a 17-year old daughter.   Fortunata's business is raising and selling rabbits, ducks and hens. 
Fortunata is dark-skinned, short, brown-eyed and has long hair that she wears pulled back.  Her first language is Quechua, which she speaks at home.  She speaks Spanish with the general public and in her work.  Fortunata shares her life with her husband, who works, and with her children, who go to school.  
Fortunata and her family live in their own brick house and have electricity.  They do not have potable water or a sewage system.  To get water they go to the river, which is ten minutes away, and collect it in buckets.  All the family members participate in this work every day.  The people who live in the area wash their clothing in the river and many of them bathe there as well.  This same water is collected further down the river by other residents who boil the water and drink it. “We live in a remote area, and when we started building our house there was no water service.  The city grew, and now we can get connected to potable water," Fortunata says.  Her dream is to give her family a better life.  She wants to get potable water connected to her kitchen, bathroom and laundry so that her family can live in better conditions.  This is her second loan with the institution in the three years she has been living there. 
This is why Fortunata is requesting a loan- to install a potable water connection to her kitchen, bathroom and laundry so she can give her family better living conditions.

loans.use: to install a potable water connection in her kitchen, bathroom and laundry so she can give her family better living conditions.

loans.name: Lenie

texts.en:
Lenie is a widowed mother of two children. She is 37 years old and is engaged in both a retailing business and a farming business. In order to cover her children's needs, Lenie patiently manages these sources of income. 

She sells a variety of grocery items in their village. Lenie wants to expand the business in order to increase her income. Because of this, she is asking for a loan of P30,000 to buy soft drinks, canned goods, biscuits, and other commodities.
 
Her only dream is to give a better life to her children and that they will finish their studies. Lenie stands as both mother and, at the same time, as father to her children. It is not easy to make her dream become reality, but she will do her best to make it happen.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, canned goods, biscuits and other commodities.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a business-minded man, who always looks for success. He is married, and has two kids. His wife serves as his partner in managing their auto parts supply business. 

They share ideas with each other on how to improve and expand their business. Richard wants to borrow a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy tires, wheels, chains, and other auto parts to sell. Through this loan, he can expand his business to other towns, as his business branches out. 

He hopes to have greater profits for his children's education, and to lift their standard of living, too.

loans.use: to buy tires, wheels, chains, and other auto parts to sell.

loans.name: Jovy

texts.en:
Jovy is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jovy is 26 years old and has one child who is still in school.

She has a buy and sell frozen foods business in the Philippines. Jovy requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more frozen products to sell, like hot dogs, sausages, etc.

Jovy has been in this business for 1 year. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more frozen products to sell, like hot dogs, sausages, etc.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 50 years old, married, and has three children, one of whom attends school. She works very hard to provide for her family.

For the past year, Josephine has run a general store in the Philippines. She is requesting a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her store, such as shampoo, noodles, canned goods, and spices. She would like to save enough money to provide her family with a secure future.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell such as shampoo, noodles, canned goods, and spices

loans.name: Pazilat

texts.ru: Пазилат, 51 год, замужем, есть 6 детей. У Пазилат среднее образование, имеет очень хорошие отзывы от своих соседей. Они отзываются о ней как о доброй и трудолюбивой женщине. Пазилат в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, на протяжении 20 лет занимается полеводством, животноводством и заготовкой овощей для реализации. В хозяйстве есть земельный надел мерою 4,0 ГА, где она выращивает фасоль для реализации. Экологически чистая, вкусная продукция пользуется большим спросом. Благодаря упорному труду Пазилат, ее деятельность приносит около 15,000 сом (KGS) в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. Также в хозяйстве есть 9 коров, 15 овец. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Пазилат обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 3 лошадей. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса, а также в будущем хочет купить земельный участок, женить детей.
texts.en:
Pazilat is 51 years old, married and has six children. Pazilat has secondary education. She gets very good feedback from her neighbors. They speak of her as a good and hardworking woman. 

As a main source of income for her family, Pazilat has worked with field crop cultivation, livestock breeding and harvesting vegetables for selling for a period of 20 years. She has a plot of land of 4.0 hectares on her farm, where she grows haricots for selling. Such ecological and tasty products are in high demand. 

Thanks to Pazilat's persistent work, her business brings in around 15,000 som (KGS) per month, which is the foundation for covering the family's food and household expenses. She also has 9 cows and 15 sheep on her farm.

With an aim to further develop her business, Pazilat turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) to purchase three horses. She plans to invest the income from the loan in further improving her business. She would also like purchase more land and marry away her children in the future.

loans.use: to purchase three horses in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Nasira

texts.ru: Насира, 47 лет, замужем, есть 4 детей. У Насиры среднее образование, имеет очень хорошие отзывы от своих соседей. Они отзываются о ней как о ответственной и трудолюбивой женщине. Насира в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, на протяжении 20 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. В хозяйстве есть земельный надел мерою 2,5 ГА, где она выращивает клевер и фасоль для реализации. Экологически чистая, вкусная продукция пользуется большим спросом. Благодаря упорному труду Насиры, у нее в хозяйстве есть 3 дойные коровы, 32 овцы, 2 теленка, 2 лошади.  В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Насира обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 лошадей. Доходы от кредита Насира планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса, а также в будущем хочет дать своим детям достойное образование.
texts.en:
Nasira is 47 years old, married and has four children. Nasira has secondary education and gets very good feedback from her neighbors. They speak about her as a responsible and hardworking woman. 

As a main source of income for her family, Nasira has worked with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation for a period of 20 years. She has a plot of land of 2.5 hectares on her farm, where she grows clover and haricots for selling. These ecological and tasty products are in high demand. Thanks to Nasira's persistent work, she has three dairy cows, 32 sheep, two calves and two horses on her farm.

With an aim to further develop her business, Nasira turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) to purchase two horses. Nasira plans to invest the income from her loan in further developing her business. She also would like to give her children a decent education in the future.

loans.use: to purchase two horses in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 23 years old and single with one child. Judith works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, like shampoo, canned goods, noodles, sugar, breads, etc.

Judith has been in this business for 2 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, like shampoo, canned goods, noodles, sugar, breads, etc.

loans.name: Buaisha

texts.ru: Буайша, 45 лет, замужем, есть 3 детей. У Буайши среднее образование, работает официантом, также более 20 лет занимается животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду и целеустремленности Буайши, на сегодняшний день у нее имеется 2 коровы, 20 овец.   Ежемесячный доход составляет до 25,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Буайша обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) для покупки скота с целью дальнейшего разведения и реализации. Буайша намерена и дальше развить свой бизнес, что непременно приведет к увеличению капитала семьи.
texts.en:
Buaisha is 45 years old, married and has three children. Buaisha has secondary education. She works as a waiter. She has also worked with livestock breeding for more than 20 years. 

Thanks to Buaisha's persistent work and purposefulness, she currently has two cows and twenty sheep on her farm. The monthly income is up to 25,000 som (KGS).

With an aim to further develop her business, Buaisha turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 70,000 som (KGS) to purchase livestock for breeding and reselling. Buaisha intends to further develop her business, which will certainly lead to an increase in the family's capital.

loans.use: to purchase livestock for fattening up and reselling

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
Mom’s Group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Mom makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family.

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Lorina

texts.en:
Lorina is a widowed woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lorina is 53 years old and has two children who are still in school.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business, like meat, fish, spices, flour, etc.

Lorina has been in this business for 16 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business, like meat, fish, spices, flour, etc.

loans.name: Mean's Group

texts.en:
Mean’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Mean makes a living cultivating rice, and he also does extra work as a tailor to support his family.

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Grupo Suqun Group

texts.es:
Sebastiana es una madre de familia de 26 años, vive en una comunidad de Chichicastenango, tiene una linda familia de 3 hijos de las edades entre 1 y 3 años los tres se encuentran bajo su cuidado de su mamá.
Sebastiana es una mujer muy trabajadora y perseverante que a pesar de vivir en una comunidad  muy lejana de su pueblo, para ella eso no es ningún impedimento para no luchar y hacer que sus hijos tengan lo necesario, para generar sus ingresos Sebastiana se dedica al tejido de blusas típicas de su región esta actividad lo realiza desde hace diez años, lo aprendió gracias a las enseñanzas de su madre, Para Sebastiana la seguridad de su familia es lo más importante es por eso que se preocupa por ellos, y se ha dado cuenta que su casa con el paso de los años se ha  ido  deteriorando y para poder realizar las remodelaciones necesarias se necesita de una buena cantidad de dinero, pero Sebastiana no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para poder remodelar su casa, por tal motivo se ha unido a un grupo de señoras para solicitar  un prestamo que lo utilizara para comprar cemento, block, arena.
El gran anhelo de Sebastiana es seguir realizando mejoras en su casa y que sus hijos tengan una casa propia.
texts.en:
Sebastiana is a 26 year-old mother. She lives in a community of Chichicastenango. She has a lovely family of three children ranging in ages from 1 to 3 years old. The three children are under her mother’s care.

Sebastiana is a determined and hard-working woman who in spite of living in a community very far from her own, does not have any objection to  struggling to ensure that her children have what they need. To earn her income, Sebastiana creates woven textile blouses typical of her region. She has been doing this for ten years. She learned how to do it thanks to her mother’s teaching. 

Her family's safety is the most important thing for Sebastiana, and that is why she worries about them. She has become aware that the condition of her house has deteriorated over the years. To make the necessary repairs she needs a good amount of money, but Sebastiana doesn’t have enough money to remodel her house. This is the reason that she has joined a group of ladies to seek a loan which she will use to purchase cement, cement blocks and sand. 

Sebastiana’s great wish is to keep making improvements to her home, and that her children have their own home.

loans.use: to buy cement, cement block and sand to remodel her house.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 40 years old, and she is married with 5 children.

She earns a living raising pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Lorna has been running her business for 5 years now, and she also earns additional income from selling baked goods.

Lorna is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Aurora Mabel

texts.es: Aurora,  tiene 21 años de edad quien curso su primaria con mucho éxito y sus padres viendo el interés de estudio de ella por ser diversificada en una carrera de provecho se esforzaron y sacrificaron para que ella pudiese terminar la secundaria. Aurora es una joven emprendedora la cual se interesó por un mayor conocimiento la cual cuenta con capacitaciones impartidas por una prestigiosa empresa a nivel nacional e internacional en la preparación de cultivos a escala. Ella es soltera y vive con sus padres. Ella aprendió a trabajar la tierra a temprana edad con su padre y gracias a las diferentes capacitaciones ella ha mejorado su conocimiento. Ella solicita crédito para poder comprar semilla de maíz, semilla de frijol, abono 12-24.12, urea, entre otros productos aprovechando el pago de mano de obra para poder hacer un trabajo más eficiente y eficaz para su negocio. Sus planes seguir trabajando con este tipo de cultivo y proponiendo un nuevo proyecto para su vida y es diversificación en cuanto a la siembra y cultivo de sandía ya que en el lugar donde reside es apta la tierra y el clima para este tipo de cultivo.
texts.en:
Aurora, 21, was successful in primary school. Her parents, seeing that her interest in study could be turned into a career advantage, strove and sacrificed so that she could finish high school.

Aurora is a young entrepreneur that is interested in more knowledge. She has training,  given by a company that is prestigious at the national and international level, in producing crops to scale.

She is single and lives with her parents. She learned to work the land at an early age, with her father, and thanks to the different training, she has improved her knowledge.

She requests a loan to buy corn seed, bean seed, fertilizer 12-24.12, urea, among other products, leveraging the cost of labor, by making the work more efficient and effective for her business. Her plans are to continue working with this type of cultivation, and proposing a new project, for her life, of diversification, in terms of planting and cultivation of watermelon. Aurora wants to diversify, because in her place of residence, the land and climate are suitable for this crop.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies: cost of labor and seeds of corn and beans.

loans.name: Yhoana Alexandra

texts.es: Yhona es una mujer muy sonriente, ella junto a dos familiares (ver foto) tienen un negocio de venta de guarapo una bebidas extraída de la caña de azúcar y realizada con una maquina llamada máquina de trapiche, de momento Yhona tiene dicha maquina descompuesta y necesita una reparación urgente pero no cuenta con el capital por ello solicita un préstamo para repárala pues de esta depende tres familias.
texts.en:
Yhoana is a woman who always has a smile on her face. She and two of her relatives (who also appear in the photo) have a business of selling sugar cane juice. They make their product with the use of an extractor.

Yhoana says that the current machine is broken and in need of immediate repair, but she does not have the capital. Therefore, she is requesting a loan so that she can repair it since three families are dependent on this business.

loans.use: to repair an extracting machine used for making sugar cane juice.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre muy entusiasta y optimista que vive en una comunidad de Sololá, es casado tiene ocho hijos de las edades entre 2 y 22 años de edad y algunos de ellos ya lo ayudan con los ingresos de la familia.
Para juan el que su familia cuente con lo necesario es lo más importante  es por ello que para generar sus ingresos él es jornalero realiza todo tipo de trabajo con sus vecinos, él es un hombre bastante responsable y honrado  es por eso que a pesar de no contar con un trabajo fijo, con la responsabilidad con la que hace su trabajo lo ha mantenido a que mucha gente necesite de sus servicios, pero juan con lo que gana día con día no ha logrado realizar la remodelación de su casa que es su gran sueño, pero el junto a su familia se han puesto de acuerdo para solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizaran para comprar cemento, cal y hierro y estaría pagando el préstamo con la ayuda de su esposa y sus hijos
Para juan el brindarle a su familia un mejor lugar donde puedan vivir es lo más importante, es por eso que tiene las esperanzas de poder conseguir este préstamo.
texts.en:
Juan is a very enthusiastic and optimistic man, that lives in a community of Sololá. He is married, and has eight children, between the ages of 2 and 22. Some of them are already helping him with the family income.

For Juan, that his family has what it needs is the most important thing. That is why he makes his living as a laborer, and does all types of work with his neighbours. He is a very responsible and honest man. That is why, despite not having a permanent job, with the attention he gives his work, he has kept a lot of people needing his services. 

However, with what Juan earns every day, he has not managed to remodel his house, which is his big dream. He and his family have agreed to borrow the money to buy cement, lime, and iron. He will be paying off the loan with the help of his wife and children.

For Juan, to give his family a better place to live is the most important. That is why he has the hope of getting this loan.

loans.use: to buy cement, lime, and iron for the remodel of his house.

loans.name: Luz Edilma

texts.es: Luz Edilma es una confeccionista de 42 años de edad, se encarga de confeccionar bermudas y uniformes, en su negocio cuenta con la ayuda de dos empleados, ella es feliz realizando su actividad, se proyecta para este año finalizar con taller de confección mínimo con 5 empleados internos, ella quiere comprar una maquina fileteadora pero al estar en principio de mes y con las responsabilidades en su hogar, su hija, el pago de sus empleados no puede realizar un gasto tan grande por ello solicita un préstamo para comprar esta máquina que la tiene muy motivada, debido a que puede generar un empleo más y estar cerca de su meta de 5 empleados al finalizar este año. Su mayor sueño es ser reconocida como una competidora fuerte en la ciudad de Medellín.
texts.en:
Luz Edilma is a seamstress who is 42 years of age. She manufactures Bermuda shorts and uniforms. Her business has the help of two employees and she happily manages her business. By the end of the year, she expects her workshop to have a minimum of five employees.

Luz Edilma wants to buy an overlock sewing machine, but with this being the first of the month and having to cover household responsibilities, her daughter’s expenses, and payment of her employee salaries, she is not able to afford such a large expense. For this reason, she is requesting a loan in order to buy this machine. She is very excited about being able to create another job and getting closer to her goal of having five employees by the end of this year.

Her greatest wish is to become well-known as a strong competitor in the city of Medellín.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos es un joven de 25 años de edad es soltero, vive junto a sus padres en una comunidad de Chichicastenango.
Juan Carlos es un muchacho solidario y responsable, el a pesar de ser joven se preocupa por su familia, Juan Carlos  para generar sus ingresos se dedica a la albañilería desde hace 4 años construyendo casas, muros y todo lo relacionado con la construcción,  para él lo más importante es la comodidad  de su familia es por eso que se ha dado cuenta  que la necesidad más prioritaria es la remodelación de su casa pues ya se encuentra en mal estado, pero una de las limitaciones de Juan Carlos es que no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para poder  remodelar su casa, pero el a tomado la decisión de realizar un préstamo que lo utilizara para comprar cemento, block, cal y arena.
El gran sueño de Juan Carlos es poder conseguir el prestamo lo más pronto posible para ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y también poder comprar un vehículo para sacar a pasear a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is a young 25 year old man, is single, and lives with his parents in the community of Chichicastenango.

Juan Carlos is a caring and responsible man, and despite being young he cares about his family. Juan Carlos has made a living in masonry for 4 years constructing houses to generate an income, including walls and everything related to construction. For him the most important thing is the comfort of his family, it is for this that he has realized that his priority is remodeling his house that is already in poor condition. But one of the limitations of Juan Carlos is that he lacks the sufficient money to remodel his house, but he has made the decision to ask for a loan that he will use to buy cement, block, lime and sand.

Juan Carlos' great dream is to be able to continue the loan as soon as possible to offer his family a better quality of life and also be able to buy a vehicle to take his family.

loans.use: to buy cement, block, lime and sand to remodel his house.

loans.name: Jose Segundo

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 45 años está casado la esposa tiene 46 años tiene 2 hijos con los cuales vive en la comunidad de Pivarince de la Parroquia de Eugenio Espejo de Otavalo tiene casa propia por el sector donde ellos viven son artesanos la mayoría de personas se dedican a elaborar y al comercio de las mismas, son personas indígenas que alrededor de sus vidas han venido dedicándose en estas actividades de las artesanías y del turismo.
Segundo tiene un local de alquiler de internet, papelería y bazar esta actividad viene realizando varios años en el sector donde el vive, con el negocio ha crecido bastante y así mismo brinda todo lo mejor para sus hijos que nada les falte y que sigan estudiando y que sean personas de bien en el futuro, habido obstáculos que él ha podido enfrentar para estar día a día en este negocio.
El crédito que solicito en Fundación Alternativa lo va invertir en la compra materiales de construcción va realizar paredes de seguridad tanto para el negocio y el domicilio por que en el sector donde vive últimamente esta habiendo delincuencia y quiere prevenir para no ser afectado.
texts.en:
Segundo is 45 years old. He is married and his wife is 46 years of age. They have two children and reside in the community of Pivarince in the parish of Eugenio Espejo de Otavalo. Segundo and his family own a house in the area where they live. Most of the people in this area make and sell handicrafts. The indigenous people in the surrounding areas have spent their lives in the handicraft and tourism trades.

Segundo has a shop where he has an Internet café, a stationery store, and a bazaar. He has been in business for several years in the area where he lives. His business has grown significantly and it has allowed him to provide the best for his children so that they lack nothing. They are able to continue their studies so that they can become successful people in the future. Segundo has had to face obstacles each day in this business.

The loan he is requesting from Fundación Alternativa will be invested in the purchase of construction materials for putting up security walls around his business and home. The area where he lives has experienced crime lately, so he wants to take steps to prevent from being affected.

loans.use: to buy construction materials in order to build security walls around his business and home.

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es: Rosa tiene 33 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo de 8 años de edad. Rosa es pequeña comerciante y se dedica a la venta de ricos tamales de elote, atol de elotes y elotes asados. De esta forma se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones de vida solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción del techo del corredor de su vivienda. Con el monto solicitado comprará lámina galvanizada,  madera y polines. Espera poder contar con dicho financiamiento y de esta forma dar inicio a la mejora lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Rosa is 33 years old and resides in her own home along with her life companion and their eight-year-old son. She is a small-scale merchant who sells delicious corn tamales, warm corn porridge, and roasted corn. Earning her living in this manner allows her to sustain her household.

Rosa wants to improve her living conditions, so she is requesting a loan from FUSAI in order to invest in the construction of a roof over the corridor of her home. The amount she requested will be used to buy galvanized sheets, wood, and beams. She hopes to receive this loan so that she can begin making this improvement as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheets, wood, and beams in order to build a roof over the corridor of her house.

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es:
Lorenzo es un hombre trabajador tiene 54 años de edad, es casado cuenta con una linda familia de siete hijos de las edades de entre 10 y 27 años de edad, viven en una comunidad de Sololá.
Lorenzo es un padre de familia que se dedica a con amor y empeño a su trabajo porque ama el campo y le gusta compartir con la naturaleza,  es por eso que se dedica a la agricultura sembrando una diversidad de verduras, desde hace 30 años para generar sus ingresos y mantener a su familia, pero él desde hace algún tiempo ha visto una de las necesidades más prioritarias que es la de terminar de construir su casa pero una de las limitaciones que Lorenzo tiene es que no  cuenta con el dinero suficiente para terminar de construir su casa, pero él ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un préstamo de Q 1,000.00 para comprar cemento y hierro. El gran sueño de Lorenzo es poder seguir realizando mejoras en su casa.
texts.en:
Lorenzo is a hardworking man, 54 years old, married, with a beautiful family of seven children between the ages of 10 and 27 years old. They live in a community of Sololá.

Lorenzo is a father who is engaged with love and commitment to his work, because he loves the countryside, and enjoys communing with nature. It is for this that he has made his living in farming, sowing a variety of vegetables. 

For the last 30 years, he has made his income, and supported his family. However, he has, for some time, seen that the highest priority necessity is the completion of construction of his house. One of Lorenzo's limitations is that he does not have enough money to finish constructing his house. He has decided to apply for a loan of Q 1,000.00 to buy cement and iron. Lorenzo's big dream is to be able to continue making improvements on his house.

loans.use: to buy cement and iron for the completion of the construction of his house.

loans.name: Ma. Jenny

texts.en:
Ma. Jenny is 45 years old and has three children. She is married and has two children who are still in school.

Ma. Jenny is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy sacks of feed and vitamins for her livestock.

Ma. Jenny has been in this business for seven years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of feed and vitamins for her livestock.

loans.name: Lordesita

texts.en:
Lordesita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a motorcycle transportation business in the Philippines.

Lordesita requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts, gasoline oil and maintenance for her motorcycle.

Lordesita has been in this business for three years now, and also earns additional income from fish vending.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts, gasoline oil and maintenance for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 46 years old and has four children.  She is married and two of her children are still in school. Marites is in the agricultural business  in the Philippines. Marites requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Marites has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Maria Dominga

texts.es:
María Dominga, es un mujer muy entusiasta, ella vive en Sololá junto a su esposo y a sus cinco hijos de las edades entre 1 y 9 años de edad y todos están  bajo la responsabilidad de sus padres  María Dominga tiene 26 años de edad. 

María Dominga es una señora muy trabajadora y muy dedicada a su familia, pues ella desde hace ya varios años se dedica a la venta de una diversidad de plantillas tales  como de aguacates durazno y entre otros, y junto a esto ella  vende verduras en una plaza de su comunidad, con  la poca  ganancia que ella tiene, ayuda a su esposo en sufragar los gastos de su hogar,  paralelo  a la venta  María Dominga también se  dedica a  la agricultura, la meta de María Dominga es conseguir un préstamo para comprar sus semillas y fertilizantes  para ampliar su cultivo y así poder generar más ingresos, para ayudar a sus hijos a seguir estudiando, hasta llegar hacer unos profesionales, ella no solo piensa en sus hijos, si no también tiene otra meta es seguir trabajando duro, para que más adelante, pueda apoyar a su esposo para comprar más terrenos y aumentar el cultivo.

María Dominga está muy segura que conseguirá el préstamo y con las ganancias que genera la agricultura pagara su préstamo.
texts.en:
Maria Dominga is a very enthusiastic woman. She lives in Sololá with her husband and their five children, aged between one and nine, who are in their parents’ care. Maria Dominga is 26 years old.

Maria Dominga is a very hard-working lady and she is very dedicated to her family. For several years she has made a living by selling a variety of small plants, such as avocado pear trees and peach trees, and she also sells vegetables at a plaza in her community. With the few profits she makes, she helps her husband to pay for the household expenses. In addition to selling plants and vegetables, Maria Dominga also works in agriculture. Her goal is to obtain a loan for buying seeds and fertilisers in order to expand her crops and generate more revenue so she can help her children to continue studying until they get a degree. She is not only thinking of her children; her other goal is to keep working hard so that, further down the track, she can help her husband to buy more land and increase their crops.

Maria Dominga is very sure that she will get the loan and that the profits from her agricultural work will pay off the loan.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilisers in order to expand her crops

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en: Marjorie is 56 years old and married with twelve children. With one child still in school, Marjorie works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, noodles, sugar, breads, etc.  Marjorie has been in this business for four years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, noodles, sugar, breads, etc.

loans.name: La Langosta Group

texts.es:
La Asociación Comunal La Langosta, está integrado por 11 mujeres (ANDREA, ELONA, EMELDA MARITZA, EVESTINA, ISABEL, LIDY LEONIDA, LUZ MARINA, MARGUESA, MARIA ELENA, MARITZA y MARLENE LOURDES), todas viven en la comunidad de Tuapi, es una pequeña comunidad indígena miskito que posee diversos atractivos naturales y una riqueza cultural local. Tuapí está rodeado de agua. Un poco antes de llegar a la comunidad se puede observar el río que lleva el mismo nombre y es utilizado por los pobladores para realizar pesca artesanal en botes tradicionales conocidos como “cayucos”.

Maritza: Es la coordinadora de la Asociación Comunal, es una mujer miskita, con cualidades de líder, emprendedora que lucha día a día para obtener un ingreso diario y poder llevar el sustento  al hogar, a través de la venta de mariscos, pescados, camarones y langostas, que son característicos de encontrar en la comunidad de Tuapi, porque está rodeada de densos mangles. Está casada, tiene  tres hijos: Dos adolescentes que estudian primaria y una pequeña de 5 años de edad. Desde hace tres años se dedica a la venta de mariscos, de esta manera apoya con los gastos del hogar y en los estudios de sus hijos. Está solicitando financiamiento para mejorar el cayuco de su esposo que se dedica a la pesca artesanal y ella a la comercialización. Ella y su esposo sueñan con establecer una pulpería en la comunidad.
texts.en:
The communal bank “La Langosta” consists of 11 women (Andrea, Elona, Emelda Maritza, Evestina, Isabel, Lidy Leonida, Luz Marina, Marguesa, Maria Elena, Maritza, and Marlene Lourdes). They all live in the community of Tuapi, which is a small indigenous Miskito community with various natural attractions and a rich local culture. Tuapi is surrounded by water. A short distance before arriving in the community, you can see the river of the same name, which is used by the people for artisanal fishing in traditional boats known as “cayucos”.

Maritza is the coordinator of the communal bank. She is a Miskito woman with the qualities of a leader. She is an entrepreneur. She fights day after day to earn a living and support her household by selling shellfish, fish, shrimps, and crayfish, which are commonly found in Tuapi as it is surrounded by dense mangroves. She is married and has three children: two adolescents, who are in primary school, and a five-year-old girl. She has been selling shellfish for three years. By doing this she helps with the household expenses and with her children’s education. She is requesting a loan in order to improve her husband’s canoe, as her husband does the fishing and she sells his catch. She and her husband dream of setting up a grocery store in the community.

loans.use: to make improvements to her husband's canoe so he can fish and she can sell his catch

loans.name: Nymfa

texts.en:
Nymfa has been engaged in the rental housing business for years, and she earns well from this. She is from Pasay City, 52 years of age, and is married to Roberto. Having a bigger responsibility requires more effort to provide for their needs. Nymfa and her husband are working hard with the determination of having more income than they currently have.

To improve her profit and to pay for the maintenance of the boarding house, Nymfa would like to ask for loan assistance. An amount of PHP 15,000 could help her in the renovation and beautification of their place, so that her regular boarders will choose to stay there for a longer period of time. She will also use a portion of the loan to buy supplies like feed, fertilizer and other items needed for her buy-and-sell business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance, in advance.

In the future, Nymfa hopes that her business will thrive more. She also desires to start up other business, for their additional income.

Nymfa meets with her co-fellowship* members every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of their house rental and also to purchase fertilizer, feed and other supplies she needs in her buy-and-sell business.

loans.name: María Imelda

texts.es:
María  es una mujer con la mente muy positiva y lo que busca cada día es progreso para su familia, ella tiene 37 años y vive en una comunidad muy bonita. 

María es una señora muy optimista, busca los medios como generar ingresos económicos para ajustar los gastos en su hogar, para que su familia tenga lo necesario, ella se dedica a la elaboración de ropa típica, esta actividad lo tiene desde hace 5 años, la ventaja de María  es de que desde su casa  puede realizar otros oficios de su casa y cuidar a sus hijos  es por eso que cuenta también con una venta de refacciones en su casa que le genera otro ingreso.

María con el empeño que le pone a su labor ha logrado que las personas se sientan satisfecho de sus productos que elabora y prepara así ha logrado  generar sus ganancias, pero con las ganancias que genera  no es  suficiente para la meta  y el sueño  de María, que es el de poder hacer que su casa se vea mejor. Ella para satisfacer sus necesidades, busca otras opciones de como adquirirlo, Ella ahora necesita un préstamo para remodelar y poder comprar block, cemento, y cal, para que su familia tenga una mejor casa donde pueda vivir, El sueño más grande de María es que en un futuro, pueda tener un local en la plaza de Chichicastenango donde pueda vender sus ropas típicas.
texts.en:
María is a woman with a positive mind and what she searches for every day is progress for her family. She is 37 years old and lives in a very beautiful community.

María is a very optimistic woman. She searches for means to create economic income to meet her household expenses so that her family has what it needs. She works making traditional clothing and has had this business for five years. María’s advantage is that she can carry out other professions from her house and take care of her children. That is why she also sells snacks from her home, which gives her another income.

María, with the determination that she puts into her work, has made it so people feel satisfied with the products that she makes and prepares, and in that way she has been able to generate her earnings. However, the earnings that she generates are not enough for María’s goal and dream, which is to be able to improve her house. In order to satisfy her needs, she is searching for other options to acquire it. She needs a loan now to buy block, cement, and lime so that her family can have a better house to live in. María’s biggest dream is to have a store in the Chichicastenango plaza where she can sell her traditional clothing.

loans.use: to buy cement, block, and lime to remodel her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: This loan will be used to buy and build a bathroom, septic tank, and a toilet at their home to improve her family's access to water and sanitation.

loans.name: Margilina

texts.en:
Margilina is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 36 years old and has four children who are currently in school.

Margilina has a motorcycle transportation business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts and maintenance for her motorcycle.

Margilina has been in this business for five years and earns additional income from fishing. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and maintenance for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase medicines and special examinations.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 34 years old and married with five children. With four of her children still in school, Mercy works very hard to provide for them.

Mercy runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell such as shampoo, canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, etc.

Mercy has been in this business for three years.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell such as shampoo, canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Margeline

texts.en:
Margeline is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 45 years old and has four children who are still in school.

Margeline has a business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Margeline has been in this business for four years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 50 years old and has three children who are still in school.

Maria has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fish net, bamboo and maintenance for her boat.

Maria has been in this business for 23 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish net, bamboo and maintenance for her boat

loans.name: Nora

texts.en: Nora is 42 years old, married and gets income through her vegetable vending business. She uses her income for education purposes. She wanted to sell more vegetables and get more profits so she needs to increase her sales too. She is asking for help from all lenders to lend her a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy eggplant, beans and cabbages to sell. It will help increase sales capacity. Someday, she hopes to achieve income stability and continue giving good education to her children.

loans.use: to buy eggplant, beans and cabbages to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is 30 years old, married and has two children. She is selling vegetables to the people in her village. She wants to keep selling vegetables so she is asking for additional capital of PHP 5,000 to buy more vegetables (cabbages, tomatoes and eggplant) to sell. She wants to improve her sales and offer additional goods for added profits.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Ketty Mariselda

texts.es:
En la ciudadela nueva california de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito Los Jardines. 
En este lugar vive la señora Ketty, tiene 62 años de edad,  está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun viven con ella. El esposo es abogado.
Doña Ketty es una mujer que le gusta  trabajar para tener para sus gastos, ella es artesana y elabora todo tipo de manualidades con motivos navideños, carameleras, apliques, piñatas y muchas otras manualidades para cualquier compromiso social, ella realiza sus trabajos para entregar bajo pedido, son muchos los clientes que le piden sus trabajos los mismos que son de muy buena calidad, razón por lo cual sus clientes la prefieren. Tienen más de 5 años con esta actividad la cual le encanta y se entretiene a la vez.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar materiales para manualidades. Lleva 4 ciclos  en el Grupo Crédito y le gusta porque los  créditos les ayudan mucho. Sus metas son seguir adelante en su actividad la cual le encanta.
texts.en:
Every fifteen days, the partners from the communal bank “Los Jardines” meet in the new California citadel in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of the Manabi province, known for many years as the city of the “reales tamarindos.”

Ketty lives here.  She is 62 years old, married, and from this relationship has four older children, two of whom live with her.  Her husband is a lawyer.  Ketty is a woman who likes to work in order to have money to cover her expenses.  She is an artisan and makes all kinds of crafts such as those Christmas-themed, candy dishes, patches, piñatas, and many others for any social engagement.  She makes a lot of her crafts to order; there are many clients who prefer her and who ask for her work because it is of very high quality.  She has been carrying out this profession for over five years, which both she loves and keeps her occupied at the same time.

She is going to use this loan to purchase craft materials.  She has been with this communal bank for four cycles, and she likes it because the loans help them a lot.  Her goal is to move forward with this profession that she loves.

loans.use: to purchase craft materials

loans.name: Menardo

texts.en:
Menardo owns and runs his small retail store. He has been in this kind of business for one year. With his aim to have a better income, he is asking for a loan of PHP 6,000 to allow him to buy grocery items to sell. He knows that having this amount will enable him to achieve his goals and improve his business involvement.

Menardo is hoping to obtain the amount of loan he requested. In this way, he could improve his living condition and make his retail business profitable.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 60 years old and married with eight children. With three children in school, Alicia works very hard to provide for them.

Alicia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, canned goods, eggs, groceries, etc.

Alicia has been in this business for three years now. 

In the future, Alicia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, canned goods, eggs, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel works hard to support her family. She is single and has a dried fish making business in the Philippines.

Maricel requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish, salt and other materials to use for her business.

Maricel has been in this business for one year now, and also earns additional income from fish vending.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish, salt and other materials to use for her business.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Marieta works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Marieta is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business like fish, meat, spices, etc.

Marieta has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business like fish, meat, spices, etc

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 32 years old and married with two children. With two children are still in school, Marissa works very hard to provide for them.

Marissa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell like shampoo, breads, soft drinks, noodles, sugar, coffee, etc. Marissa has been in this business for three years.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like shampoo, breads, soft drinks, noodles, sugar, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Myrna is 60 years old now.

Myrna has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. Myrna requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fruits to sell like mango, etc.

Myrna has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Myrna would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fruits to sell like mango, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover school expenses (uniforms, school supplies, and tuition)

loans.name: Dexy Monserrate

texts.es:
En la ciudadela nueva california de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito Los Jardines. 
En este lugar vive la señora Dexi, tiene 28 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos de 8 y 4  años ke estudian  en  escuela. Ella vive en casa de una hermana. 
Doña Dexi con la intención de ganarse algo por su cuenta y con esto salir adelante se dedica al comercio, ella tiene un local en el centro de la ciudad en el cual venden  ropa de todo tipo y variedad de telas. Trabaja todos los  días de la semana desde las 08h0 hasta las 16h00, su hermana le ayuda en su negocio, ya son más de 12 años que lleva en esta actividad con la cual se gana el sustento diario para ella y sus hijos. 
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ropa de todo tipo y telas. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace  2 años y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus pequeños.
texts.en:
Every fifteen days, the partners from the communal bank “Los Jardines” meet in the new California citadel in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of the Manabi province, known for many years as the city of the “reales tamarindos.” 
 
Dexy lives here, a 28-year-old single mother of two children, who are 8 and 4 and attend school.  She lives in her sister’s house.  With the intention of earning something on her own and with this, move forward, Dexy makes a living in commerce.  She has a shop downtown, where she sells all kinds of clothing and a variety of fabrics.  She works every day of the week from 8:00 am to 4:00 pm.  Her sister helps her with her business.  She now has 12 years of experience in this profession, with which she supports herself and her children every day.

She is going to use this loan to purchase all kinds of clothes and fabric.  She has been in the communal bank for two years and likes it because of the help that the loans give her.  Her dream is to provide the best for her children.

loans.use: to purchase all kinds of clothes and fabric

loans.name: Somaly

texts.en:
Somaly, 42, lives in a community in Banteay Meanchey province, Cambodia. She is a lovely mother of 3 children. To earn a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farm located near her house. So far she has been in this business for 15 years. On average, she is able to earn of 2.50 USD per day.

Because her house currently does not have a latrine, Somaly wishes to improve the general living conditions of her entire family by building one. Therefore, she is requesting a loan from Kiva and Hattha Kaksekar Limited to build the latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help lessen environmental deterioration. 

Somaly is thankful for the loan granted through HKL, which has a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Mailenda

texts.en:
Mailenda is a 36 year-old married woman with four children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Mailenda has a food vending business in the Philippines. Mailenda requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Mailenda has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Mailenda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business

loans.name: Eneng

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of new Ruma agents, Eneng. Eneng lives in West Bandung, a suburban area located about 3 hour’s drive from Jakarta, the capital city. She lives there with her husband and her son. Eneng owns a small stall where she daily sells consumer products and provides mobile payment services for her community. Eneng is a hardworking woman and her customers see her as a trusted mobile provider.

Eneng joined Ruma two months ago. She knew Ruma from Ruma’s sales executive who came to her stall and she decided to join Ruma because she wants to learn how to expand her business. With support from Ruma’s staff, Eneng sees some improvements in her business. As the business grows, Eneng is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide enhanced mobile payment services to her community, especially on weekends. Knowing the importance of the loan to her, your loan will be very useful to help Eneng improves her business and accordingly, her community who needs access to such services.
